loans.name: Khanoglan

texts.en: Khanoglan is married and has 4 children. He is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from Fuzuli town, but now he settled in Fuzuli region with his wife and children. He has been raising farm animals for the last 10 years. Khanoglan now needs a loan of 1,500 Azerbaijani New Manat in order to increase the number of animals he has for sale.

loans.use: to buy calves

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim is from Iraq. He is 43 years old, married and has four children. He is the only provider for the family.

Ibrahim owns a small grocery store selling soft drinks, juices, detergents and snacks. He established his business in 2009, and now he has one employee. He has good experience in this field and a good reputation in his local community.

He is requesting a $3,000 loan to pay the annual rent for the shop and to increase his inventory. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his family with better living conditions.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent for the shop and to increase his inventory.

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon is a 48-year-old businessman. He is married to Ann, who is a farmer, and they are blessed with seven children. He has been in a welding business for the past 28 years with a monthly income of 20,000 Kenyan shillings (KES), which he uses to support his family. 

He is applying for his second loan with KADET after repaying the previous loan successfully. Simon will use the loan to buy old metals for his business. With the anticipated profit from the business, he will educate his children. 

He hopes to own a garage and improve the family's living standards.

loans.use: To buy old metals for his welding business.

loans.name: Tuichibek

texts.ru: У него трудное условия жизни и низкий доход, но доброе сердце и хороший нрав. Он -Туйчибек из Таджикистана, которому 31 лет, женат и на воспитании имеет 4 детей. Более  4 лет он занимается выращиванием сельхоз культуры, как картофель, пшеница, морковь и т.п. Полученный доход он продает на рынке. Так как у него высококачественный урожай, так и его товары имеют большой спрос. Его жена помогает ему в ведении бизнеса. С целью обеспечения семьи со всеми необходимыми средствами он хочет развевать свой бизнес, а для этого он должен получить больше урожая. Он запрашивает кредит на сумму 6500  сомони, чтобы купить минеральные удобрения и семена. Доход, который он будет получать от бизнеса, будет использовать для образования своих детей и улучшения условия жизни. Он нуждается и ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
He has a difficult life and low income, but a good heart and kind character. He is Tuichibek from Tajikistan - a 31-year-old man who is married and raising 4 children. For over 4 years, Tuichibek has been cultivating crops such as potatoes, wheat, carrots etc. and selling his harvest at the market. His high-quality produce is in high demand. Tuichibek's wife helps her husband with his business.

In order to provide his family with all necessities of life, Tuichibek wants to develop his business, and for that he needs bigger harvests. He is requesting a loan of 6500 somoni to purchase mineral fertilizers and seeds. Tuichibek will use his business profits to pay for his children's education and improve his family's living conditions. He needs and awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Serah

texts.en:
Serah is now 30 years old and married to George, who is also a farmer, and they help each other in the farming business. They are blessed with three children. She has been in this business for four years, earning a monthly income of 12,000 Kenya shillings.

This will be her first loan with KADET Ltd., and she will use the loan to buy farm inputs including seeds and fertilizers. She will use the anticipated profit to buy more acres of land for farming and to educate her children.

loans.use: To buy farm inputs like fertilizers and seedlings.

loans.name: Makarimal Akhlakh Groupe 7

texts.fr:
Le groupement d’intérêt  économique  dénommé GIE MAKARIMAL AKHLAH est né le 10 octobre 2003 au Sénégal. Le terme   Makarimal Akhlakh symbolise une personne qui a un bon cœur,  de bonnes pratiques. Le GIE  a atteint le nombre de 300 adhérents depuis  2009. Son objectif est d’unir ses membres et de leur permettre d’exercer des activités de production agricole et halieutique, de commerce général d’import export et de transport, d’industrie, d’artisanat, de bâtiments , d’élevage, d’exploitation minière, de pêche, d’exploitation d’hydrocarbures, d’art  et de culture, d’imprimerie et de menuiserie bois, de services et d’action d’utilité publique, de représentation, de transformation de produits halieutiques, d’agriculture , de vente de pièces détachées, de fabrique de glace , de boulangerie et de prestations de services divers. Le GIE vise aussi a consolider des liens d’amitié et de solidarité entre ses membres pour leur permettre d’acquérir des moyens matériels et financiers nécessaires au développement de leurs activités génératrices de revenus et de bénéficier de tous les avantages liés au GIE. Et c’est dans cette mouvance qu’un protocole d’accord a été signé entre le GIE et UIMCEC  au bénéfice  des membres du GIE au niveau national. La première phase  a porté sur  un échantillon de 120 membres actifs divisés en 12 groupes de 10. 
Makarimal  Akhlakh groupe 7 est composé de 10 personnes   membres du GIE exerçant  la meme activité. Ils sont représentés par monsieur Abdoulaye  qui pratique la vente de fruits depuis plusieurs années. Sa journée de travail démarre chaque jour à  heures  le  matin et se termine a 00 heures la nuit. Il est membre d’un guichet de l’UIMCEC et sollicite un crédit prévu pour l’achat de fruits à revendre. L’augmentation de son fond de roulement  lui permettra de s’approvisionner en quantité plus importante, par conséquent de gagner du temps et de réduire les frais liés aux déplacements  journaliers. Les revenus que lui procure son activité servent a supporter les frais scolaires de ses enfants et a assister sa famille. Son objectif consiste a parvenir a épargner de l’argent pour parvenir d’ici deux  ans a faire de l’import-export.
texts.en:
The economic interest group, GIE MAKARIMAL AKHLAH, was created on October 10, 2003, in Senegal. "Makarimal Akhlakh" means someone who has a good heart and good practices. By 2009, GIE had 300 members. It's goal is to unite its members and allow them to carry out their agricultural production and fishery activities, their general importing and exporting activities, and their transportation, industrial, artisan, building, animal raising, mining, fishing, hydrocarbon exploitation, artistic and cultural, printing, carpentry, services and actions for the public good, representation, processing of fishery products, agricultural, sale of spare parts, ice-making, and bakery activities, as well as provide various services.

GIE also aims to consolidate the ties of friendship and solidarity between its members to allow them to acquire the necessary material and financial means to develop their revenue-generating activities and to benefit from all of the advantages that GIE offers. And it's against this background that an agreement was signed between GIE and UIMCEC for the benefit of the GIE members at the national level. The first phase applied to a sample of 120 active members divided into 12 groups of 10.

The Makarimal  Akhlakh Groupe 7 group is is made up of ten GIE members who are all involved in the same business. They are represented by Abdoulaye, who has been selling fruit for several years now. His workday begins every morning and finishes at midnight. He is a member of a branch of the UIMCEC, and he is seeking a loan to buy fruits that he will resell.

Increasing his capital will allow him to stock up in greater quantity, consequently saving him time and reducing the costs associated with his daily commutes. The revenue that he earns from his business allows him to pay for the education of his children and support his family. His goal is to save enough money to start importing and exporting within the next two years.

loans.use: to buy fruits intended for resale

loans.name: Felecia

texts.en:
Felecia is 28 years old and lives in Gardnersville. She is single and has a 2-year-old child who lives at home.

For the past four years, she has been selling body cream, soap, pens, textbooks and other items. She was taught how to run the business by her mother. She is requesting a loan to purchase more body cream, soap, pens, textbooks and other items for her business. Her plan is to become an international businesswoman.

loans.use: to purchase more body cream, soap, pens, textbooks and other items for her business.

loans.name: Wael

texts.en:
Wael is 32 years old from Nablus.

He owns an entertainment shop for billiards, Internet and Play Station games.

He asked Ryada for this loan in order to buy Play Stations and a new billiard table for his shop.

He hopes that this loan will help him improve his income and thus provide him with the money to get married and have his own family.

loans.use: to buy play stations and a new billiard table for his shop

loans.name: Makarimal Akhlakh Groupe 9

texts.fr:
Le groupement d’intérêt  économique  dénommé GIE MAKARIMAL AKHLAH est né le 10 octobre 2003 au Sénégal. Le terme   Makarimal Akhlakh symbolise une personne qui a un bon cœur,  de bonnes pratiques. Le GIE  a atteint le nombre de 300 adhérents depuis  2009. Son objectif est d’unir ses membres et de leur permettre d’exercer des activités de production agricole et halieutique, de commerce général d’import export et de transport, d’industrie, d’artisanat, de bâtiments , d’élevage, d’exploitation minière, de pêche, d’exploitation d’hydrocarbures, d’art  et de culture, d’imprimerie et de menuiserie bois, de services et d’action d’utilité publique, de représentation, de transformation de produits halieutiques, d’agriculture , de vente de pièces détachées, de fabrique de glace , de boulangerie et de prestations de services divers. Le GIE vise aussi a consolider des liens d’amitié et de solidarité entre ses membres pour leur permettre d’acquérir des moyens matériels et financiers nécessaires au développement de leurs activités génératrices de revenus et de bénéficier de tous les avantages liés au GIE. Et c’est dans cette mouvance qu’un protocole d’accord a été signé entre le GIE et UIMCEC  au bénéfice  des membres du GIE au niveau national. La première phase  a porté sur  un échantillon de 120 membres actifs divisés en 12 groupes de 10. 
Makarimal  Akhlakh groupe 9 est groupe de 10 femmes membres du GIE  qui  fréquentent le meme marché ou elles  exercent leurs activités quotidiennes génératrices de revenus. Elles  sont représentés par madame Mariama. C’est une femme   qui évolue dans le secteur du commerce depuis 7 ans et pratique la vente  de poissons séchés ou fumés, et d’huile de palme en provenance d’une des régions du pays. Elle utilise les bénéfices qu’elle réalise pour supporter les frais scolaires de ses enfants. Elle souhaite développer son activité de commerce pour pouvoir acquérir une cantine d’ici un an.
texts.en:
The Makarimal Akhlah economic interest group (EIG) was created on 10 October 2003 in Senegal. The term "Makarimal Akhlakh" means a person who has a good heart and good practices. 

The EIG has reached 300 members since 2009. Its objective is to unite its members and allow them to exercise farming and fishing activities, general import and export trading activities, transport, industrial, artisanal, building, livestock farming, mining, fishing, hydrocarbon exploitation, art and cultural, printing, carpentry, public utility services, representation, processing of fishing and farming produce, sale of spare parts, ice-cream making, and bakery businesses, as well as the provision of other services. The EIG also aims to consolidate friendship and solidarity links between its members so that they can obtain the material and financial resources necessary to develop their income-generating activities and benefit from all the advantages relating to the EIG. Within this context a protocol agreement has been signed between the EIG and UIMCEC, to benefit the members of the EIG across the country. The first phase has been applied to a sample of 120 active members, divided into 12 groups of 10.

Makarimal Akhlakh Group 9 is a group of ten female members of the EIG, who all go to the same market where they carry out their daily profit-making businesses.  They are represented by Mariama. She has worked for seven years in the retail sector, selling dried and smoked fish and palm oil, which she gets from another region of the country. She uses the profits she makes to provide for her children’s education. She would like to continue with her retail business so that she can acquire a small store in the market in one year.

loans.use: To buy palm oil and dried and smoked fish for resale.

loans.name: Ieat's Group

texts.en:
Ieat is a 33-year-old mother of three children, one daughter and two sons, who attend the local public school. 

For her children's sake, she earns a daily income from her rice-growing and pig-raising business (six pigs). She is able to earn about 25,000 KHR per day from the current business that she has been with for six years. 

The main challenge for her is inadequate working capital to support her businesses. This is the seventh micro-loan for Ieat with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. The past loans have sustained a standard of living for her family. 

Now she is forming a group of two members, both women. Her co-member is in her fourth borrowing cycle. She and her co-member are applying for 500,000 KHR and 1,000,000 KHR, respectively. She will use her loan portion to buy six sacks of fertilizer for her farmland and to buy pig's feed. She hopes to earn more income so she can save some money to enlarge her pigpen and buy more piglets for raising.

loans.use: To buy pig's feed and six sacks of fertilizer for her farmland.

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is 55 years old, married to Jesse and they are blessed with four children. Her husband provides additional income for the family. She owns rental houses and she has been in this business for 15 years now, earning a monthly income of 50,000 shillings.

This is her first loan with KADET Ltd., and she plans to use the loan to buy materials for repairs to be done in her rental houses. She plans to use the anticipated profit to build more houses for rental.

She hopes that she will be financially stable in the near future.

loans.use: To repair her rental houses.

loans.name: Akarimal Akhlakh Groupe 10

texts.fr:
Le groupement d’intérêt  économique  dénommé GIE MAKARIMAL AKHLAH est né le 10 octobre 2003 au Sénégal. Le terme   Makarimal Akhlakh symbolise une personne qui a un bon cœur,  de bonnes pratiques. Le GIE  a atteint le nombre de 300 adhérents depuis  2009. Son objectif est d’unir ses membres et de leur permettre d’exercer des activités de production agricole et halieutique, de commerce général d’import export et de transport, d’industrie, d’artisanat, de bâtiments , d’élevage, d’exploitation minière, de pêche, d’exploitation d’hydrocarbures, d’art  et de culture, d’imprimerie et de menuiserie bois, de services et d’action d’utilité publique, de représentation, de transformation de produits halieutiques, d’agriculture , de vente de pièces détachées, de fabrique de glace , de boulangerie et de prestations de services divers. Le GIE vise aussi a consolider des liens d’amitié et de solidarité entre ses membres pour leur permettre d’acquérir des moyens matériels et financiers nécessaires au développement de leurs activités génératrices de revenus et de bénéficier de tous les avantages liés au GIE. Et c’est dans cette mouvance qu’un protocole d’accord a été signé entre le GIE et UIMCEC  au bénéfice  des membres du GIE au niveau national. La première phase  a porté sur  un échantillon de 120 membres actifs divisés en 12 groupes de 10. 
Makarimal  Akhlakh groupe  10 est un sous groupement mixte de 10  personnes appartenant au GIE MAKARIMAL AKHLAH  qui  fréquentent le meme marché ou ils exercent leurs activités quotidiennes génératrices de revenus. Ils sont représentés par madame Ndiobé, femme mariée qui capitalise une expérience de 2 ans dans le commerce et la vente de tissus voile et portables par placement a ses clients.  Elle voyage souvent vers un des pays limitrophes du Sénégal pour se procurer ses marchandises.  Ses bénéfices lui permettent de supporter les frais scolaires de ses enfants et d’épargner de l’argent. Elle souhaite dans l’avenir devenir  une grande commerçante  import-export.
texts.en:
The Makarimal Akhlah economic interest group (EIG) was created on 10 October 2003 in Senegal. The term "Makarimal Akhlakh" means a person who has a good heart and good practices. 

The EIG has reached 300 members since 2009. Its objective is to unite its members and allow them to exercise farming and fishing activities, general import and export trading activities, transport, industrial, artisanal, building, livestock farming, mining, fishing, hydrocarbon exploitation, art and cultural, printing, carpentry, public utility services, representation, processing of fishing and farming produce, sale of spare parts, ice-cream making, and bakery businesses, as well as the provision of other services. The EIG also aims to consolidate friendship and solidarity links between its members so that they can obtain the material and financial resources necessary to develop their income-generating activities and benefit from all the advantages relating to the EIG. Within this context a protocol agreement has been signed between the EIG and UIMCEC, to benefit the members of the EIG across the country. The first phase has been applied to a sample of 120 active members, divided into 12 groups of 10.

Makarimal Akhlakh Group 10 is a mixed sub-group with ten members, who all belong to the Makarimal Akhlah EIG and carry out their daily profit-making businesses in the same market. They are represented by Ndiobé, a married woman who has two years’ experience in selling headscarf fabrics and cellphones to her customers. She often travels to one of the countries beside Senegal to buy her merchandise, and her profits allow her to provide for her children’s education and save money. In the future, Ndiobé would like to be a large retailer in the import-export business.

loans.use: To buy products for resale.

loans.name: Christina

texts.en:
Christina lives in Gardnersville. She is 35 years old and she is a high school graduate, married, with two children, 12 and 16 years old. Her husband is a mechanic. 

For the past ten years, she has been running a shop where she sells bath soap, washing soap, rice, toothpaste, groundnuts and others items. She started this business with money given to her by her oldest brother, and she learned this way of selling from her friends. 

She likes the way her business keeps her busy and the buying makes her proud. She is requesting a loan to purchase more bath soap, washing soap, rice, toothpaste, groundnuts, and others items for her business. 

In future, she wants to buy a pieces of land and build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more bath soap, washing soap, rice, toothpaste, groundnuts, and others items for her business.

loans.name: Isaac Ngotho

texts.en:
Isaac is now 55 years and still married to Petronila, who is a business lady. Their five children are also okay. 

He started rearing rabbits about one year ago as well as poultry farming, and he says that his business income is able to meet his family needs.

He is applying for his third loan term with KADET, after repaying the previous loans successfully. Isaac will use the loan to buy feed and more rabbits. With the anticipated profit from the business, he will educate his children. 


His hopes and dreams are to expand the business by adding more rabbits and increase the income.

loans.use: To buy feed and more rabbits.

loans.name: Mecca

texts.en:
Mecca, age 28, lives at West Point. She is single with a son who is 9 years old and attends school. She stopped her education in the fourth grade.

She started first as a housemaid before getting into business with the little income that she saved. For the past five years, she has been selling bread, cooking oil, mineral water, butter, sardines, and other items. Since she is the only source of income for her son, she makes profit when she sells and with the profit, she buys more goods to improve her business. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase more cooking oil, bread, mineral water and sardines for the business. Her plan for the future is to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more cooking oil, bread, mineral water and sardines for the business.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca lives in Gardnersville. She is 36 years old, and she and her boyfriend live together and have three children between the ages of 11 months and 12 years old. Two are in school and all three of them live at home.

For the past four years, she has been selling rice, salt, oil, okra, bitter ball, vita and onion in the market. She started this business with money given to her by her aunt and learned this way of selling from her mother.

She is requesting a loan to purchase more rice, salt, oil, okra, bitter ball, vita and onion for her business. In future, she wants to buy a piece of land and build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, salt, oil, okra, bitter ball, vita and onions for her business.

loans.name: Amadu

texts.en:
This is 50-year-old Amadu. He is married and has five children, age 7, 8, 14, 16 and 18 years; they are all school going children. 

In 1991, Amadu established his dried fish business. He began his business because he came from a poor background. His parents were not educated and they did not know the value of education. Instead, they trained him in their life of business. He used to join his father in islands and villages to buy and trade dried fish. He was raised to be a fish monger.  

Working seven days a week and seven hours a day, he earns about SLL 1,837,000 every month from this business. Changes in price are his major problem.

He would like a loan in the amount of SLL 4,000,000. Amadu has already received and successfully repaid two loans, and now requires a new loan in order to purchase five baskets of dried fish @ SLL 800,000. 

In the future, Amadu plans to see his children through university. The loan will help, as it is an additional income to his business. He is hardworking and a good competitor. This credit service has helped him a lot and he is looking forward to acquiring loans in future. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase five baskets of dried fish.

loans.name: Alpha

texts.en:
This is 41 year-old Alpha.  He is married, and he has two children, aged 13 and 18 years. He has one other dependent who lives with him because he assists him in the business.  

In 1991, Alpha established his Ovaltine, biscuits, sweets, batteries, pure water, soft drinks, and cigarette business. He began his business because he dropped out of school because of his father's death; there was nobody to assist him.  He later became a shop-boy for a Lebanese business man, and after some years, his boss paid him off.  He used the money to start his business.  

Working 7 days a week and 13 hours a day, he earns about Le4,444,000 every month from his business. He would like a loan in the amount of Le5,000,000. 

Alpha requires a loan to buy pure water, 140 bundles @ Le3,000; batteries, 11 cartons @ Le170,000; glucose biscuit, 20 cartons @ Le75,000; and Ovaltine, 3 cartons @ Le400,000,  The balance Le10,000 will be used to pay the labourer. 

In the future, Alpha plans to build another house, provide quality education for his children, buy a delivery van, and acquire another shop.  The loan will help him to generate more income.   His major challenge is the fluctuation in foreign currency. 

He is very hardworking and trustworthy business man.  ARD has helped his business to grow.  He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy water, batteries, glucose biscuits, and Ovaltine for his store.

loans.name: Makarimal Akhlakh Groupe 11

texts.fr:
Le groupement d’intérêt  économique  dénommé GIE MAKARIMAL AKHLAH est né le 10 octobre 2003 au Sénégal. Le terme   Makarimal Akhlakh symbolise une personne qui a un bon cœur,  de bonnes pratiques. Le GIE  a atteint le nombre de 300 adhérents depuis  2009. Son objectif est d’unir ses membres et de leur permettre d’exercer des activités de production agricole et halieutique, de commerce général d’import export et de transport, d’industrie, d’artisanat, de bâtiments , d’élevage, d’exploitation minière, de pêche, d’exploitation d’hydrocarbures, d’art  et de culture, d’imprimerie et de menuiserie bois, de services et d’action d’utilité publique, de représentation, de transformation de produits halieutiques, d’agriculture , de vente de pièces détachées, de fabrique de glace , de boulangerie et de prestations de services divers. Le GIE vise aussi a consolider des liens d’amitié et de solidarité entre ses membres pour leur permettre d’acquérir des moyens matériels et financiers nécessaires au développement de leurs activités génératrices de revenus et de bénéficier de tous les avantages liés au GIE. Et c’est dans cette mouvance qu’un protocole d’accord a été signé entre le GIE et UIMCEC  au bénéfice  des membres du GIE au niveau national. La première phase  a porté sur  un échantillon de 120 membres actifs divisés en 12 groupes de 10. 
Makarimal  Akhlakh groupe  11 est un sous groupement mixte de 10  personnes appartenant au GIE MAKARIMAL AKHLAKH  qui  fréquentent le meme marché ou ils exercent leurs activités quotidiennes génératrices de revenus. Ils sont représentés par madame Ndeye Coura qui est une  femme mariée qui évolue dans le secteur du commerce depuis 8 ans et s’adonne a la vente de produits alimentaires. Elle est membre de l’UIMCEC et sollicite un crédit dans le but de renforcer son fonds de roulement afin de pouvoir diversifier les produits alimentaires qu’elle commercialise. L’accroissement de ses bénéfices pourra l’aider  améliorer les conditions alimentaires de sa famille , a supporter les frais scolaires de ses enfants, a aider ses parents et a épargner de l’argent. Son projet futur est de devenir une grande commerçante  import-export, et gérer une grande cantine dans la capitale sénégalaise.
texts.en:
The Makarimal Akhlah economic interest group (EIG) was created on 10 October 2003 in Senegal. The term "Makarimal Akhlakh" means a person who has a good heart and good practices. 

The EIG has reached 300 members since 2009. Its objective is to unite its members and allow them to exercise farming and fishing activities, general import and export trading activities, transport, industrial, artisanal, building, livestock farming, mining, fishing, hydrocarbon exploitation, art and cultural, printing, carpentry, public utility services, representation, processing of fishing and farming produce, sale of spare parts, ice-cream making, and bakery businesses, as well as the provision of other services. The EIG also aims to consolidate friendship and solidarity links between its members so that they can obtain the material and financial resources necessary to develop their income-generating activities and benefit from all the advantages relating to the EIG. Within this context a protocol agreement has been signed between the EIG and UIMCEC, to benefit the members of the EIG across the country. The first phase has been applied to a sample of 120 active members, divided into 12 groups of 10.

Makarimal Akhlakh Group 11 is a mixed sub-group with ten members, who all belong to the Makarimal Akhlah EIG and carry out their daily profit-making businesses in the same market. They are represented by Ndeye Coura, a married woman who has worked in retail for eight years selling food products. She is a member of UIMCEC, and has requested a loan to increase her working capital so that she can diversify the food products she sells. An increase in her profits will allow her to improve her family’s food conditions, provide for her children’s education, help her relatives and save money. In the future she would like to become a large retailer in the import-export field, and to run a large store in the market in the Senegalese capital.

loans.use: To buy food products for resale.

loans.name: Makarimal Akhlakh Groupe 12

texts.fr:
Le groupement d’intérêt  économique  dénommé GIE MAKARIMAL AKHLAH est né le 10 octobre 2003 au Sénégal. Le terme   Makarimal Akhlakh symbolise une personne qui a un bon cœur,  de bonnes pratiques. Le GIE  a atteint le nombre de 300 adhérents depuis  2009. Son objectif est d’unir ses membres et de leur permettre d’exercer des activités de production agricole et halieutique, de commerce général d’import export et de transport, d’industrie, d’artisanat, de bâtiments , d’élevage, d’exploitation minière, de pêche, d’exploitation d’hydrocarbures, d’art  et de culture, d’imprimerie et de menuiserie bois, de services et d’action d’utilité publique, de représentation, de transformation de produits halieutiques, d’agriculture , de vente de pièces détachées, de fabrique de glace , de boulangerie et de prestations de services divers. Le GIE vise aussi a consolider des liens d’amitié et de solidarité entre ses membres pour leur permettre d’acquérir des moyens matériels et financiers nécessaires au développement de leurs activités génératrices de revenus et de bénéficier de tous les avantages liés au GIE. Et c’est dans cette mouvance qu’un protocole d’accord a été signé entre le GIE et UIMCEC  au bénéfice  des membres du GIE au niveau national. La première phase  a porté sur  un échantillon de 120 membres actifs divisés en 12 groupes de 10. 
Makarimal  Akhlakh groupe  12 est un sous groupement mixte de 10  personnes appartenant au GIE MAKARIMAL AKHLAKH  qui  fréquentent le meme marché ou ils exercent leurs activités quotidiennes génératrices de revenus. Ils sont représentés par monsieur Babacar qui est un homme célibataire qui évolue dans le secteur du commerce depuis 7 ans et s’adonne à la vente d’habits et de chaussures. Elle est membre de l’UIMCEC et sollicite un crédit dans le but de renforcer son fonds de roulement afin de pouvoir diversifier les articles qu’il commercialise, et en meme temps  développer et élargir son activité de commerce. L’accroissement de ses bénéfices pourra l’aider  a soutenir ses parents financièrement et a épargner de l’argent afin de réaliser son rêve  futur de devenir un grand commerçant  import-export.
texts.en:
The Makarimal Akhlah economic interest group (EIG) was created on 10 October 2003 in Senegal. The term "Makarimal Akhlakh" means a person who has a good heart and good practices. 

The EIG has reached 300 members since 2009. Its objective is to unite its members and allow them to exercise farming and fishing activities, general import and export trading activities, transport, industrial, artisanal, building, livestock farming, mining, fishing, hydrocarbon exploitation, art and cultural, printing, carpentry, public utility services, representation, processing of fishing and farming produce, sale of spare parts, ice-cream making, and bakery businesses, as well as the provision of other services. The EIG also aims to consolidate friendship and solidarity links between its members so that they can obtain the material and financial resources necessary to develop their income-generating activities and benefit from all the advantages relating to the EIG. Within this context a protocol agreement has been signed between the EIG and UIMCEC, to benefit the members of the EIG across the country. The first phase has been applied to a sample of 120 active members, divided into 12 groups of 10.

Makarimal Akhlakh Group 12 is a mixed sub-group with ten members, who all belong to the Makarimal Akhlah EIG and carry out their daily profit-making businesses in the same market. They are represented by Babacar, a single man who has worked in retail for seven years selling clothing and shoes. He is a member of UIMCEC, and has requested a loan to increase his working capital so that he can diversify the products he sells, as well as to develop and expand his retail business. An increase in his profits will allow Babacar to financially support his parents and save money so that, in the future, he can realize his dream of becoming a large retailer in the import-export field.

loans.use: To buy shoes and clothing for resale.

loans.name: Mohamed M.

texts.en:
This is 32-year-old Mohamed M. He is married and has two children, age 2 and 5 years. 

In 1999, Mohamed established his retail business, selling toilet cleaners, soap, bath foam, shaving sticks, toothbrushes, bags, etc. He began his business because he dropped out of school because of severe illness. He used to assist his mother in business and after he was fully mature, his mother gave him some money to start his own business.  

Working seven days a week and 12 hours a day, he earns about  SLL 1,882,000 every month from this business. His major challenge is limited capital.

He would like a loan in the amount of SLL 3,000,000. Mohamed requires a loan in order to buy mouthwash - 5 dozen @ SLL 120,000; toilet cleaner - 5 dozen @ SLL 108,000, bath foam - 5 dozen @ SLL 108,000,  shaving sticks - 5 cartons @ SLL 250,000. The balance of SLL 70,000 will be used for transportation. 

In the future, Mohamed plans to acquire land and build a house, educate his children and acquire a shop. This loan will help to achieve his future plans. He is hardworking business man. He hopes to repay the loan within the time frame. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy and transport mouthwash, toilet cleaner, bath foam and shaving sticks.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
This is 29 year-old Gladys.  She is married, and she has two children, aged 7 and 5 years. She has one additional dependent who lives with her for fostering.  

In 2009, Gladys established her biscuit, hard drinks, soft drinks, batteries, milk, pure water, and bread business. She began her business by using her salary to establish the business because she doesn't want to depend on her husband.  

Working 7 days a week and 15 hours a day, she earns about Le 2,730,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of Le3,000,000.

Gladys requires a loan in order to buy extra stout, 4 crates @ Le110,000; stout (pint), 5 crates @ 98,000; fruit wine, 4 crates @ Le24,000; milk, 3 cartons @ Le280,000; biscuit, 2 cartons @ Le200,000; batteries, 3 cartons @ Le200,000; and sweets, 1 carton @ Le70,000.  The balance Le64,000 will be used for transportation. 

In the future, Gladys plans to build a house, educate her children, acquire a shop, and further her course in nursing.  This loan will help to accomplish some of her future plans. Her challenge is inadequate capital.  

She is hardworking business woman.  She hopes to repay the loan within the stipulated time.    She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy extra stout, stout, fruit wine, milk, and other goods for her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for tuition fees and living expenses at the Maharishi Institute.

loans.name: Saturnina

texts.es:
Saturnina tiene 35 años, vive en compañía de sus tres hijos, en la casa de su suegra desde hace 8 años. 
Se dedica a la agricultura y a la ganadería, ya tiene 8 años de experiencia en estas actividades. Le gusta pasar la mayor parte de su tiempo en el campo, pues su casa se ubica en una zona rural donde puede criar a su ganado. Ella compra los animales (en su mayoría ganado vacuno), luego los engorda por un periodo promedio de cuatro meses, para después venderlos en la feria ganadera de la ciudad. “Me gusta mucho negociar, pues si no obtengo buenas propuestas postergo la venta del animal para otra ocasión mejor”, comenta muy alegre. Ahora desea mejorar su negocio e incursionar con más capital en la agricultura. 

Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “Los emprendedores” y este es su primer crédito con MFP, por tanto agradece la oportunidad para cumplir con sus objetivos. Por otro lado, promete cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas.
Saturnina invertirá el dinero de este préstamo en la compra de un toro pequeño.
texts.en:
Saturnina is 35 years old. For 8 years she has lived with her 3 children in her mother's house.

She in the business of agriculture and livestock for a living. She has 8 years of experience in these activities. She likes to spend the majority of her time in the field, as her house is located in a rural area where she can raise livestock. She purchases animals (mostly cattle), then she feeds them for an average of 4 months, in order to then sell them at the livestock market in the city. "I very much like to negotiate, and if I don't get a good offer, I postpone the sale of the animal for a better time," she says happily. Now she wants to improve her business and put more capital into agriculture.

She belongs to the group "Los emprendedores" or "The Entrepreneurs" and this is her first loan with MFP, for which she is very grateful for the opportunity to achieve her objectives. She also promises to comply with her payment schedule. Saturnina will invest the money from this loan in the purchase of a small bull.

loans.use: to purchase a small bull..

loans.name: Natia

texts.en:
Natia is 31 years old. She lives in Tskaltubo District with her husband, Zurab, two daughters (1 and 6 years old) and an 84-year-old grandmother. Natia has requested loans from local financial institutions several times for a family agricultural business start-up, but without any success. Her loan requests were rejected because of low income and family’s poor living conditions. 

The only source of the income for the family is the monthly pension of Natia’s grandmother and a small income earned through a small-scale agricultural business. The family grows nut trees on a family-owned plot of land. They sell harvested nuts locally. According to Credo estimations, the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Natia requested a loan from Credo to start an agricultural business. Her loan request was approved in the frame of new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to the country's rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. 

With the received credit, Natia will pay for tilling a family-owned plot of the land to prepare it for seeding greens. Also Natia will purchase fertilizers and seeds. She will work hard on the plot during all seasons to harvest good greens. Natia will sell the harvested greens locally to wholesalers. The new business initiative will significantly increase the monthly income of the family and allow Natia to provide better living conditions for her children and other members of the family.

loans.use: to pay for tilling the land and purchasing seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Ibrahim K.

texts.en:
This is 30-year-old Ibrahim K.  He is single and has 2 children aged 4 and 5 years, one is a school-going child.  In 2002, Ibrahim K. established his easy wear shoes business.  He began his business because he used to assist his brother in business after school hours and after he sat his high school exams, his elder brother gave him some amount of money to start a business while awaiting the results.  But he didn't do well in the exams, so he decided to concentrate on business. 

Working 7 days a week and 13 hours a day, Ibramhim K. earns about Le 3,485,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of Le 4,000,000.  Ibrahim K. requires a loan in order to buy shoes for men (1 bundle @ Le 3,000,000) and shoes for women (1 bundle @ Le 1,000,000).

In the future, Ibrahim K. plans to open an outlet in the neighboring town, build a house and educate his children. This loan will generate more income.  Sometimes, there will be shortage of stock.  Ibramhim K. is hardworking and reliable.  He hopes to repay the loan and access another one.  He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: buy shoes to resell

loans.name: Minkailu

texts.en:
This is 41-year-old Minkailu.  He is married and has 4 children, aged 10, 15, 17 and 19 years, and all are school-going children. In 2001, Minkailu established his slippers business selling comfort shoes, madam slippers, toilet slippers, foam sandals, foam slippers, etc. He began his business after he dropped out of school.  He engaged in a labourer job in order to earn some money to start the business so that he can get back to school.  But the business became so interesting, he decided to continue with it rather than going back to school. 

Working 7 days a week and 11 hours a day, Minkailu  earns about Le3,626,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of Le 6,000,000.  Minkailu has already received and successfully repaid 3 loans, and now requires a new loan in order to purchase comfort slippers (2 cartons at Le 815,000), madam slippers (1 carton at Le 600,000), foam slippers (10 dozens at  Le 121,000), sponge sandals (1 carton at Le 750,000), sponge slippers (3 dozen at Le 480,000), plastic shoes (1 packet at Le 150,000) and toilet slippers (1 packet at Le 220,000).  

In the future, Minkailu plans to build a house, provide quality education for his children, acquire a shop and buy a car. The loan will help to improve his business.  Some items get faded, especially in the dry season, and can be sold at cheaper prices.  Minkailu is hardworking and trustworthy.  He hopes to maintain a good credit history.  He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: buy shoes to resell

loans.name: Santigie

texts.en:
This is 42-year-old Santigie.  He is married and has 4 children, aged 4, 6, 13 and 17 years, and all are school-going children. He has 1 additional dependent who lives with him to assist him in his schooling.  In 1997, Santigie established his hardware business selling paint, shovels, hammers, door locks, etc.  He began his business because he was not opportuned to attend school.  He was only introduced to business and Arabic.  He used to sell for his elder brother and after some years his brother established the business for him.  

Working 7 days a week and 12 hours a day, Santigie earns about Le 4,089,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of Le 4,000,000. Santigie requires a loan in order to buy electrical cable (2.5) - 6 rolls at Le 400,000, electrical cable (1.5) - 4 rolls at Le 350,000 and sockets - 4 cartons at Le 50,000. 

In the future, Santigie plans to build a house, attend Hajj Pilgrimage and educate his children.  This loan will help to generate more income.  He has inadequate capital.  Santigie is hard-working and devoted to his business.  He thanks ARD for access to the loan.  He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: buy cables and sockets to resell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase Wax Cotton - 1 bale @ Le3,000,000.

loans.name: Teta

texts.en:
Teta, 40, is a mother of four children and resides with her husband in Congo Town.  Her children are between the ages of 10 and 21.  She has been involved in her business for the past eight years.  She sell palm oil in the market and is proud of her business because she makes a profit when she sells.   With the profit, she buys palm oil in huge quantities to increase her sale.  

Teta started this business with a little income that she received from her husband. She is requesting a loan to purchase more palm oil for the business. Her plan for the future is to educate her children.

loans.use: buy palm oil to resell

loans.name: Surriya

texts.en:
Surriya is 23-year-old lady who has been in the work of making 'Masala', a mixture used in food for taste. She has been efficiently doing it for the past five years. Her husband is employed as a salesman in a private food company. His income is not enough to cover the family’s daily expenditures. In order to cater the need of 4 children, Surriya initiated her own business on small scale with the support of Kashf Foundation. At present, she is earning a satisfactory amount of income to support her family. 

Surriya has a good client list and serves well in her community.  She applied for a loan of amount Rs 15000 to buy stocks of black cardamoms, cumin seeds, pepper, coriander, cinnamon and dry red chilies, etc. to meet up with the increasing demand consistently. She wishes to utilize the profits to build a separate room for her children.

loans.use: buy spices to make masala

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy rice and soap to resell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy food items to resell and pay for transport costs

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
This is 43-year-old Daniel.  He is married and has 5 children, aged 3, 5, 8, 12 and 15 years, all are school-going children. 

In 2005, Daniel established his spare parts business selling clutches, fan belts, brake oil, engine oil, bearing, brake pads, brake liners, carbon brushes, etc. He began his business because he dropped out of school because of sponsorship.  His father sent him to a garage to acquire knowledge in vehicle maintenance.  After specializing in it and accumulating some amount of money, he opened a spare parts shop.  

Working 7 days a week and 11 hours a day, Daniel earns about Le2,101,000  every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of Le6,000,000. Daniel has already received and successfully repaid 3 loans, and now requires a new loan in order to buy clutches (35 sets @ Le80,000), fan belts (80 pieces @ Le20,000), brake oil (30 units @ Le30,000), and carbon brushes (87 pieces @ Le8,000).  The balance Le4,000 will be used to pay labourers. 

In the future, Daniel plans to build another house, educate his children, acquire a bigger shop and to become an international business man. This loan will help him to generate more income.  Daniel is a very hardworking and devoted man with good vision.  He thanks ARD for improving his business. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: buy auto spare parts to resell

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en: Nancy is 50 years old and lives in the Jacob town area.  She’s married with five children with ages between 19 to 29.  All live at home with her and all are in school.   Nancy has been involved with the sales of fufu (an African food made of cassava) for the past twenty years.  She started this business with the help of her sister who gave her some money to start.  She is requesting a loan to purchase more fufu for her business. She hopes to build her own house in the future.

loans.use: buy fufu to resell

loans.name: Shamshad

texts.en:
Shamshad is a 29-year-old married woman. She has done stitching work for the past five years. She is a responsible mother of two daughters and one son. She is bound to fulfill their demands. Her husband is working as a driver and one of her sons is employed in a workshop but the income is not enough to support her family. She is striving hard to contribute to the family income to improve their standard of living. 

Her stitching is much appreciated in her community. She beautifully designs dresses upon the order of her customers. Her business has gradually improved with the support of Kashf Foundation. Now she requested for a loan of Rs 15,000 to buy a stock of threads of different colors from the market at lower rates. She wishes to utilize the earned profits on her daughters’ education.

loans.use: to buy a stock of threads of different colors from the market at lower rates.

loans.name: Walid

texts.en:
Walid is from Iraq. He is 38 years old, married and has five children. His brother lives with him and contributes to the family income.

Walid owns a shop for mobiles, DVDs, and photocopying. He has been in this business since 2009. Now he has good experience in this field and a good reputation in his local community.

He is requesting a 1,200 USD loan to install a rolling shutter for the door and to increase his inventory. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his family with better living conditions.

loans.use: to install a rolling shutter for the door and to increase his inventory

loans.name: Victor  O.

texts.en: Victor, 30, is married and has two children ages 5 and 3. In 2007, Victor established his business selling phones and accessories, top-up cards and DVDs. He began his business after finishing high school. He worked for some years as shop attendant and the stipends that were given to him every month were saved to start his business. Working seven days a week and 16 hours a day, he earns about Le3,013,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of Le4,000,000. Victor requires a loan in order to buy mobile phones, batteries and accessories and for transportation. In the future, Victor plans to acquire a shop, educate his children and build a house.This loan will generate more income and achieve some of his future plans. He is a hardworking and established businessman.  He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy phones and phone accessories.

loans.name: Charbel

texts.en: Charbel is a 43-year-old Lebanese man. He lives with his wife and three children in their modest house located in a beautiful Lebanese village. Two of his children are still attending school while the other has started to work. Charbel has spent the last 13 years working as a home electrician. He works independently on a freelance basis.  Charbel has always wanted to better develop his business and improve his work, but he has never had enough income. For that reason, he decided to take a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase a car in order to facilitate transportation to his clients' homes. He says that this loan will help him take on more projects, increasing his income by 15 per cent. In the future, he wishes to open his own electrical equipment shop in order to continue to meet his family's needs.

loans.use: to purchase a car in order to facilitate transportation to his clients' homes.

loans.name: Emanuel

texts.es:
Emanuel tiene 23 años y nació en Barranquilla, Colombia. Estudió ingeniería electrónica en la Universidad del Norte gracias a los ahorros de muchos años de vida de sus padres que fueron destinados a la educación de Emanuel y sus 4 hermanos. 

Emanuel tiene el sueño de realizar una maestría en Bélgica u Holanda y el apoyo de Kiva ayudaría a que pueda pagar la inscripción y preparación de los exámenes del TOEFL y del GRE.

Una vez realice su maestría y regrese a Colombia, Emanuel tiene el sueño de trabajar en proyectos para  el desarrollo de una sociedad limpia y sostenible energéticamente. Particularmente le gustaría trabajar para una hidroeléctrica.

Aquí está su historia:

A pesar de que cuento con el apoyo de mi familia para cumplir este sueño, mis padres no pueden llegar a cubrir gastos tan elevados como estos debido a su limitada situación económica.  Además desde mi grado en septiembre de 2011 me tomó un año para conseguir un trabajo con un sueldo muy bajo.

Kiva sería el apoyo que necesito para superar los primeros pasos de este largo camino y el impulso para poder realizar esta maestría en el exterior. No me quiero dar por vencido para cumplir este objetivo y sé que gracias a mi excelencia académica y un gran esfuerzo puedo lograrlo.

Para mí sería un motivo de orgullo incalculable saber que puedo contribuir para la implementación de un modelo donde el sector industrial realmente haga una apuesta por una sociedad auto sostenible, teniendo como  eje central el uso de energías renovables. Soy consciente que una maestría en las mejores universidades de Europa me daría las herramientas y el conocimiento necesario para logar este cometido.

Colombia y  Suramérica  en general, como bloque económico emergente son el escenario ideal para la implementación de este modelo de negocios, ya que no sólo cuenta con los recursos naturales necesarios, sino porque  también se encuentra a tiempo de evitar los errores cometidos por los países más industrializados. Es por esto que deseo trabajar para una empresa colombiana con este tipo de visión y de esta manera aportar todo mi conocimiento y esfuerzo para solucionar este complejo problema. La única garantía que tengo es dar lo mejor de mí para cumplir mi sueño.
texts.en:
Emanuel, age 23, was born in Barranquilla, Colombia.  He studied electrical engineering at the Universidad del Norte.  He did this thanks to the many years of their lives that his parents saved for Emanuel’s and his four siblings’ education.

Emanuel’s dream is to get a Master’s Degree in Belgium or Holland.  The support from Kiva will help him to be able to pay the registration and preparation fees for the TOFEL and GRE exams.  Once he gets his Master’s and returns to Colombia, Emanuel dreams of working on projects to develop a society with clean and sustainable energy.  He especially would like to work for a hydroelectric power plant.

Here is his story:

In spite of the fact that I have my family’s support to fulfill this dream, my parents are not able to cover such high costs as this due to their limited financial situation.  Also, since I got my degree in 2011, it took me a year to get a job with a very low salary.  Kiva would be the support I need to take the first steps on this long road.  It would also be the catalyst to be able to get my Master’s abroad.  I do not want to give up on meeting this objective.  I know that, thanks to my academic excellence and great effort, I can do it.

It would be a great source of immeasurable pride for me to know that I can contribute to the implementation of a model where the industrial sector really backs self-sustainability for the public.  The central idea is the use of renewable energy.  I realize that a Master’s at one of the best universities in Europe would give me the tools and the knowledge needed to manage this undertaking.

Colombia, and South America in general, as an emergent economic block are the ideal settings for the implementation of this business model.  This is true not only because they have the needed natural resources, but also because it is early enough to avoid the errors committed by the more industrialized countries.

That is why I wish to work for a Colombian business that has this type of vision.  This way I will contribute all of my knowledge and effort to find a solution for this complex problem.  The only guarantee I have is to give the best of myself in order to fulfill my dream.

loans.use: to pay the application fees to study for a Master's Degree in Energy.

loans.name: Mbalu

texts.en: Mbalu is a 47-year-old widow, and has five children, including three who attend school. In 2001, Mbalu established her gara cloth business with money provided by her late husband. Working seven days a week and 11 hours a day, she earns about Le3,681,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of Le5,000,000. Mbalu has already received and successfully repaid four loans. She now requires a new loan in order to purchase bedspread (20 pieces @ Le50,000), gowns (50 pieces @ Le40,000), and bamakoh (40 pieces @ Le50,000). In the future, Mbalu plans to build a house, continue to educate her children and acquire a shop. This loan will help to achieve some of her future plans. She is grateful to ARD for improving her life.  Her main challenge is fluctuation in foreign currency. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase material for her Gara cloth business.

loans.name: Lawrence

texts.en:
Lawrence is 45 years old, married, and has three children whom he supports. He operates a cereals business. He has been in this business for a period of two years now and earns an income of 12,750 KES per month. 

This will be his first loan with KADET LTD. He will use the loan to add more stock items to his business like maize, peas, and ground nuts. He will use the anticipated profit to buy a piece of land for horticultural farming.

loans.use: To buy more inventory for his cereals business

loans.name: Samuel  S.

texts.en:
This is 43-year-old Samuel S.  He is married, and has 6 children aged 4, 6, 8, 10, 11 and 20 years, and all are school-going children. In 2002, Samuel S established his building materials business. He began his business because he dropped out of high school because his father could not pay his WAEC (West African Examinations Council) fees.  

His mother gave him a small amount of money and he started peddling.  His business grew over the years, and with loans that he has acquired from this credit service his business has expanded.  Working 7 days a week and 12 hours a day, he earns about Le1,280,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000. Samuel S has already received and successfully repaid 5 loans, and now requires a new loan in order to purchase cord cables - 5 rolls @ Le500.000, electric bulbs 10 cartons @ Le130,000, safty caps - 10 pieces @ Le20,000, door locks - 50 @ Le20,000. 

In the future, Samuel S plans to be importer.  The loans help as they bring in additional income.  He is very hardworking.  The loans he took helped a lot in solving his domestic and business problems.  He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase cord cables - 5 rolls @ Le500.000, electric bulbs 10 cartons @ Le130,000, safety caps - 10 pieces @ Le20,000, door locks - 50 @ Le20,000.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stock for his clothing business.

loans.name: Nugzar

texts.en:
Nugzar is 50 years old. He lives in Khoni District, West Georgia with his wife Gulnara and 22-year-old daughter. Nugzar requested loans from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was always rejected, because of his low income and his family’s poor living conditions. 

Nugzar’s wife Gulnara lives abroad. She works abroad and sends part of her income to her family. Nugzar is leading his family's small-scale agricultural business. He runs a family-owned dairy farm with two milk cows. Nugzar produces cheese and sells it in the village. The family's average monthly income is 200 GEL. It is not enough to provide Nugzar and his daughter with normal living conditions. According to Credo estimations, the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Nugzar requested a loan from Credo to re-start his family business, which was stopped a couple of years ago because of financial problems. His loan request was approved as part of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program provides credit for business start-up and re-start-up with fewer conditions to the country's rural poor. This population is often considered "high risk borrowers" because of low incomes, and they often do not have access to credit. With the credit, Nugzar will purchase chickens to start a poultry farm. He will place the chickens in a shed located in their yard. He will raise them and sell them for a higher price. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family. Nugzar and his daughter also hope that the income will be enough for the family so that Gulnara will be able to return home and work in the family business.

loans.use: to purchase chickens for poultry farm start-up

loans.name: Thaer

texts.en:
Thaer is from Iraq. He is a youth client, 28 years old, married, and he has two children. He lives with a family of six members, two of whom are employed. 

Thaer owns a shop for mobiles and all accessories. He has been in this business since 2010. Now he has good experience in this field and a good reputation in his local community.

He is requesting a $3,000 Youth loan to buy a laptop and a small generator, and to install rolling shutters for the door. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his family with better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a laptop and a small generator, and to install rolling shutters for the door.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is currently practicing mixed crop farming, and his children are doing well in their different levels of education. He is applying for his second loan term with KADET after repaying the previous loan successfully. Joseph will use the loan to purchase seedlings and fertilizers for his farm. With the anticipated profit from the business he will educate his children. His dream is to become a well-known livestock trader in his area of business.

loans.use: to buy a heifer and animal feed.

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en: Hussein is a 51-year-old Lebanese man living with his wife and one school-aged child. He has been working as a taxi driver since 2008. His main route is between his town and the neighboring villages. He also offers private transportation upon client’s requests. His business income is very important, because he represents the only income source for his family. Today, he is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to perform required maintenance on his car, such as painting the body and fixing many other small problems. He says that these repairs will make his vehicle safer and will help him attract more customers. This is his second Kiva loan, and he hopes to use it to improve his business as well as his family’s financial situation.

loans.use: to perform required maintenance on his car, such as painting the body and fixing many other small problems.

loans.name: Roena

texts.en:
Roena is from Senaki district. She is 63 years old, married, and lives with her husband, grown son, daughter-in-law, and two grandchildren. Roena and her husband are provided with a retirement pension. Her son works as a joiner and earns a monthly income. Roena’s grandchildren go to the local school. The main source of income for the family is their agricultural business. In particular, they own a plot of land where they grow nuts, mandarins and laurel leaves. Roena is involved in animal husbandry as well. She has five milk cows, five calves, three buffalos and three young buffalos. Roena produces cheese and sells it, along with her other agricultural products, at the local open market. In addition, the family owns beehives and sells honey in the nearby villages. Roena is a very hard-working woman with a great deal of experience in her work. 

Roena requested a loan to purchase two milk cows. She will be able to produce and sell more cheese. This will increase the family's income. With the increased income, Roena plans to purchase wood treatment installation for her son. He will work hard and help his family to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase two milk cows

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
Elizabeth tiene 23 años, vive con su único hijo, Rolando, en la casa de su madre.
Ella realiza varias actividades; durante la mañana prepara panes y galletas típicas de zona, pues abastece el pedido de algunos clientes y además ella misma los vende en la feria de la ciudad. Asimismo, todas las tardes, vende comida a los trabajadores de la escuela que se está construyendo; y ya por la noche, vende hamburguesas y papas fritas. Ya tiene muchos años dedicándose a este negocio, por lo que tiene muchos clientes. Estos trabajos la ayudan a ser una mujer independiente y sobre todo a mantener a su hijo, darle comida, vestido y estudio; pues lo que más quiere es verlo crecer y tener una carrera universitaria. 

Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “Palomitas” y este es su quinto crédito con MFP, por lo que agradece al apoyo que hace posible que continúe con su trabajo. Además promete ser puntual en sus cuotas, ya que le agrada trabajar con personas responsables y solidarias en su grupo.
Elizabeth invertirá este dinero en la compra de insumos para sus comidas, como papas por sacos, aceite por galones y salsas de diversos tipos.
texts.en:
Elizabeth, 23, lives with her only son, Rolando, in her mother’s house.  She does a variety of things.  In the morning she makes bread rolls and cookies that are typical of the region to fill customer orders and to sell in the local street market.  In the afternoon she sells food to workers at a construction site where a school is being built and at night she sells hamburgers and fried potatoes.  

She’s been in business for many years so has many customers.  These jobs help her be an independent woman and above all to support her son, provide him with food, clothing and schooling because what she wants most is to see him grow and have a university career.

She’s a member of the “Palomitas” (Little Doves) communal bank and this is her 5th MFP loan.  She’s grateful for the support that makes it possible for her to stay in business.  She promises to be punctual with her installment payments because she likes working with the responsible, supportive members of her group.

Elizabeth will use this money to buy ingredients food like sacks of potatoes, gallons of oil and various types of sauces for her meal preparation.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food.

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
This is 30-year-old Fatmata.  She is single and has no child.   In 2007, Fatmata established her Chairs & Floor Mats business. She began her business because when she graduated from high school, there was not enough money for her parents to pay her college fees, being that her younger siblings’ school fees were also stressing them.  

She decided to engage herself in selling fast food, so she dropped out of school for one year and saved enough to pay her first year's fees.  She continued with her little business.  Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about Le832,000 every month from this business. Fatmata would like a loan in the amount of Le5,000,000. She requires a loan in order to purchase plastic chairs - 140 pieces @ Le35,000, with the balance of Le100,000 used for transport. 

In the future, Fatmata hopes to be an importer.  The loan will help as it is additional capital for her business.  Fatmata’s main challenge is the poor road network. Transportation from Liberia to Sierra Leone causes a lot of stress and inconvenience.  She is hoping to acquire subsequent loans from this credit service in order to develop her business and improve her standard of living.   She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase plastic chairs - 140 pieces @ Le35,000, with the balance of Le100,000 used for transport.

loans.name: Antony

texts.en: Antony is 49 years old. He is married to Esther, who also contributes to the family’s total income. They are blessed with three children. He has been in the butcher shop business for a period of nine years, earning an income of KES 35,000 per month. This will be his first loan with KADET, and he plans to use the loan to purchase more meat for resale in his butcher shop. He will reinvest the profit back into his business. He hopes to prosper.

loans.use: to purchase more meat to sell in his butcher shop.

loans.name: Yasmine

texts.en: Yasmine is a 39-year-old Lebanese woman. She lives with her husband and five school-aged children. With her husband's cooperation, she is able to meet her family's needs and offer them a decent way of living. Yasmine owns a small minimarket where she sells a variety of dairy and daily-use products in addition to soft drinks and many other items. Today, she’s asking for a loan from Kiva Partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase food provisions for her minimarket. This loan will enable her to diversify her stock, thereby increasing her revenues and thus her income. Yasmine looks forward to expanding her grocery. In the future, she hopes to open other branches and assign her children ownership of these branches.

loans.use: to purchase food provisions for her minimarket.

loans.name: Hadi

texts.en:
Hadi is a 20-year-old, single man living with one parent and two siblings.  He is from Lebanon.  He has two years of experience working with mobile phones.  He sells various trademark mobile phones and related accessories.

With his requested youth loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l, Hadi will be able to increase his selection of new mobile phones and accessories, and purchase prepaid cell phone cards to sell.  Hadi is always looking for new ways to please his clients and offer them good quality products.  He reports that both his income and business sales will increase as a result of the loan.  

In the future, he is looking to further expand his business and increase its capital.

loans.use: to purchase mobile phones, accessories and prepaid cell phone cards for resale.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan, es soltero y tiene dos hijos que están en etapa escolar, viven en una casa alquilada ocupando dos habitaciones con paredes de adobe y el piso de tierra, la casa se encuentra ubicada en la zona Chuquiaguillo de la ciudad de La Paz.
El estudió solo hasta la primaria y actualmente percibe ingresos ya que se dedica a lustrar calzados trabajando por más de doce horas al día en un puesto que tiene en una de las Plazas de la ciudad de La Paz, ya que es el único que cubre los gastos de educación, alimentación y pago de servicios básicos de su familia.
El crédito lo requiere para comprar material para la limpieza de los calzados (cremas de colores negro, café, amarillo, neutral, cepillos para lustrar los calzados), ya que desea mejorar sus ingresos para ayudar a su familia y dar un mejor servicio a sus clientes..
El sueño de Juan, es aumentar sus ingresos para poder moverse a  una casa en anticrético para ahorrar en el pago de alquileres y mejorar su calidad de vida.
Es la segunda vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Juan is single and has two school age children.  He lives in a rented house occupying two bedrooms with adobe walls and dirt floors.  The house is located in the city of La Paz's Chuquiaguillo zone.

He only went to elementary school and earns income working shining shoes for more than 12 hours daily in a stand he has in one of the city of La Paz’s squares.  He is the only one who covers education, food and basic utility costs for his family.

He needs the loan to buy cleaning supplies for shoe care (black, brown, yellow and neutral shoe polish, brushes to buff shoes) because he wants to improve his income to help his family and to provide better customer service.

Juan’s dream is to increase his income so that he can move into an ‘anticrético’ [transaction whereby a property owner requests a "loan" from you in exchange for housing, which must be paid back to you at the end of your contract. If your loan is not repaid, the property owner could lose the property to you] house to save on rental costs and to improve his quality of life.  This is the second loan request to IMPRO and first to KIVA.

loans.use: to buy shoe polish and brushes for his shoe polishing business.

loans.name: Barbara

texts.es:
Bárbara tiene 32 años, está separada de quien fue su conviviente, fruto de aquel amor tiene tres hijos de 14, 11 y 10 años, quienes se han convertido en su principal motor y motivo para seguir adelante. Actualmente viven con sus hijos en su casa propia, construida mientras vivió con su ex cónyuge. 

Su trabajo es la venta de jugos y refrescos en un pequeño puesto del colegio de su barrio. Inicia por las tardes cuando ingresan los alumnos mayores, pero su principal clientela son los docentes de la institución. Trabaja desde hace un año en esta actividad y lo hace con ayuda de su hija mayor. Sus ganancias diarias son muy buenas y eso le da la tranquilidad que necesita para sobrellevar los gastos que requiere para la crianza de sus hijos menores. Complementa esta actividad trabajando por las mañanas como personal administrativo en una empresa cervecera de la ciudad en la que vive. Su gran anhelo es poner una juguería en una zona céntrica y concurrida de la ciudad para vender mayor variedad de jugos y al mismo tiempo incrementar sus ganancias en beneficio de su familia.

Este es su segundo préstamo con la institución MFP, por ello agradece a todas las personas que hacen posible su financiamiento para que pueda concretar sus planes. Además le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque todos sus integrantes son personas que responsables y muy solidarias entre sí. 
Con el monto solicitado, de 800 nuevos soles, comprará dos sacos de naranjas y dos sacos de piña para que pueda continuar preparando jugos. También comprará otras frutas y probará nuevos sabores.
texts.en:
Bárbara, 32, is separated from her spouse; she has three children who are 14, 11 and 10 years old who have become her main motivating force and reason to continue forward.  She lives with her children in her own house that was built when she still lived with her ex-spouse.

She works selling juice and soft-drinks in a small stand at her local school.  She starts out in the afternoon when the older students start classes but her main customers are the school teachers.  She’s been working in this business for a year and her older daughter helps her with it.  Her daily profits are very good and this gives her the peace of mind she needs to cover the expenses that arise in raising her minor children.  She also works mornings as an administrative assistant for a brewery in the city where she lives.  Her great dream is to open a centrally-located juice shop in a busy part of the city to sell a larger variety of juices while at the same time increasing profits for her family’s benefit.

This is her second MFP loan and she is grateful to all the people who make the financing possible so she can make her plans a reality.  She also enjoys being part of her communal bank because all the members are responsible, very mutually supportive.

She will use the requested 800 new soles to buy two sacks of oranges and two sacks of pineapples to continue making juice.  She will also buy some other fruits to try new flavors.

loans.use: to buy sacks of oranges and sacks of pineapples and also some other fruit.

loans.name: Haja  I.

texts.en:
This is 28-year-old Haja I.  She is married, and has 1 child aged 7 years, who is school-going. In 2009, Haja I established her Provisions business, selling milk, ovaltine, mayonnaise, sugar, etc. She began her business because she came from a poor background and her parents did not have the capacity to see her through schooling, and by then her elder sister who was a trader was married in Freetown. Haja I joined her sister in Freetown for her to assist her education, but her sister preferred to train her in the business.  

Business is all Haja I knew since she was a teenager.  Working 7 days a week and 16 hours a day, she earns about Le696,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of Le4,000,000. She requires this loan in order to purchase milk - 2 carton @ Le440,000, ovaltine - 3 carton @ Le210,000, mayonnaise - 3 carton @ Le200,000, cigarette (gold seal) - 1 carton @ Le700,000, bond street cigarette - 1 carton @ Le1,130,000, and the balance Le60,000 is for transport. 

In the future, Haja I plans to build a house so that she can live peacefully with her family. Transportation is her major problem.  She is hardworking.  She hopes to pay her loan on time in order to acquire subsequent loans.   She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase milk - 2 carton @ Le440,000, ovaltine - 3 carton @ Le210,000, mayonnaise - 3 carton @ Le200,000, cigarette (gold seal) - 1 carton @ Le700,000, bond street cigarette - 1 carton @ Le1,130,000 and the balance Le60,000 is for transport.

loans.name: Abibatu

texts.en:
This is 33-year-old Abibatu.  She is married and has 4 children, aged 6 months, 6, 8 and 12 years, three of whom are school-going children. In 2002, Abibatu established her clothing business. She began her business because she was brought up by her aunt who was a businesswoman.  She came to live with her because she had not conceived by then.  Her aunt did not think it was necessary for her to go to school as she was helping with her domestic activities.  Abibatu usually accompanied her to the market to trade.  Trading is all she knew from then.  

Working 7 days a week and 11 hours a day, she earns about Le643,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of Le3,000,000. Abibatu requires a loan in order to purchase waxed cotton - 1 bale @ Le3,000,000. In the future, Abibatu plans to build a house to enable her family to have better living conditions. Rainy season is her major problem, as customers seldom go to the market.  

Abibatu is a hardworking woman.  She is hoping to generate profit from this loan because she will be able to buy enough goods with the money.  She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase waxed cotton - 1 bale @ Le3,000,000.

loans.name: Hilarion

texts.es: El señor Hilarión de 53 años de edad casado más de 30 años, viven en la comunidad de Chullpani Grande hacia el sud de Colomi, saben leer y escribir, tienen 2 hijos pequeños una familia humilde. El señor Hilarión se dedica al servicio de transporte afiliado en Sindicato de Autotransporte Mixto con ruta Colomi-Cbba y viceversa a la vez son agricultores anualmente venden 70 cargas de papa, 80 de haba, 10 de papaliza, 10 de oca que mayormente se dedica su esposa cultivando en 2 has de terreno herencia de sus padres contrata personal eventual para preparación de terreno, siembra, labores culturales y cosecha de esta forma ellos captan recursos económicos para mantener a su familia. Don Hilarión nos comenta que hizo construir recientemente su casa de material de dos plantas en lo cual invirtieron todo el ahorro que tenían pero les falto dinero para la obra fina, teniendo esta oportunidad ahora tendrán una vivienda cómoda para vivir más felices con sus dos hijos pequeños que les quedan.
texts.en: Hilarion is 53-years-old and has been married for more than 30 years. They live in the community of Chullpani Grande towards southern Colomi. They know how to read and write. They have two small children, a humble family. Hilarion works in transport service in the Sindicato de Autotransporte Mixto (Mixed Transport Union) with a route from Colomi to Cochabamba to back. They are also farmers. Every year they sell 70 loads of potatoes, 80 loads of hay, 10 of ulluco, 10 of another tuber. Mostly his wife works growing on two hectares of land inherited from her parents. She hires temporary employees for land preparation, planting, cultivation labors, and harvesting. This way, they get economic resources to maintain their family. Hilarion tells us that that he had construction done on the two-story house. They invested all the savings they had but they don't have money for the fine workmanship. With this opportunity, they will have a comfortable home to live more happier with the two children who are still with them.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to finish his home

loans.name: Carina

texts.es:
Carina tiene 38 años, es una mujer trabajadora y empeñosa, además de ser alegre y amable tiene muchas ganas de salir adelante.
