Con mucho empeño y entusiasmo, día a día Carlos trabaja como chofer de taxi, todas las mañanas desde tempranas horas inicia su labor, el puede trabajar un aproximado de 10 horas diarias y cree que le va bien porque conoce las zonas donde encontrar mayor cantidad de pasajeros, así también por el trato amable y respetuoso que brinda a sus clientes.  
Carlos se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar los trámites documentarios para la obtención de la licencia de circulación, así como la compra de un par de llantas para su auto; de esta manera Carlos tendrá su auto en mejores condiciones y podrá realizar su trabajo sin problemas, así Carlos espera seguir esforzándose y trabajando para más adelante poder adquirir otro auto para ampliar su negocio y así poco a poco salir adelante.
texts.en:
Carlos is a 30-year-old man. He is single and lives in the city of Ica. He is a very kind, hardworking, and enthusiastic person. He has a great desire to get ahead. 

Thanks to his efforts and help from his parents, Carlos was able to study a technical career of Computation and Data Processing. In his free time he likes to play soccer with his friends and neighbors. Sometimes he cooks a delicious Carapulcra with dry soup to share with his family. 

With a lot of dedication and enthusiasm, Carlos works daily as a taxi driver. Everyday he works starting early in the morning. He can work approximately 10 hours daily. He thinks he does well because he knows the areas to find a greater quantity of passengers and because he is kind and respectful to his clients. 

Carlos is very grateful for the Kiva loans. The loans offer aid to help him with the documents needed to obtain a circulation license.   Also, he will purchase new tires for his car. With this his car will be in better condition and he can work without problems. 

Carlos expects to continue to work hard to purchase another car and expand his business in the future. Therefore, little by little, Carlos will be able to do well.

loans.use: to complete documents for his circulation license and purchase new tires

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en: Adjoa is a food vendor.   She sells different kinds of food at Abura.  Some of the food she sells is banku, cooked yam, cooked rice and many more.  In the photo, she is preparing the stew for her food.  Adjoa is single but has one child.   She uses her income to pay their accomodation and utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy bags of rice, maize and other ingredient need to prepare her food to sell. She hopes to use the new profits to provide a meaningful education for child.

loans.use: buy ingredients to make food for sale

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en:
Hussein is a 30-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife. He has owned a car repair shop since 2009 and has worked for 10 years in the same domain. His job consists in changing oil for cars. 

With his requested youth loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l, Hussein will increase his shop’s inventory of mechanical tools and supplies such as oil, screwdrivers, hammers, etc.  He took advantage of a previous Kiva loan and was very satisfied with the results, especially that he was able to remarkably expand his business and get higher income.  In the future, he plans to open a new branch of his shop where he will start car spare parts sales in addition to his area of expertise.

loans.use: buy oil and shop tools

loans.name: Aba

texts.en:
Aba is a palm oil extracter at Abura.  She uses the palm fruit around her to extract the oil.  She has been in this business for 5 years. 

Aba is a single parent taking care of 6 chilren. She sees to the well-being of her home with the income she makes from her sales. Her loan will be used to buy more palm fruits to extract oil. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to invest back into the business.

loans.use: buy palm fruits to extract oil for sale

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is still married to Ann and they now have three children.  He is still running the Agrovet shop and it has been getting him income which is providing for his family's needs.  

John is applying for his second loan term with KADET after repaying the previous loan successfully. He plans to use the loan to buy more plant chemicals to sell in his shop. With the anticipated profit from the business, he will educate his children.   His dreams are to improve the living standard of his family.

loans.use: buy plant chemicals to sell

loans.name: Nodar

texts.en:
Nodar is from Senaki district in West Georgia. He is 63 years old, married and lives with his wife and 22-year-old son. The family earns their living through an agricultural business. In particular, Nodar has 7 milking buffaloes, 2 milk cows, a pig and a horse. He sells cheese and piglets at the local open market. In addition, he has a plot of land which is cultivated and different kinds of vegetables are grown. Nodar is very hard-working man with a rich experience in his work.

Nodar requested a loan to purchase an additional buffalo.  He will then be able to get more milk and increase the sales of his dairy products. This will raise his income. With the increased income, Nodar plans to expand his agricultural business and renovate his house which is old and damaged. He awaits your support.

loans.use: buy a buffalo

loans.name: Tatu

texts.en:
Tatu is an entrepreneurial mother of a family and eager to get ahead. She still runs her food stall which has provided her with good results.  Her business is open every day and she takes care of it with the help of her children during the evening and weekends. In her stall she offers a variety of dishes. Her customers are requesting dishes that she needs to start offering.

With this loan Tatu wants to be able to buy ingredients like wheat flour and cooking oil in order to improve production and as a result she hopes to be able to pay her loan on time.

loans.use: buy ingredients to make food food for sale

loans.name: Fadi

texts.en:
Fadi, 23, is single and lives with his parents and two siblings. His father is the main breadwinner, but the whole family cooperates in seeking a better life.

Fady raises all kinds of dogs and sells them to neighborhood pet shops. He has been in business for many years and knows how to manage his work very well. He’s successful and looks forward to developing his business any way possible.

One way for him is to take out a 1500 USD youth loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to buy dog food and related products such as medicines for his dogs. He feels this step will allow him to increase his sales and earnings and boost his whole way of live.

Because of his loyal customers and good reputation, Fady sees himself rapidly expanding his business.

loans.use: to buy dog food and related products.

loans.name: Vazha

texts.en:
Vazha, 51 years old, lives in the village of Mukhiani, West Georgia,with his two adult daughters (25 and 21 years old) and a son-in-law. His wife Shorena works abroad and transfers part of her income to her family to assist them financially. The main source of family income is a small dairy farm, led by Vazha. He has three milk cows from which he produces cheese to sell in the village to local dairy product retailers. According to Credo estimations the family belongs to the subsistence poor category.

Vazha has requested a loan from Credo to restart the family business which was stopped recently due to financial problems. His loan request was approved through a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo, whose start-up loan program envisages the provision of business start-up and re-startup loans with soft conditions to the country's rural poor who do not have access to credit products because they are regarded as “high risk borrowers” due to low income. Indeed, Vazha had requested loans from local financial institutions several times, but was rejected each time due to his low income.

With the loan, Vazha will renovate family-owned greenhouses, which aren’t functional now due to a state of disrepair. After renovation Vazha will once more grow vegetables in the greenhouses during the whole year, and consequently the income of the family will significantly increase. It will therefore allow him to provide better living conditions for his family.

loans.use: to purchase materials for greenhouse renovation.

loans.name: Mwanaisha

texts.en:
In the city of Mombasa, we found Mwanaisha still selling food stuffs. It is a business she loves, and it motivates her.  It gives her time to socialize with both friends and her family. 

Mwanaisha is taking out another loan that will help her buy wheat flour, charcoal, and cooking oil. She still hopes that she will one day own a hotel. 

She is very grateful for the opportunity given.

loans.use: To purchase wheat flour, charcoal, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Akbarali

texts.ru: Акбарали  мужчина в возрасте 41 года, женат , имеет четверых детей.   Сам по профессии строитель, но также дома занимается домашним хозяйством, откормом и продажей скота.   Акбарали имеет только две коровы, поэтому на полученный кредит Акбарали решил купить ещё два молодых бычка и корма для них.   Он хочет расширить свой бизнес,получить хороший доход и осуществить свои планы.     Заранее благодарит нашу организацию за поддержку.
texts.en:
Akbarali is 41 years old and married with four children. He works in construction but also runs a farm, where he fattens and sells livestock.
Akbarali has only two cows, so he has requested a loan to buy two additional bull calves and fodder for them. He wants to grow his business, make a good profit, and make his plans come true. He thanks our organization in advance for our support.

loans.use: to purchase  livestock

loans.name: Eddy Miguel

texts.es:
Eddy es un hombre de 21 años, vive con sus padres en la ciudad de Cañete, en el distrito de Imperial, tiene un hijo pequeño de 2 años de edad, a quien quiere mucho y es su razón principal en la vida, lamentablemente por diversas razones se separó de su pareja; gracias a su esfuerzo y al poyo de sus padres Eddy estudió la carrera profesional de Contabilidad, lamentablemente por la necesidad de trabajar para solventar los gastos de su pequeño y gastos personales no pudo terminar cursar su carrera, pero sueña con poder hacerlo pronto.
Con mucho empeño y entusiasmo, día a día Eddy trabaja como chofer de su propia mototaxi, todas las mañanas desde tempranas horas inicia su labor, él sale a recorrer las calles de su ciudad en búsqueda de pasajeros, cree que le va bien por su dedicación y por el trato amable y respetuoso que brinda a sus clientes.  
Eddy se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realiza la refacción y el mantenimiento general de su mototaxi; de esta manera Eddy contará con su vehículo en buenas condiciones para poder realizar su labor, así el espera seguir trabajando y obteniendo ingresos económicos, los cuales poco a poco desea ahorrar para poder adquirir otra mototaxi, para así poder ampliar su negocio y con ello lograr su gran sueño de ver convertido a su pequeño en un hombre de bien y en un gran profesional.
texts.en:
Eddy is a 21-year-old man. He lives with his parents in the city of Canete, in the Imperial district. He has a 2-year-old son that he loves very much and is his main purpose in life. Unfortunately, for a variety of reasons he separated from his partner. 

Thanks to the effort and support of his parents, Eddy studied Accounting as a professional career. Sadly, he was not able to finish his career because he had to work to cover costs for his child and personal expenses. He hopes to finish soon. 

With a lot of dedication and enthusiasm he works every day as a taxi driver of his own motor taxi. Every day he starts work early in the morning. He leaves to travel through the streets of the city in search of passengers. He believes he does well because of his dedication and because he is kind and respectful to his clients. 

Eddy is very grateful for the Kiva loans thanks to which he will able to complete the repairs and general maintenance of his motor taxi. With the repairs, Eddy will be able to trust that his vehicle is in good condition in order to work. He hopes to keep working and have income, which little by little he wants to save to purchase another motor taxi. With this he will be able to expand his business and achieve his dream to raise his child to become an honest man and great professional.

loans.use: to complete the repairs and general maintenance of his motor taxi

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is a 30-year-old married woman and a mother of two young children, ages 9 and 7.  She lives in Bohol, Philippines, together with her family.

Marilou is engaged in the kalamay business. Kalamay is a sticky, sweet delicacy popular in the Philippines, most especially in the Bohol region. It is made of coconut milk, brown sugar, and ground glutinous rice.  It can also be flavored with margarine, peanut butter, or vanilla.  Kalamay can be eaten alone, but is usually used as a sweetener for Filipino desserts and beverages.

Marilou needs additional funds for her kalamay-making business. She is asking a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy ingredients in making kalamay, such as glutinous rice, sugar, nuts, and others. With this, she will be able to make more kalamay to sell.

In the future, Marilou dreams of making her business a success and sending her children to school for better learning and education.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for making kalamay, such as glutinous rice, sugar, nuts, and others.

loans.name: Annie

texts.en:
Annie, 40, is a mother of three children, aged between 8 and 12. She lives at Congo Town with her husband. For the past four years she has been selling charcoal in her community. Her favorite part of the business is  that she makes a profit and with the profit she helps her husband with the expenditures in the home and buys more charcoal for the business. 

A challenge  she faces is that during the rainy season, most of the charcoal  gets wet. She learned how to sell from her mother and started this business with a little income that she got from her saving club. This is her third loan cycle with BRAC Liberia. She has requested another loan to purchase more charcoal for the business and increase her sales. Her plan for the future is to educate her children and build  a house.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal for the business and increase her sales.

loans.name: Nilda

texts.es:
Nilda tiene 35 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de Camaná, ciudad que se caracteriza por tener un clima cálido y acogedor, asimismo se desarrolla la agricultura, se cultiva arroz, azúcar, frejoles, entre otros, asimismo posee playas hermosas. Cuando dispone de un tiempo libre le gusta mucho mirar películas y también le encanta en algunas oportunidades comer el riquísimo “Chupe de Camarones”. Debido a sus pocos recursos económicos el solo pudo estudiar hasta el quinto de secundaria, pero le hubiera gustado estudiar una carrera universitaria.

Día a día Nilda trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de ropa interior y ropa, ella trabaja alrededor de 10 horas y puede atender hasta 20 clientes en el día, ella cree que le va bien en su trabajo porque es muy amable con los clientes y ofrece productos de calidad.

Nilda está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar mercadería para su negocio como braziers, medias, entre otros; así de esta manera podrá tener mayor variedad de productos para ofrecer, así como también poder mejorar sus ingresos, de esta manera ella podrá seguir trabajando para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Tener su casa propia”.
texts.en:
Nilda is 35 years old and lives in the city of Camaná. The city is characterized by a warm and welcoming weather for the agriculture, growing rice, sugar, and beans, among others. Also, it has beautiful beaches.

When she has free time, she loves to watch movies. Also, she likes to eat the delicious "Chupe de Camarones" [Shrimp stew] sometimes. Due to her limited financial resources, she could only study up to fifth grade in secondary school, but she would have liked to study a college degree.

Every day, Nilda works in her small business selling underwear and clothes. She works about 10 hours a day and serves up to 20 customers every day. She believes she is doing well because she is very kind with customers and offers quality products.

Nilda is very grateful to Kiva borrowers because thanks to the help provided, she will be able to buy merchandise for her business such as brassieres and tights, among others. Thus, she will have a greater variety of products to offer, and she will also be able to improve her income. She will continue working to make her biggest dream a reality: "to have her own home".

loans.use: to buy merchandise (brassieres and tights, among others).

loans.name: Konstantin

texts.en:
Konstantin is 27 years old. He lives in the village of Mukhiani, West Georgia with his wife Diana, two children (7 and 6 years old) and his 74-year-old grandmother. Konstantin requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for family business re-start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected each time because of insufficient income. 

The main source of income for the family is their small-scale agricultural business, led by Konstantin. He has a small family farm with a milk cow and a pig. Dairy products are mainly consumed by the family members, and a small surplus is sold to local dairy products retailers. Also, Konstantin sells piglets in the village. The total average monthly income of the family is 300 Laris, including the monthly pension of Konstantin’s grandmother. According to Credo estimations the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Konstantin requested a loan from Credo to re-start the family business, which was stopped recently because of financial problems. His loan request was approved in the framework of new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. This start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions for country rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. 

With the received credit Konstantin will renovate family-owned greenhouses, which aren’t functional now, as they are in bad condition. After renovation Konstantin will re-start to grow vegetables in the greenhouses during whole year and the income of the family will significantly increase. This will allow him to provide better living conditions for the family members.

loans.use: to purchase materials for greenhouse renovation

loans.name: Abena

texts.en: Abena  is a fishmonger at Abrofo near Abura. She buys fresh fish and smokes it for sale. Abena has been in this business for 10 years now. She is divorced and has two childern.  Abena  uses her income to feed and clothe her children and to pay their school fees.  She will use her loan to purchase a large quantity of fresh fish to smoke for sale. With the new profit Abena wishes to expand her business

loans.use: purchase a large quantity of fresh fish to smoke for sale.

loans.name: Esi

texts.en:
For the past 10 years Esi has been cooking "banku" (fermented dough balls). She serves it with hot pepper sauce and fried fish at Abrafo near Abura. She is married to a farmer and has six children who are currently in school, so she uses her income to help her husband in paying their children’s school fees. 

Esi hopes to expand her "banku" business and so needs a loan to enable her to buy maize, peppers, tomatoes, cassava dough and fire wood to make her food production easier. Her future plan is to build a better place to host her customers.

loans.use: to buy maize, peppers, tomatoes, cassava dough, and firewood to make her food production easier.

loans.name: Khaldoun

texts.en:
Khaldoun is a 49-year-old Lebanese married man. He lives with his wife and two children. He has been working as a private teacher since 1995. He likes his occupation because he feels that he is helping learners to get the needed education. In parallel, he teaches at a local school and has gained many years of experience. His wife is a teacher as well. They cooperate to gather enough money to be able to pay the heavy life expenses.

Today, he’s applying for a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to arrange a special room in his house where he can receive his students and equip it with required materials and supplies. These materials will facilitate his work preparation and will help him do research and studies which will improve his teaching skills. He really wishes to receive more students with the coming school year.

loans.use: to arrange a special room in his house where he can receive his students and equip it with required materials and supplies

loans.name: Kibibi

texts.en:
Kibibi used her previous Kiva loan to buy an indispensable stock of flour, sugar, etc., to offer better service to her numerous clientele who she offers good services. Thanks to her previous Kiva loan, her sales increased, and her customers are very satisfied.

Kibibi is currently applying for a new Kiva loan to buy more ingredients, such as flour, rice, baking powder, among others.  She will continue doing physical upgrades to her space to provide the customer the comforts they require.  This is her dream of prosperity.

Her message to Kiva lenders is: “Thank you for making my dreams a reality, to continue growing as a person and as a businesswoman.”

loans.use: to buy more ingredients, such as flour, rice, baking powder, among others.

loans.name: Mwashamba

texts.en:
Mwanashamba is so happy for the support Yehu and Kiva are giving her through the loans. She tells us that she is getting reasonable profits out of her businesses. Now requesting another loan for her retail shop, Mwanashamba plans to buy the goods that yield a greater profit such as maize flour, paraffin, detergents, etc. This way she will be able to continue offering services to her neighborhood.

Thanks to her entrepreneurial spirit, Mwanashamba has been able to move a step forward.

loans.use: to purchase maize flour, paraffin, detergents, etc.

loans.name: Roberto

texts.en:
Roberto is a 36-year-old married man and the father of three young children, from Bohol, Philippines. 

He runs a sari-sari or convenience store for more than seven years now. This is the source of his income.

Roberto is in need of additional capital for his business. He is asking a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy more merchandise to sell in his store, like canned goods, soda, biscuits, and other snack foods.  Through this, he will be able to attract and cater to more customers in his store.

In the future, Roberto hopes of expanding his business and make it more sustainable. In addition, he wants to continually send his children to school for better learning and a bright future.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise to sell in his store, like canned goods, soda, biscuits, and other snack foods.

loans.name: Maria Esmeralda

texts.es:
María es una mujer de 39 años, vive en la ciudad de Chiclayo con sus 3 hijos, a quienes ama y son su principal razón en la vida, lastimosamente por diversas razones se separó de su pareja, desde entonces ella es padre y madre para sus hijos, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; lamentablemente por la necesidad de trabajar para solventar sus gastos, María no pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Educación que tanto deseaba, pero le hubiera gustado mucho poder hacerlo, en sus ratos libres le gusta ver televisión y en algunas ocasiones cocina unos deliciosos Tallarines Rojos para compartir con su familia.
Con mucho empeño y dedicación, María puso en marcha su pequeño negocio de venta de abarrotes, todos los días desde tempranas horas inicia su labor, ella pueda trabajar un aproximado de 12 horas diarias y cree que le va bien por la variedad de sus productos y por el trato amable que brinda a sus clientes.
María se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de mercadería para su negocios, tales como: arroz, azúcar, leche, aceite, fideos, menestras, entre otros; de esta manera María tendrá su negocio mejor abastecido, con ello espera poder aumentar sus ventas e incrementar sus ingresos económicos, los cuales poco a poco irá ahorrando para poder asegurar el bienestar y la educación de sus hijos, ya que sueña con verlos convertidos en buenos profesionales y en hombres de bien.
texts.en:
María is a 39-year-old woman who lives in the city of Chiclayo with her three children. She loves her children who are the main reason for her life. Unfortunately, for various reasons, she separated from her partner and since then has been both father and mother to her children.

She is a very friendly, hardworking and enthusiastic person who dedicates all her efforts to moving her family forward. Unfortunately, due to the need to work to pay her bills, María was not able to study for a professional career in education, which she greatly wanted to do. In her spare time, she enjoys watching television and occasionally she cooks a delicious “Tallarines Rojos” to share with her family. 

With a great deal of effort and dedication, María opened a small grocery store. She works every day from early in the morning and puts in approximately 12 hours a day. She believes her business is doing well because of the variety of her inventory and because of her friendly treatment of customers.

María is very grateful to Kiva lenders because, thanks to their help, she was able to purchase merchandise for her business, such as rice, sugar, milk, oil, pasta and mixed vegetables, among other items. In this way, she will have a better stocked business. Thus she expects to increase her sales and income, which she will save little by little so that she can insure the well-being and education of her children for she dreams of seeing them become good professionals and upstanding men.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise such as rice, sugar, milk, oil, pasta, etc.

loans.name: Suzette

texts.en:
Suzette is from the community of Bien Unido, Bohol. She is married with three children. Her eldest is 21 and the youngest is five. 

Suzette has been making and selling salted and dried fish for 15 years now. 

She is asking for a loan to buy more fresh fish and salt for her business. She is confident that a loan will go a long way in making her business more sustainable.

Her income will give her family a healthy diet and pay the school fees for her children. It is her hope and dream that she will be able to successfully send her children to school so they can have a better future.

loans.use: to buy more fish and salt for her dried fish business.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca  is a single parent, with a child who is 10 years old and attends school. She stopped her own education in the twelfth grade. Rebecca has been selling used clothes for the past six years. She sells clothes for both boys and girls in the market. 

Her favorite part of the business is during the Christmas season; she makes more profit, and with the profit she buys more goods and attends to the needs of her child.  She is requesting this loan to purchase more used clothes for the business.  Her future plan is to open a shop and extend the business.

loans.use: to purchase more used clothes for the business.

loans.name: Tessie

texts.es:
Tessie tiene 50 años, vive en compañía de sus dos sobrinas, a quienes cuida en la casa que heredó de sus padres hace 30 años. Solo tiene una hija, que ya es independiente y vive en otra ciudad.
Tessie tiene una dificultad parar caminar, a pesar de ello es una mujer muy trabajadora y no se amilana frente a los retos que le ofrece la vida. Desde hace 17 años tiene un depósito que acondicionó en la parte frontal de su casa que se ubica en una de las zonas céntricas de la ciudad. Todos los días recibe varios sacos de papa y otros productos para guardar. Ahora desea refaccionar su almacén, ya que el techo se encuentra con algunos agujeros; “es el único ingreso económico que poseo, por ello lo tengo que cuidar”, comenta. 

Este es su sexto crédito con MFP y se siente tranquila por el apoyo que recibe, además de agradecer la confianza que depositan en ella. Promete cumplir con sus cuotas de manera puntual, pues no defraudará a su grupo, conformado por personas solidarias y responsables.
Tessie invertirá este dinero en la compra de calaminas para techar su depósito.
texts.en:
Tessie, 50, lives with two nieces who she cares for in the house she inherited from her parents thirty years ago.  She only has one daughter who is independent now and lives in a different city.  

Tessie has difficulty walking but despite that she’s very hardworking and does not lose heart in face of life’s challenges.  She’s had a warehouse in the front of her house that’s centrally-located in the city that she set up 17 years ago.  She receives several sacks of potatoes and other products every day to be stored.  She wants to upgrade the warehouse now because the roof has holes in it.  “It’s the only source of income I have so I have to take good care of it,” she comments.

This is her sixth MFP loan and she feels at ease because of the support she gets; she’d also like to give thanks for the trust that’s placed in her.  She promises to make her payments punctually so as not to disappoint her group which is composed of supportive, responsible people.

Tessie will use this money to buy plywood sheets to roof her warehouse.

loans.use: to buy plywood to roof her warehouse.

loans.name: Aurea

texts.en:
Aurea is a merchant and has owned a sari-sari or convenience store for more than ten years now. She lives in Bohol, Philippines together with her family. This business is the source of her income which she uses for the family's daily needs.

Aurea is in need of additional funds for her business. She is asking for a loan worth 3000 PHP to buy more stock to sell in her store such as noodles, soap, snack foods, sodas and others. She believes that through this loan she can finally augment her sales and income.

In the future, Aurea dreams of making her business a success.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell in her store such as noodles, soap, snack foods, sodas and others

loans.name: Kambua

texts.en:
Kambua is a resident of Kisauni of Coast Province, Kenya. She is married and has three children. She runs a business selling fish, a venture that she has been operating for three years.

She learned about Yehu through a friend who invited her to the group and she joined with an aim of accessing credit to improve the operations of her business. Her main challenge is a low seasonal market.

Kambua is applying for a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to purchase more fish. The extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to pay school fees for her children. She aspires to expand her business and open a retail shop.

loans.use: to purchase more fish.

loans.name: Soledad Del Valle  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Soledad del Valle está conformado por 5 socias y 2 socios quienes son conocidos y amigos, la mayoría de sus integrantes viven en la parroquia del Valle en Cuenca, esta parroquia tiene un clima frió y  varios lugares turísticos para disfrutar de la naturaleza, su gente es amable y aun mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos, laboran en la agricultura, cría de animales y comercio.

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Sandra, este es su segundo crédito que realiza en el banco comunal Soledad del Valle, vive por el sector de Miraflores en la ciudad de Cuenca, tiene 29 años de edad, viven en unión libre y ha procreado 3 hijos de 12 y 9 años de edad y su ultimo hijo de apenas 4 meses de nacido, su primer hijo va a ingresar al colegio en este nuevo año lectivo y su segunda hija está estudiando en una escuelita de la ciudad. Su esposo es empleado privado y también le ayuda en su negocio, la casa en la que  viven es arrendada.

La Señora. Sandra desde hace un año se dedica a la elaboración y venta de helados, su producto lo vende recorriendo la ciudad de domingo a domingo sin un horario fijo, el resto de su tiempo lo dedica a su familia. 

Su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de frutas, azúcar, leche y huevos para la elaboración de los helados.
 
Su sueño es tener su casa propia para vivir cómodamente con su familia.
texts.en:
The “Soledad del Valle” Communal Bank is made up of 5 women and 2 men who are acquaintances and friends. Most of the members live in Valle parish in Cuenca. This parish has a cold climate and several tourist destinations where visitors enjoy nature. Its people are friendly and still maintain their traditional culture. They work as farmers, livestock breeders and traders.

One of the members of this group is Sra. Sandra. This is her second loan in Soledad del Valle Communal Bank. She lives in the Miraflores area of the city of Cuenca and is 29 years-old. She lives with her common law partner and has conceived three children, who are 12 and 9 years old and the last son, who is scarcely 4 months old. Her oldest son is going to enter high school this new school year and her second child, a daughter, is in a little elementary school in the city. Her husband is privately employed and also helps her with her business. They live in a rented house.

Sra. Sandra has been making and selling ice cream for the past year. She is a street vendor and works from Sunday to Sunday, without a fixed work schedule. She dedicates the rest of the time to her family.  She will invest her new loan in the purchase of fruit, sugar, milk and eggs to make her ice cream.

Her dream is to own her home so she can live comfortably with her family.

loans.use: to buy fruit, sugar, milk and eggs.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
María tiene 37 años, su esposo es Juan, con quien tiene cuatro hijos. Viven en la casa de su suegra desde hace 18 años.  
Su casa se ubica en unas amplias pampas, le gusta mucho vivir en el campo. Su principal ingreso económico es de la ganadería, posee tres vacas lecheras y dos terneros, los cuales cuida diariamente, pues tiene que alimentarlos y extraer la leche que producen. Al día vende un promedio de 20 litros, con eso puede mantener los gastos de su hogar. Su secreto es sembrar ella misma el pasto para el alimento de sus animales, “de esa manera controlo la calidad del alimento, para que no se hinche su barriga o puedan tener una enfermedad”, comenta. Ahora ella desea aumentar su ganado para poder producir más. 

Este es su cuarto crédito con MFP, se siente tranquila por el apoyo que recibe, además de agradecer la confianza que depositan en ella. Promete cumplir con sus cuotas de manera puntual, pues no defraudará a su grupo, ya que todos son personas solidarias y responsables.
María invertirá el dinero de este préstamo en la compra de una vaca de buena calidad para aumentar su ganado.
texts.en:
María is 37-years-old and her husband is Juan; they have four children and they have lived in her mother-in-law’s house for the last 18 years.  Her house is located in vast plains and she likes working in the fields very much.  Her main source of income is raising cattle; she has three dairy cows and two calves that she cares for daily because she has to feed and milk them.  She sells 20 liters on average per day and is able to cover her household expenses that way.  Her secret is to do the planting herself of grass to feed her animals.  “That way I control the quality of the feed so that their stomachs won’t swell or they could catch some other disease,” she comments.  She’d like to increase her herd size to produce more.

This is her 4th MFP loan and she feels at ease with the support she gets and she is thankful for the trust placed in her.  She promises to make her installment payments punctually in order not to defraud her group since they are all supportive, responsible people.

María will use the money from this loan to buy a good quality cow to increase her herd size.

loans.use: to buy a good quality cow.

loans.name: Ma. Nila

texts.en:
Ma. Nila is from the town of Bien Unido in the province of Bohol. She is married with two children aged 18 and 19. Ma. Nila sells fish for a living. She started this business three years ago to help support her family. 

She is asking for a loan to buy more fresh fish, pay school fees and food for the family.

Ma. Nila is determined to see her children finish their education and have a healthy diet. She hopes that in the future her business will become very successful and she will be self-sufficient and will be able to depend on her income for everything that her family needs.

loans.use: to buy more fresh fish, pay school fees and buy food for the family.

loans.name: Yessica Brigith

texts.es:
Yessica tiene 21 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de Pisco, ciudad que se caracteriza por tener un clima cálido y acogedor, asimismo se desarrolla la agricultura, en especial el cultivo de algodón, frejoles, maíz, entre otros. Cuando dispone de un tiempo libre le gusta mucho jugar vóley con sus vecinos de su barrio y también le encanta comer uno de sus platillos favoritos el cual es el riquísimo “Arroz con pato”. Debido a sus pocos recursos económicos ella solo pudo estudiar hasta el quinto grado de secundaria, pero le hubiera gustado mucho estudiar una carrera universitaria.

Con mucho entusiasmo Yessica trabaja en una empresa, ella labora alrededor de 8 horas al día, ya que con ello puede apoyar con los gastos de su hogar; ella cree que le va bien en su trabajo porque es responsable y porque tiene muchas ganas de salir adelante.

Yessica está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar materiales para realizar mejoras en su vivienda como cemento, arena, pintura, entre otros, con lo cual mejorar su vivienda y su calidad de vida; de esta manera también mejorara su calidad de vida, así ella seguirá trabajando muy duro para hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Tener un negocio propio y tener su casa propia”.
texts.en:
Yessica, 21, lives in the city of Pisco, a city noted for its hot, welcoming climate.  Agriculture is common here too, especially cotton, broad bean and corn, among others.  When she has free time available she likes to play volleyball with her neighbors and also loves to eat one of her favorite dishes, the delicious “Arroz con Pato” [Chicken with Duck].  Because of her limited economic resources she was only able to study up to fifth grade in secondary school but she would have liked to have studied a university career.

She works hard as an employee in a firm for about 8 hours daily and is able to help with household expenses that way.  She believes that she does well at work because she’s responsible and she has a strong drive to get ahead.

Yessica is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the support they’ve given her she will be able to buy supplies like cement, sand and paint, among others to do some home improvements which will improve her quality of life too.  She will improve her quality of life and continue working hard to make her greatest dream a reality: to own a business and a house.

loans.use: to buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: C7930 Twegerane Group

texts.en:
Jacqueline is 31 years old. She is married and has four children, aged between 1 and 13 years old. 

She owns an agriculture business selling rice, which is open from 6 a.m. until 11 p.m. daily, except on the weekend. Jacqueline currently employs four people to help her. She has five years of experience in this work.

She is the leader of the group called "C7930 Twegerane" in the local language. (She is the first person on the right side.)  Jacqueline has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company to expand her agriculture business by cultivating more rice to sell. 

With the profit, she expects to save money for her future and to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: To expand her agriculture business by cultivating more rice to sell.

loans.name: Angela

texts.es:
Ángela tiene 53 años, es una mujer sencilla y amable. Vive en compañía de su nieta y su hermana, en la casa que construyó hace 30 años en el terreno que heredó de su familia. 
Trabaja con mucho esmero por sus dos hijas, ellas están estudiando en la ciudad de Lima. Sus actividades económicas son la agricultura y ganadería, esta última es la que le provee su principal ingreso de dinero. Comprar cuyes, gallinas, cerdos y ovejas en distintas ciudades del valle donde vive, después las cuida hasta que se encuentren maduras y las vende; “las gallinas las vendo cada tres meses a un cliente fijo”, comenta. Ahora desea mejorar la calidad de sus animales alimentándolos de mejor manera.  

Este es su primer crédito con MFP y se siente tranquila por el apoyo que recibe, además de agradecer la confianza que depositan en ella. Promete cumplir con sus cuotas de manera puntual, pues no defraudará a su grupo, conformado por personas solidarias y responsables.
Ángela invertirá este dinero en la compra de varios pollos pequeños.
texts.en:
Ángela, 53, is an unassuming, kind woman.  She lives with her granddaughter and her sister in the house she built 30 years ago on property she inherited from her family.  She works very hard for her two daughters who are attending school in the city of Lima.  

Her economic activities are agriculture and raising livestock, the latter is the one that produces the main part of her income.  She buys guinea pigs, pigs and sheep in various cities in the valley she lives in and then cares for them until they mature and then she sells them.  “I sell the chickens every three months to a regular customer,” she comments.  She’d like to improve the quality of her animals now feeding them better.

This is her first MFP loan and she feels at ease because of the support she receives; she’d like to give thanks for the trust placed in her.  She promises to make her installment payments punctually in order not to defraud her group composed of supportive, responsible people.

Ángela will use this money to buy several baby chicks.

loans.use: to buy several baby chicks.

loans.name: Jinna

texts.en:
Jinna is 45 years old and comes from San Miguel, Bohol. She is married with two adult sons. She has been cooking and selling peanut rolls (peanut roll is crushed sweetened peanuts that are wrapped in lumpia wrapper and fried) for an income. This has been her business for six years now. She is asking for a loan to buy ingredients such as peanuts, brown sugar and cooking oil. Her profit will be for healthy diet for her family and reinvestment into the same business. 

Jinna is dependent on the livelihood that she knows best, so in the future she would like to explore other aspects of food vending so she can have a better income.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as peanuts, brown sugar, cooking oil

loans.name: Casimera

texts.en:
Casimera is a 52-year-old married woman and mother of three teenage children from Bohol, Philippines. She runs a sari-sari or convenience store and has been doing this for five years now. 

Casimera needs additional funds for her business. She is asking for a loan of 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy more items to sell, such as canned goods, dry goods, snack foods and other household products. She is optimistic that this loan could help her to realise her dream of making her business successful.

In the future, Casimera wants to raise her family's standard of living and experience fullness of life.

loans.use: buy more items to sell, such as canned goods, dry goods, snack foods and other household products.

loans.name: Eugenio Espejo  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Eugenio Espejo está conformado por 13 mujeres que gracias a su amistad han formado este banco, se dedican a laborar en diferentes actividades que les permiten mejorar la economía de sus hogares, son mujeres luchadoras ya que a pesar de las adversidades que les presenta la vida siempre están dispuestas a regalar una sonrisa. Viven en diferentes lugares de la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad tiene un clima frió, es  la tercera ciudad más importante del país, es desde Diciembre de 1999 Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad y tiene varios lugares para disfrutar de la naturaleza.

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora Dolores, fue invitada por una amiga a formar parte del banco comunal Eugenio Espejo, este es su primer crédito. Vive por el sector de Miraflores en la ciudad de Cuenca, tiene 58 años de edad, es casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 4 hijos quienes 3 de ellos son casados y viven  independientes, su hija soltera trabaja y es quien le ayuda económicamente. Su esposo no se encuentra en el país  ya que ha migrado en busca de mejores oportunidades para sacar adelante a su familia, la casa en la que vive es de su propiedad.

Doña Dolores para ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar trabaja de lunes a sábados en un pequeño restaurante que tiene, esta actividad la desempeña hace 5 años y cuenta con una clientela selecta.
 
Su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de  vajillas y víveres para la preparación de sus platos. 

Su meta es crecer más en su negocio.
texts.en:
The “Eugenio Espejo” communal bank has 13 members, all women who thanks to their friendship have formed this communal bank.  They work in different activities that allow them to improve their home economy.  They are hardworking women who despite life’s adversities are always quick with a smile.  They live in different parts of the city of Cuenca.  This city has a cold climate and is the country’s third most important.  Since December, 1999, it’s been a Cultural Heritage of Humanity and it has several places in which to enjoy nature.

One of the bank members is Dolores.  She was invited to join the Eugenio Espejo communal bank by a girlfriend and this is her first loan.  She lives in the Miraflores sector of the city of Cuenca.  She’s 58-years-old, married and has four children.  Three of them are married and live independently and her single daughter works and helps her out economically.  Her husband is abroad since he emigrated in search of better opportunities to move his family forward.  She owns the house she lives in.

To help her husband with household expenses, Dolores works Monday through Saturday in a small restaurant she has.  She’s been in business five years and has a select clientele.  She will use the loan to buy table settings and ingredients to prepare her dishes.  Her goal is to grow more in business.

loans.use: to buy food and table settings.

loans.name: Jenisa

texts.en:
Jenisa is a 30-year-old married woman and a mother of three young children from Bohol, Philippines. She has been engaged in a fish vending business for several years now. 

Jenisa is in need of additional capital for her business. She is asking for a loan of 7,000PHP to buy more fish to sell and fuel for the tricycle she uses in selling fish to people in her community.

This loan, Jenisa believes, could help her in making her dream of improving her life come true. Jenisa wants to earn more so she can send her children to school so they can have a bright future.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell and fuel for the tricycle she uses in selling fish to people in the community

loans.name: Duo Manos A La Obra Group

texts.es: Dúo manos a la Obra, la señora María de 51 años de edad, es originaria de Acatenango, ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de tortillas los tres tiempos, ella se dedica a esta actividad desde hace varios años, está solicitando este crédito para la compra de maíz y leña, ya que de esta forma quiere seguir luchando para sacar adelante a su familia y que sus hijos tengan un futuro mucho mejor y con más oportunidades de trabajo,
texts.en: Maria is a 51-year-old woman from the group “Dúo manos a la Obra” (Dual hands at work). She is a native if Acatenango. She works to create and sell tortillas three times a day. She has done this work for several years and is requesting this loan for the purchase of corn and firewood. Through her work she wants to keep working hard to get her family ahead. She wants her children to have a better future and more work opportunities.

loans.use: to purchase corn and firewood to create tortillas for sale

loans.name: Bwagonga Tukore Group

texts.en:
Bwagoga Tukore group is located on the outskirts of Ibanda town. The group is comprised of people whose main economic activity is agriculture.

Adrine is a single mother of three and a member of Bwagonga Tukore Group. She has requested a loan of 300,000 ugx to buy manure in the form of cow dung for her banana plantation. Adrine will use the money to buy cow dung, transport it and pay for labor, since she cannot work alone. In six months, Adrine expects a high yield from her banana plantation. She will use the profits to send her first daughter to the university.

Adrine also hopes to buy another piece of land and expand her banana plantation from the proceeds of her next loan. Thereafter she can construct a permanent house for her family.

Adrine is a very creative, focused and hardworking lady.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her banana plantation

loans.name: Melche

texts.en:
Melche is 25 years old and from Trinidad, Bohol. She is married, with three children ages 9, 2 and 4 months. 

Melche is currently engaged in food vending, hog raising and a transportation business. She is helping her husband, who works as a habal-habal driver (driving a motorcycle to transport passengers), by making fruit salad and taking care of the hogs. She is asking for a loan to buy milk, sugar, fruits and feed for the hog. 

Her income will help support her family, especially her children, in terms of daily consumption and school fees. 

In the future, when her children are older, she would like to have a bigger food vending business and piggery so she can send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy milk, sugar, fruits and feed for the hog

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.en:
Alejandro is a Peruvian artisan who specializes in carving cedar relief panels. He would would like to purchase larger quantities of cedarwood, as well as tools to increase production.

Alejandro has been selling through NOVICA since 2007. This is his story:

"I am an heir to my family's wood carving legacy. I learned to carve when I was younger, and I've always enjoyed working with my hands. I love the wood's natural grain. My work is about beautiful images that come forth from the wood. In 2005, I opted for creating my own pieces and working on my own. I am motivated by the idea of one day becoming a great wood artist and having my work remembered forever. I try to transmit the patience and dedication one must have to do this kind of work."

"Thank you for welcoming my work into your homes, and appreciating this art form that I love so much. I also very much appreciate your support of my art by way of this microcredit loan."

Use the link below to view Alejandro's carved panels on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/artistdetail/index.cfm?faid=6220

loans.use: to purchase larger quantities of cedarwood, as well as tools to increase production

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is a 45-year-old gentleman married with 5 children. He primarily deals in cattle fattening and has been doing that business for the last 5 years. 

David took out a loan of 3000000 ugx to buy bulls for fattening. He fattens them for a period of 3 months and sells them at a profit when they are big enough.

David also harvests cow dung from the cows which he sells as fertilizer to cultivators.

David's major challenge is lack of enough land for grazing his cattle and the long distance to the cattle markets. He plans to buy more land for grazing from the loan proceeds.

David's dream is to take his children to good schools and construct a permanent house for his family.

loans.use: to purchase cattle to sell

loans.name: Lourdes Magdalena

texts.es: Lourdes  tiene 20 años realiza trabajos como empleado dependiente en dos lugares, desde las 5 de la mañana trabaja como apoyo de venta de desayunos, culminando su trabajo antes del medio dia, vende productos de cosméticos para tener mejores ingresos a partir de las 2 de la tarde ingresa  a otro trabajo que tiene en la venta de pollos a la broaster, actualmente cuenta con un dependiente de menos de un año de edad, tiene ganas de superase, estudio a nivel secundaria, por falta de ingreso económico dejo sus estudios para dedicarse al trabajo y así poder apoyar a su familia, el préstamo solicitado es para realizar la construcción de una habitación para vivienda, la cliente tiene ganas de seguir adelante, ser mas independiente de su familia poder seguir estudiando, formar una carrera a nivel técnico, de esta forma darle a su hijo un mejor futuro, pese a que no cuenta con el apoyo del padre del niño.
texts.en:
Lourdes, 20, works as an employee at two jobs.  Starting at 5am she works as a sales assistant selling breakfasts; she finishes this job before noon.  She also sells cosmetics to improve her income and at 2pm she starts to sell Broaster-style chicken.  She currently has a dependent that is under the age of one and she wants to get ahead.  She studied secondary school but because of lack of economic resources had to stop attending school to go to work and help support her family.  

The loan she’s requesting is to add a room to the house.  She wants to continue forward, to be more independent from her family and to be able to continue studying and to study a technical career to give her son a better future despite not having any support from her son’s father.

loans.use: to build a bedroom.

loans.name: Manasseh

texts.en: Manasseh is 64 years old. He is a father of three children, aged between 13 and 21. He has spent 14 years selling beans and potatoes. He wants the loan to add more beans as well as potatoes. He plans to use the profits to pay school fees for the children.

loans.use: To buy more beans and potatoes for sale.

loans.name: Jean De Dieu

texts.en: Jean De Dieu is 26 years old and is single. He has been a motorbike-taxi driver for six months. He transports people every day from 6 a.m. until 8 p.m. Jean De Dieu has requested a loan from Kiva lenders to buy essential materials like tires and an engine for his motorbike. With his profit, he will pay medical insurance and save money for his family.

loans.use: To buy essential materials like tires and an engine for his motorbike.

loans.name: Coco Victor

texts.es: Coco es una persona muy humilde y trabajadora, que se dedica al transporte de pasajeros en su taxi, que recorre la calles cochabambinas donde va en busca de pasajeros, él es un minusválido ya que pero la pierna hace varios años en un accidente de trabajo, sin embargo no dejo de luchar y seguir adelante, su concubina lo abandono con una hija pequeña que ahora tiene 4 años, a la cual quiere muchísimo, ya que le da fuerzas para enfrentar su realidad de no tener quien le pueda ayudar a criarla, él no se descuida de su educación pero tiene que llevarla a una guardería por la mañana donde se queda todo el día mientras él trabaja. El crédito lo quiere para poder realizar el mantenimiento general de su herramienta de trabajo que con el transcurso del tiempo y el uso de gas como combustible deteriora más rápido el vehículo.
texts.en: Coco is a very humble, hardworking person who works providing passenger transportation in his taxi.  He travels through the streets of Cochabamba looking for customers.  He’s handicapped because he injured his leg several years ago in an accident. However, he never stopped striving to continue forward.  His spouse abandoned him and their little girl who is now 4-years-old; he loves her very much and she gives him the strength to face his reality of not having anyone else who can help him care for her.  He does not neglect her education but has to leave her at a day-care center in the morning where she stays all day while he works.  He wants the loan to provide general service to his work tool which with the passage of time and the use of gasoline as fuel deteriorates the car more quickly.

loans.use: to service his taxi.

loans.name: Nida

texts.en: Nida is a rice farmer from the town of Bien Unido, Bohol. She is married, with two children. Farming has been her very source of livelihood for her family. She would like to maintain her farm because the harvest helps them with food supply and an income. She is asking for a loan to buy quality seeds, fertilizer, and pesticides and to pay for labor. Nida hopes to have a bigger business someday that will assure her and her husband of a comfortable life when they are old. In the future, she hopes to acquire more land that she can farm for a better income.

loans.use: to buy quality seeds, fertilizer, and pesticides and to pay for labor

loans.name: Gustavo

texts.es: Gustavo tiene  27  años y radica en el trópico de Cochabamba, en la comunidad  en el municipio de Entre ríos, desde hace 11 años. EL cliente es de la provincia  de charcas, de la comunidad de chitani del departamento de potosí, uno de los lugares mas pobres de bolivia, donde los terrenos son malos para la producción, existe mucha erosión de tierra, vino del sur al trópico como la mayoría de las personas buscando mayor oportunidad de vida, en su comunidad las oportunidades de trabajo eran cada vez menores, por lo que decidió  salir,  en el transcurso de estos años trabajo como peón en muchos trabajos agrícolas, trabajaba como partidario,  con mucho trabajo y  esfuerzo se compró su lote agrícola, en la que hoy en día trabaja en el sector agrícola. El crédito que está solicitando es para realizar mantenimiento de sus cultivos, esto le ayudara a seguir creciendo, su deseo más grande es ampliar sus cultivos,  así de esta manera podrá mejorar su nivel de vida.
texts.en: Gustavo is 27 years old and has lived in the tropics of Cochabamba, in a community in the municipality of Entre Ríos, for eleven years. He is from the  Chitani community of the administrative division of Potosí, in the province of Charcas, one of the poorest places in Bolivia, where the land is bad for production and there is a lot of land erosion. He came from the south to the tropics like the majority of the people looking for better life opportunities. In his community the employment opportunities were dwindling, which is why he decided to leave. Over the course of years he worked as a farmhand in many agricultural jobs. He worked as a follower. With a lot of work and effort he bought his own agricultural lot, where nowadays he works in the agricultural sector. The loan he is requesting is to enable him to maintain his crops, which will allow him to keep growing. His biggest wish is to expand his crops, and in this way he can improve his standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural inputs for the maintenance of his land

loans.name: Gs 7 De Mayo Group

texts.es:
Doña Paula es un Señora muy trabajadora dedicada a su trabajo, y vive con su esposo, tiene 3 hijos los cuales ya son mayores de edad y le ayudan en la parte económica.
Doña Paula tiene su negocio en una colonia en el sur de Honduras. Desde hace mas de 15 años. Se dedica a su negocio pulpería.
Doña Paula El préstamo lo necesita Para la compra de pollo, canes, lácteos, refrescos, maíz, frijoles, azúcar y otros. Este crédito le ayudara ya que tendrá capital fresco para invertir ya que trabaja con créditos, ya que ella da créditos en su negocio.
Los sueños de Doña Paula es hacer que su negocio sea más rentable y de esta manera agenciarse de más fondos para tener una mejor vida.
Doña Mariana se dedica a su negocio venta de carne y pulpería, en la aduana de Guasaule desde hace más de 14 años y actualmente vive con su esposo 
Doña María se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras desde hace mas de 15 años madre de 3 hijos y actualmente vive con su esposo.
Choluteca, Honduras - Julio del 2012
texts.en:
Paula is a very hardworking woman who is dedicated to her work.  She lives with her husband and has three children who are now adults and help her out economically.

Paula has a business in a neighborhood in south Honduras.  For more than 15 years now she’s been a grocer.

Paula needs the loan to buy chicken, meat, dairy products, soft-drinks, corn, beans, sugar and others.  The loan will help her have fresh capital to invest since she works with loans because she sells on credit in her store.

Paula’s dream is that her business will be more stable so that she can earn more income and have a better life.

Mariana has sold meat and groceries in the Guasaule customs for more than 14 years; she currently lives with her husband and María has been selling fruit and vegetables for more than 15 years and is the mother of three children; she lives with her husband at present.

Choluteca, Honduras - July, 2012

loans.use: to buy chicken, meat, dairy products, corn, soft-drinks, corn, beans, sugar and others.

loans.name: Guadalupe

texts.es: La Señora Guadalupe tiene 31 años de edad madre soltera con 3 hijos menores dependientes, vive y trabaja en una comunidad rural Candelaria Mosoj Rancho que se encuentra a 64 km de la ciudad de Cbba, hace 12 años se dedica a la agricultura es la fuente de su ingreso económico produce papa, papaliza en terreno de 1.9 has herencia de sus padres en la comunidad de Tabla mayu, doña Guadalupe necesita capital para compra de insumos agrícolas (abono orgánico) para ampliar sus cultivos y aumentar la producción en la siguiente campaña agrícola, Doña Guadalupe nos comenta que ahora sembrara en más superficie garantizando la seguridad alimentaria para su familia y mejorar sus ingresos para ahorrar dinero y hacer estudiar sacar adelante a sus hijos, ya que el padre de sus hijos abandono hace años.
texts.en:
Guadalupe, 31, is a single mother of three minor, dependent children.  She lives and works in the rural community of Candelaria Mosoj Rancho located 64 kilometers from the city of Cochabamba.  She’s been working in agriculture for 12 years and growing various types of potatoes is her source of income.  She has a 1.9 hectare piece of farmland her parents passed down to her in the community of Tabla Mayu.

Guadalupe needs capital to buy farm supplies (organic manure) to expand her crops and increase production next growing cycle.  Guadalupe comments that she will now plant a larger surface area thus insuring a food supply for her family and will improve her income to save money and send her children to school since their father abandoned them years ago.

loans.use: to buy organic manure.

loans.name: Gs Las Casitas 1 Group

texts.es:
Doña Paulina es un señora muy trabajadora dedicado a su trabajo, casada tiene 3 hijos los cuales ya son mayores de edad y le ayudan en la parte económica. Ella Tiene su negocio en su casa de habitación en el sur de Honduras. Desde hace más de 20 años se dedica a Lo que es la venta de refrescos y molino de moler maíz.
Doña Paulina el préstamo lo necesita Para la compra un molino. Este crédito le ayudara ya que tendrá capital fresco para invertir ya que trabaja con créditos, también ella da créditos en su negocio.
Doña Paulina sus sueños son de comprar tierras que le venden para a si tener mejores ingresos para bienestar de sus hijos.
Jorge se dedica a la venta de ropa nueva y sandalias desde hace mas de 12 años y actualmente vive con su esposa.
Delmi se dedica a la venta de ropa nueva desde hace mas de 12 años es padre de 2 hijos y actualmente vive con su esposo.
Choluteca, Honduras - Julio del 2012
texts.en:
Paulina is a very hardworking woman who is dedicated to her work.  She’s married and has three children who are adults now and help her economically.  She has her business at home in south Honduras.  For more than 20 years she’s been selling soft-drinks and providing corn milling services.

Paulina needs the loan to buy a mill.  The loan will help her have fresh capital to invest since she works with loans because she also sells on credit in her business.

Paulina’s dream is to buy land she’s being sold to have better income for her children’s wellbeing.  

Jorge has worked selling new clothes and sandals for more than 12 years; he lives with his wife at present and Delmi has been selling new clothes for more than 12 years.  She has two children and lives with her husband.

Choluteca, Honduras - July, 2012

loans.use: to buy a corn mill.

loans.name: Makarimal Akhlakh Groupe 6

texts.fr:
Le groupement d’intérêt  économique  dénommé GIE MAKARIMAL AKHLAH est né le 10 octobre 2003 au Sénégal. Le terme   Makarimal Akhlakh symbolise une personne qui a un bon cœur,  de bonnes pratiques. Le GIE  a atteint le nombre de 300 adhérents depuis  2009. Son objectif est d’unir ses membres et de leur permettre d’exercer des activités de production agricole et halieutique, de commerce général d’import export et de transport, d’industrie, d’artisanat, de bâtiments , d’élevage, d’exploitation minière, de pêche, d’exploitation d’hydrocarbures, d’art  et de culture, d’imprimerie et de menuiserie bois, de services et d’action d’utilité publique, de représentation, de transformation de produits halieutiques, d’agriculture , de vente de pièces détachées, de fabrique de glace , de boulangerie et de prestations de services divers. Le GIE vise aussi a consolider des liens d’amitié et de solidarité entre ses membres pour leur permettre d’acquérir des moyens matériels et financiers nécessaires au développement de leurs activités génératrices de revenus et de bénéficier de tous les avantages liés au GIE. Et c’est dans cette mouvance qu’un protocole d’accord a été signé entre le GIE et UIMCEC  au bénéfice  des membres du GIE au niveau national. La première phase  a porté sur  un échantillon de 120 membres actifs divisés en 12 groupes de 10.
MAKARIMAL Akhlakh groupe  6 est composé de 10 membres du GIE qui partagent le meme marché ou ils exercent leurs activités de commerce. Ils sont représentés par monsieur Abdou qui évolue depuis 2006 dans le commerce et la petite restauration. Il s’active dans la vente de petit déjeuner.. Il est membre de l’UIMCEC  et consacre journalière ment  19 heures  de temps (journée et nuit)   a son activité. Il sollicite un crédit dans le but d’augmenter son fond de roulement et acquérir des chariots ambulants qui servent pour la vente de café local. Son objectif est d’élargir son activité a d’autres marchés. Cette opération pourrait l’aider élargir le nombre de ses employés,  a accroitre considérablement ses revenus, a améliorer les conditions de vie sociale de ses parents, et aussi a épargner de l’argent.  .
texts.en:
The economic interest group (EIC), named GIE MAKARIMAL AKHLAH, was created in Senegal on October 10, 2003.  The term "Makarimal Akhlakh" means a person with a good heart and good practices.  Since 2009, this group has reached 300 members.  Its goal is to unite its members and to facilitate their activities: farming and fishing activities, general import-export trading, transportation, industrial production, crafts, construction, animal husbandry, mining, fishing, hydrocarbon exploitation, art and culture, printing and woodwork, public utility or representation services, processing of fishing and farming crops, sale of spare parts, ice-cream making, bakery business and various other services.

This EIG also intends to foster friendship and solidarity between its members and to help them acquire the material and financial means necessary to the development of their income-generating activities, while allowing them to benefit from all the advantages provided by the EIG.  It is with this spirit in mind that an agreement was signed between the EIG and the UIMCEC for the benefit of the interest group's members at the national level.  The first phase involved a sample of 120 active members divided into 12 groups of 10.

The MAKARIMAL AKHLAKH (group 6) comprises ten members of the economic interest group.  These members all work at the same market, where they are involved in retail activities.  Their representative is Mr. Abdou, who has been involved in commerce and the small restaurant business since 2006.  He specifically provides breakfast services.  He is a member of the UIMCEC and spends 19 hours per day (and night) doing his work.  He is requesting a loan in order to increase his working capital and to purchase the mobile carts that he uses to sell local coffee.

His goal is to expand his business and to reach other markets.  This could in turn help him to increase his number of employees, to boost his income, to improve the living conditions of his parents, and also to save some money.

loans.use: to install mobile carts from which to sell local coffee.

loans.name: Felipa De Jesus

texts.es:
Doña Felipa es una persona muy emprendedora dedicada 100% a su negocio, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos. En el departamento de Choluteca en el sur de Honduras. Y tiene más de 20 años de tener el negocio de compra y venta de gallinas.
Doña Felipa el préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de gallinas y de esta manera incrementar más sus ventas. Con el préstamo espera superar sus ventas y satisfacer y mejorar las necesidades de sus clientes. También espera obtener mejores ingresos para tener mejor calidad de vida.
Doña Felipa sus sueños es poder mejorar su negocio, en hacerlo más grande y de esta manera poder ayudar a su familia y su esposo.
Choluteca, Honduras - Julio del 2012
texts.en:
Felipa is a very enterprising person who is 100% devoted to her business.  She lives with her husband and two children in Choluteca Department in south Honduras.  She’s had a business buying and selling chickens for more than 20 years.

Felipa will use the loan to buy chickens to increase her sales.  With the loan she will increase sales and better meet customer needs.  She also hopes to earn higher income to improve her quality of life.

Felipa’s dream is to be able to improve her business, to make it bigger and be able this way to help her family and her husband.

Choluteca, Honduras - July, 2012

loans.use: to buy chickens.

loans.name: Reyna

texts.es:
Reyna tiene 28 años, es una mujer amable, buena y muy responsable. Su pareja desde hace 13 años es Pascual, con quien tiene tres hijos de 11, 7 y 2 años de edad. Juntos viven en la casa que construyó junto a su cónyuge como fruto de mucho trabajo. 

Ella se dedica al servicio de mantenimiento, cambio de repuestos y limpieza de motores fuera de borda. Tiene su negocio instalado en una balsa flotante asentada en el río. Su trabajo le brinda buenos ingresos y se siente muy tranquila ejerciendo esta función, lo hace con la ayuda de su pareja desde hace 2 años y gracias a la buena calidad que demuestran han sabido consolidar una buena clientela. Trabaja por las mañanas, mientras que en las tardes regresa a su hogar a cumplir con las funciones de ama de casa, y su cónyuge continúa brindando el servicio. Ahora desea establecer una tienda de abarrotes en su casa para no descuidar su hogar y estar atenta del cuidado de sus hijos. 

Este es su tercer crédito con MFP y está muy contenta por el apoyo financiero que le permitirá avanzar con sus planes de su negocio. Además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual y sobre todo compenetrarse más con los integrantes de su banco comunal que son muy solidarios.
Con el monto solicitado, 1000 soles, comprará más de los repuestos y herramientas que necesita para continuar con su labor.
texts.en:
Reyna is 28 years old. She is a friendly, good, and responsible person. Her partner of 13 years is Pascual, with whom she has 3 children: 11, 7, and 2 years old. They live in a house they built together as a fruit of their labor. 

She makes a living performing service maintenance, replacing parts, and cleaning outboard motors. This business is located in a raft situated on the river. 

Her work has brought in significant revenue, and she feels very comfortable doing it. She does it with the help of her partner for 2 years ago. 

Thanks to the high quality of work they demonstrated, they were able to gain good customers. 

She works in the mornings, returns home to complete the functions of the housewife in the afternoons. Her husband continues attending to clients in her place. 

Currently, she wants to set up a grocery store in her home so she does not have to leave it and can attend more to her children. 

This is her third loan with MFP (Microfinanzas Prisma) and Reyna is very happy with the financial support that will help her advance her business plans. In addition, she is committed to repaying the installments in a timely manner, and above all improve upon the relationship with her communal bank's members who are very supportive. 

With the amount requested, 1000 soles, she will buy more spare parts and tools needed to continue her work.

loans.use: to buy more spare parts and tools needed to continue with her work.

loans.name: Mariluz Pilar

texts.es:
Mariluz es una mujer de 59 años, vive en la ciudad de Nazca con sus 2 hijas, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante  a su familia, lamentablemente por diversas razones Mariluz decidió separarse de su pareja, desde entonces ella ha sido padre y madre para sus hijas; gracias a su esfuerzo con mucho empeño ella estudió la carrera técnica de Contabilidad, en sus ratos libres le gusta dedicar un poco de tiempo a la lectura y en algunas ocasiones cocina un delicioso Ají de Gallina para compartir con su familia.
Con mucho empeño y entusiasmo, Mariluz trabajó como Auxiliar Contable en una pequeña empresa de su ciudad, ahora ella se gana la vida alquilando un pequeño local para diversas ocasiones, ella dedica a su negocio un aproximado de 8 horas diarias y cree que le va bien por las facilidades y el trato amable que brinda a sus clientes.
Mariluz se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá cubrir los gastos de estudios de una de sus hijas, tales como: pago de matrícula, mensualidades, folletería y útiles diversos; de esta manera Mariluz podrá brindar la educación que se hija necesita para convertirse en una gran profesional, ya que ese es su más grande sueño, así ella seguirá trabajando y esforzándose por sacar adelante a su familia.
texts.en:
Mariluz, 59, lives in the city of Nazca with her two daughters.  She’s a very kind, hardworking, enthusiastic person who focuses all her efforts into moving her family forward.  Unfortunately, due to a variety of reasons, Mariluz had to separate from her spouse and since then she’s been both father and mother to her daughters.  Thanks to her effort and with much dedication she completed the career of accounting.  In her free time she enjoys spending a little time reading and sometimes cooks a delicious “Ají de Gallina” to share with her family.

She worked as an accounting assistant for a small firm in her city with much effort and enthusiasm and today earns her living renting a small site for various occasions.  She spends about 8 hours daily in her business and believes she does well because of the easy terms and the kind service she offers her customers.

Mariluz is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the support she’s gotten she’ll be able to cover the educational costs like tuition, monthly fees, copying services and school supplies for one of her daughters.  In this way, Mariluz will be able to provide her daughter with the education she needs to become a great professional since that’s her greatest dream.  She will continue working and striving to move her family forward.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter's schooling.

loans.name: Jose Antonio

texts.es:
Jose es un hombre muy trabajador, vive en el distrito de Santiago, Ica, Perú. El cual se caracteriza por su clima cálido y acogedor, asimismo se desarrolla la agricultura en especial el cultivo de esparrago, uva, algodón, entre otros. Jose es muy trabajador, desde pequeño aprendió a trabajar, ya que quedo huérfano de madre desde muy pequeño y tuvo la necesidad de ayudar en casa, debido a ello solo estudio hasta el quinto grado de secundaria  debido a sus pocos recursos económicos, el se dedico a su trabajo como albañil, ya que con ello apoya con los gastos de su hogar, el trabaja alrededor de 10 horas al día y cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy trabajador y sobre todo porque tiene muchas ganas de salir adelante.

Jose está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar herramientas para realizar sus trabajos como madera, martillos, lampas, cinceles, barretas, entre otros; de esta manera ya no tendrá que alquilar los materiales que necesita y podrá tener sus propias herramientas, así el seguirá trabajando muy duro para hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Estudiar la carrera de Ingeniería Civil”.
texts.en:
José’s a hardworking man living in the Santiago district of Ica, Perú which is noted for its hot, welcoming climate.  Agriculture is commonplace here too, especially growing asparagus, grapes and cotton, among others.  

José is very hardworking and learned to work when still little since his mother died when he was still very little and he had to help around the house.  Because of that, he only studied up to 5th grade in secondary school due to his limited economic resources.  He works in construction and that is how he helps with household expenses.  He works about 10 hours per day and believes he does well in his business because he’s very hardworking and above all because he has a strong drive to get ahead.

José is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the support they’ve given him he will be able to buy work tools he needs like lumber, hammers, pickaxes, chisels and crowbars, among others.  In this way he will no longer have to rent the tools he needs and he will be able to have his own tools to continue working hard to make his greatest dream a reality: to study civil engineering.

loans.use: to buy tools and supplies.

loans.name: Juan

texts.en:
Juan is a Peruvian artisan who designs and crafts jewelry that features Andean silver and gemstones. He would like to buy materials such as silver and gemstones in order to increase production.  Juan has been selling through NOVICA since 2004. This is his story: "My wife Rosario and I once ran a clothing shop, but financial hardship struck. We were both interested in designing jewelry, and at first we relied on expert silversmiths," he said. "I was fascinated with the process of making jewelry and became an eager student – I now design and craft my own jewelry. My style is different than my wife's, and we are both proud to see how far we have come. I'm driven by a desire to excel, and I strive to transmit beauty and quality.  My jewelry comes from my inspiration to bring out a woman's natural beauty. Thanks to you, I've been able to be a part of this great endeavor. I appreciate your assistance with this microcredit."

Use the link below to view Juan's jewelry on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/artistdetail/index.cfm?faid=4424
