loans.use: to buy materials such as silver and gemstones to increase production

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay schooling costs and to buy merchandise for her business.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en: Emmanuel is 30 years old, married, and has two children between the ages of 7 and 17. He sells cattle, from 6 a.m. until 10 a.m. every day. He currently employs two people to help him, and he has three years of experience in this work. Emmanuel has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to buy more cattle to resell. He plans to use any profits generated from this loan to satisfy his family's basic needs and to reinvest in his business.

loans.use: To buy more cattle to sell

loans.name: Deysi Isabel

texts.es:
Doña Deysi es una persona muy emprendedora dedicado 100% a su negocio, vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos. En el departamento de Choluteca en el sur de Honduras. Ella tiene más de 13 años de tener este tipo de negocio.
Doña Deysi el préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de carne, pollo, arroz, frijoles, manteca, café, pan, etc. de esta manera incrementara más sus ventas. Con el préstamo espera superar sus ventas y satisfacer y mejorar las necesidades de sus clientes. También espera obtener mejores ingresos para tener mejor calidad de vida.
Doña Deysi sus sueños es poder mejorar su negocio, en hacerlo más grande como un mini mercado y de esta manera poder ayudar a su familia.
Choluteca, Honduras - Julio del 2012
texts.en:
Deysi is a very entrepreneurial person, dedicated 100% to her business. 

She lives with her husband and three children in the south of Honduras, belonging to the state department of Choluteca. 

She has had this type of business over 13 years. 

Deysi will invest the loan in the purchase of meat, chicken, rice, beans, lard, coffee, bread, and other things to increase her sales. 

With this loan she hopes to raise sales and meet or exceed the needs of her clients. In addition, she hopes to have greater profits for a better quality of life. 

Her dreams are to be able to improve her business, make it as large as a mini market, and be able to support her family.

Choluteca, Honduras - July 2012

loans.use: to buy meat, chicken, rice, beans, lard, coffee, bread, and other things for her business.

loans.name: Sifa

texts.en:
Sifa is 29 years old. She is married to a house builder. 

She sells vegetables and has spent eight years in the business. With the loan, she wants to add more vegetables for sale. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for the children.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables for sale.

loans.name: Mujeres Activas Group

texts.en:
In the rural community of Xetuj, Quetzaltenango, located in the Northwest of Guatemala, many families are engaged in agriculture and commerce, as is the case of the 14 women who make up the Trust Bank Mujeres Activas (Active Women).

Among the group is María, a 41-year-old woman, who is married and has eight children (four girls and four boys), five of whom are still in school.  One of her children is starting seventh grade this year, which is a benchmark year, since most children drop out by the sixth grade, if they make it that far. In fact, María did not have the opportunity to attend school at all. For several years, María and her husband have devoted their energy and resources to agricultural activities. They grow vegetables such as carrots, radishes, cabbage, cauliflower, and potatoes on seven acres of land. They sell their products in nearby markets.  Maria also engages in the purchase and resale of vegetables while she is at the market, so that she leverages the use of her time.  

María is an enterprising, able woman who has designs to grow her economic prospects.  With this loan, she wants to add two new small enterprises: growing flowers and raising chickens.  She intends to use the loan to buy vegetable seeds to augment her current business, flower seeds, and four-dozen chickens. This is what María says of her loan, "I am delighted to receive this new loan, and I'm very eager for my two new projects, and my family supports me." 

The 14 women of Mujeres Activas are very active and participatory. They love to participate during the monthly trainings delivered by a Friendship Bridge staff, where they discuss topics such as women's health, hygiene, children's rights, self-esteem, business administration, and money administration, among others. The Mujers Activas group is thankful for the support that the Kiva investors provide for them.

loans.use: to buy seeds and chickens

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama lives together with her husband and two children near Abura. Ama is a seamstress, which she has done for three years now.

Ama uses her income to support her husband in paying their accommodation and utility bills. She will use her loan to purchase fabric to sew. With the new profit she will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fabric to sew

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama  sells maize at Manpong near Abura, which she has done for four years now.  Ama is married to a farmer and has five dependants.  She uses her income to support her husband in feeding, clothing and paying their children’s school fees.
Ama will use her loan to purchases bags of maize to sell.  With the new profit, she will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase bags of maize to sell

loans.name: Hasina

texts.en: Hasina is a mother of five children. She is 46 years old and married to a businessman. She owns a restaurant and has been running the restaurant for two years. With the loan, she wants to add more foodstuffs to be used in the restaurant. The profits from the business will be reinvested in the business.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs to use in the restaurant.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To cultivate more rice to sell.

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en: Pauline is 26 years old. She is married and has two children. She sells foodstuffs and has been in the business for five years. With the loan, she wants to buy more beans to sell. The profits from the business will be used to provide food for the family.

loans.use: To buy more beans to sell

loans.name: Efua

texts.en:
Efua extracts coconut oil to sell at Abura. Around her is the  coconut drupe she uses to  extract the oil. 
She is a single parent taking care of six chilren. Efua has been in this business for six years. She sees to the well-being of her home with the income she makes from her sales. 
Her loan will be used to buy more coconuts to extract  oil to sell. Efua hopes to use the new profits from her business to invest back into the business.

loans.use: to buy more coconuts to extract  oil to sell

loans.name: Juan Guillermo

texts.es:
Juan Guillermo tiene 26 años y nació en Bucaramanga, Colombia. Él tenía el sueño de ser futbolista profesional algún día y le dedicó mucho tiempo y esfuerzo a los entrenamientos y competiciones. Todo esto hizo que fuera muy difícil estudiar en una de las universidades más exigentes en el área de Ingeniería de Colombia, la Universidad Industrial de Santander (UIS).

En un viaje con su equipo de fútbol se dio cuenta que lo que más quería en su vida era dedicarse a la ingeniería y sacar buenas notas en su carrera. En sus últimos semestres de carrera fue de los mejores alumnos de su clase. Además, obtuvo una tesis honorífica en sus estudios sobre Bioingeniería sobre señales eléctricas cardiacas. 

Ahora Juan Guillermo tiene el sueño de realizar una maestría en ingeniería electrónica e innovación en Francia y necesita el apoyo de Kiva para poder financiar los gastos de preparación de exámenes de idioma e inscripción a estos mismos ya que no tiene otra forma de pagarlos.

Aquí esta su historia:

El propósito de la vida es el constante crecimiento, creo que como seres humanos estamos en continuo aprendizaje y cada vivencia trae consigo una enseñanza.

En mi caso quiero cada día crecer más y más,  y el estudio es la base de ello. Una formación superior en el extranjero catalizaría mi crecimiento académico y personal.  Prepararía mi  mente a la llegada nuevas ideas, fomentaría el intercambio intercultural ante otras personas y me brindaría un trasfondo académico importante, razones coherentes para desear estudiar en otro país. 

Hoy en día surge la necesidad de cambiar las cosas cuando toman un rumbo indeseado, cualquier proceso tiene inevitables modificaciones, es cierto. Pero a manera personal creo que lo más indicado seria reformularlas en el momento de su creación. Innovación, estrategia y emprendimiento serian las herramientas que me permitirían actuar en el escenario anteriormente mencionado. Conocer a fondo cada detalle, con numerosas herramientas en el extranjero que me permitan aplicar esto en mi país seria mi aspiración en ese sentido. 

Pactado a lo anterior me veo  en un futuro volviendo a mi país generando nuevos proyectos, buscando soluciones ante diversos problemas de ingeniería y lo más importante desarrollando ideas de sustentabilidad en un territorio rico en recursos no renovables.

A pesar de que encontré un trabajo en junio, me tardaría por lo menos 15 meses de ahorro, calculando que pueda ahorrar 65 mil pesos mensuales (30 US $). El programa KIVA me ayudaría en el proceso de estudiar por fuera de Colombia, estimularía mi proyecto de forma logística y económica para poder cumplir aquello que tengo soñado.
texts.en:
Juan Guillermo, age 26, was born in Bucaramanga, Colombia.  He had the dream of being a professional soccer player one day, and he spent a lot of time and effort in the trainings and competitions.  All of this made it very difficult to study at one of the most demanding universities in the area of Engineering in Colombia, the Universidad Industrial de Santander (UIS).

On a trip with his soccer team he realized that what he wanted most in life was to devote himself to engineering and to get good grades in his courses.  In the last semesters of the courses for his degree he was among the best students in his class.  Also, he obtained honors for his thesis in his studies of Bioengineering about electrical cardiac signals.

Now Juan Guillermo dreams of getting his Master’s in Innovation Electrical Engineering in France.  He needs support from Kiva to be able to pay the expenses for enrollment and preparation for the language exams.  He does not have any other way of paying for them.

Here is his story:

Life’s purpose is constant growth.  I believe that as human beings we are continually learning, and each experience brings with it a lesson.  In my case, I want to grow more and more each day.  Studying is the foundation for this.  Post graduate studies abroad will serve as a catalyst for my academic and personal growth.  It would prepare my mind to receive new ideas, and it would promote an intercultural exchange between people.  It would provide me with an important academic background.  These are meaningful reasons to wish to study in another country.

Nowadays the need arises to change things when they take an undesirable turn.  Any process has inevitable modifications; that is true.  However, I personally believe that what is most called for would be to turn them around at the time they happen.  Innovation, strategy, and entrepreneurship would be the tools that would allow me to act in the previously mentioned scenario.  Knowing each detail in depth, with numerous tools abroad, allows me to apply this in my country.  This is my aspiration in that regard.

With the above permitting, I see myself in the future returning to my country, generating new projects, and looking for solutions to diverse engineering problems.  The most import thing is developing ideas about sustainability in a territory that is rich in resources that are not renewable.

In spite of the fact that I found a job in June, it would take me at least 15 months of savings, calculating that I can save 65 thousand pesos ($30 US) a month.  The Kiva program would help me in the process of studying outside of Colombia.  It would activate my project logistically and financially in order to be able to fulfill that which I have dreamed.

loans.use: to pay the application expenses to study for a Master's Degree in  Innovation Technology and Entrepreneurship.

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en: Hannah lives in West Point. She is 50 years old and married with four children between 16 and 31 years old. For 20 years, she has been running a table business where she sells pepper, oil, vita, onions, okra, and rice in the market. She received a little amount of money from her husband to start her business and learned it from her mother. She likes her business because she makes more profit. She is requesting a loan to purchase more pepper, oil, vita, onions, okra, and rice for her business. Her plan is to build a house for her children and send them to quality.

loans.use: to purchase more pepper, oil, vita, onions, okra, and rice for her  business

loans.name: Miguel

texts.en:
Miguel, 62 years old, is a married entrepreneur of Ozamis City with one child. Miguel earns from his gardening business. It has been going for almost 30 years now and he earns 3,000 PHP (Phillipine peso) a month. 

To improve his business, he will borrow 5,000 PHP from GDMPC micro credit which he just joined recently to buy fertilizer. Before long, he’s hopeful of the possibility to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Sokhon's Group

texts.en:
Sokhon, aged 49, is a mother of five children. She resides in Battambang province's Moung Russey district.  She survives with the daily basic needs through the farming income from a two-hectare area of rice as her main source of income. Having been in this business for five years, she is able to make almost 17,000 KHR. Insufficient working capital is the main challenge, which has affected the income of Sokhon. 

This is the third-cycle loan for Sokhon with Kiva's partner, VisionFund. She has completely paid back the entire loans with success and this has aided her to better support her standard lifestyle. 

Now, she is the leader of a microloan group consisting of two female members; her member is a fifth-time borrower who applies for 800,000 KHR. For Sokhon, her requesting amount is 1,000,000 KHR, and she will use this loan to buy five sacks of fertilizer and to pay for plowing fees. 

She hopes to grow her paddy rice in a timely manner and double her yield, so she can sustain her living condition.

loans.use: to buy five sacks of fertilizer and to pay for plowing fees.

loans.name: Josiane

texts.en: Josiane is 28 years old. She sells beans and has been in the business for two years. She wants the loan to buy more beans to sell. She plans to use the profits to buy construction materials because she wants to build a house that can be a source of earnings in the future.

loans.use: To buy more beans to sell

loans.name: Alphonsine

texts.en: Alphonsine is 45 years old. She is married and has five children between 4 and 14 years old. She sells different items such as rice, sugar and salt. She has been in the business for the past eight years. With the loan, she wants to add more rice, salt and sugar to sell. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for the children.

loans.use: To buy more sugar, maize flour and cooking oil to sell.

loans.name: Ny's Group

texts.en:
Originally from the Sangke district of Battambang Province, Ny is 52 years old and a mother of eight children. Three of her children are still in school, while the remaining five children are working for others for a fee. 

To overcome the family's financial burden to support her household, she makes a living from catching fishes; it is the business that she has been with for 35 years. To add more income, her husband also works as a paid worker. 

Ny is a first-cycle loan borrower with Kiva's partner VisionFund, the same cycle as the other two fellow group members. Her group consists of three female members and she is the group leader. 

Ny will use her portion of the loan to buy cast net for her fish catching business. She hopes to catch more fishes for sale and generate more income for her family's sake.

loans.use: to buy cast net for her fish catching business.

loans.name: Catalina

texts.en:
Catalina is 54 years old and married. She is from Kinuman Sur, Ozamis City. She has one child who has helped her in taking care of their gardening business. They have been in business for eight years and earn 2,000 PHP a month. 

In 2010, Catalina joined GDMPC. She has requested a loan of 3,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer. She hopes for a bountiful harvest and to expand her cultivated area.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for her gardening business.

loans.name: Patience

texts.en: Patience lives in West Point. She is 24 years old and married with two children between 4 and 9 years old. For the past three years now, she has been selling palm oil at the local market. She received a little amount of money from her husband to start her business and learned it from friends. She likes her business because it helps her to send her children to school (she paid her children's school fees). She is requesting a loan to purchase more palm oil by the gallon for her business. She wishes to become an international businesswoman.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil to sell

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en: Elsa is a 44-year-old resident of Kinuman Sur, Ozamis City. With the help of her husband, Elsa has been cultivating corn for about 9 years now, and this has become their main source of income. They usually earn 6,000 PHP monthly. She and her husband have to persevere even at their age in order to provide a good education for their 7 children. This year she is borrowing 10,000 PHP from GDMPC micro finance to buy more corn seeds to cultivate. She hopes to improve the business someday.

loans.use: to buy more corn seeds to cultivate

loans.name: Belinda

texts.en: Belinda is married with two children. She is 34 years old and lives in Sta. Cruz, Tangub City. Belinda owns and operates a plot of farm land, planting bananas to earn a living.  She has been in this business for 5 years and earns 4,000 PHP each month. She has requested a loan of 6,900 PHP to purchase farm chemicals. She has been a member of Kiva partner GDMPC since 2009. In the future, Belinda's plan is to save her profits in order to buy a new lot for her farm.

loans.use: to purchase farm chemicals

loans.name: Presencia

texts.en:
Presencia is 66 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with six children. 

Presencia has a small store that sells snacks and spices. She has had this business for eleven years. She requested a loan for 6,000 PHP to buy more snacks and spices to resell.

Presencia has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy more spices and snacks to resell.

loans.name: Javzandulam

texts.en:
Mrs. Javzandulam, 45 years old, lives with her husband and two children in a house in Bayanzurh district of Ulaanbaatar. Her husband`s name is Idersaikhan. Her son is college student, and her daughter helps with her business. 

Since 1995, Mrs. Javzandulam has been working as a teacher in the kindergarten, and she was also doing a kindergarten business on the second floor of her house during the summer vacation of public kindergarten. She is well-experienced in this sector. 

She is asking for 6,000,000 MNT to install a plumbing system and insulation for her kindergarten house. She is honest, and her family members are hardworking people. She says, ''I have to prepare my house for the children.''

loans.use: to install a plumbing system and insulation for her kindergarten house.

loans.name: Musu

texts.en: Musu, 48, is a widow with two children aged 15 and 18. They live at West Point. Her children are in school. She has been working very hard to meet the needs of her children. For the past nine years, she has been selling raw fish in the community market.  She learned to sell from her aunty. She likes this type of business because she makes a profit. With the profit, she buys cartons of raw fish for the business. She is requesting a loan to purchase more cartons of fish to increase her sales.  Her dream is to give her children a higher level of education.

loans.use: to purchase more cartons of fish to sell

loans.name: Marry Ann Losel

texts.en: Marry Ann Losel is married with 5 children. She is 37 years old, and resides at Nailon, Tudela. She owns and operates a plot of farm land, planting & harvesting rice to earn a living. She has been in this business for 13 years, and earns 7,000 PHP each month. She has requested a loan of 8,000 PHP to purchase fertilizers and seedlings for the next crop. Recently, Marry Ann joined GDMPC. In the future, she wants to make improvements to her house and to the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and seedlings for the next crop

loans.name: Martha

texts.en: Martha is a petty trader and also operates a grocery shop at Abura. She has done this for five years now. The items in her grocery shop are milk, milo, sugar, soups, tinned tomatoes, tinned fish, biscuits, toffees, and other food items. She is married with two children. Martha uses her income to help her husband pay their utility bills. She will use her loan to purchase a variety of grocery and food items to sell. With the new profit,  Martha plans to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of grocery and food items to sell

loans.name: Ma. Amor

texts.en: Ma. Amor is from Sta. Cruz, Tangub City. She is 42 years old. Ma. Amor is married and has 5 children. To make a living, Ma. Amor owns and operates a banana plantation business. Ma. Amor has been engaged in her business for 5 years and earns 5,000 PHP each month for these activities. In 2009, Ma. Amor joined GDMPC. Ma. Amor is requesting a loan of 12,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand it.

loans.use: To purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise

loans.name: Kong

texts.en:
Kong is 49 years old and married with five grown-up children, one of whom is employed while the rest are still students at a local school. Kong is raising his family in a small village of the Baray district, where he works in a rice-farming business and a horse-transportation business. Despite the hardship of his living conditions, he aims to improve his current businesses to increase his income, and thus satisfy his family's needs. One of the most important things is to provide a higher education for his children, so that they might have a better future.

Kong would like to renovate his present house so as to ensure comfortable living conditions for his family. Kong is taking out a loan of 2,000,000 KHR to purchase a dump truck to excavate dirt to fill the lower part of his house, which will prevent his house from getting flooded. He hopes to improve the living conditions of his family.

loans.use: To purchase a dump truck to excavate dirt to fill the lower part of his house, which will prevent his house from getting flooded

loans.name: Shonali

texts.en:
Some people find their calling at a young age. There is an influence, interaction or experience that grabs hold of their curiosity and transforms it into a passion. Such is the case for Shonali. Growing up assisting her mother in the kitchen, the combination of smells and tastes emanating from pots and pans inspired her then, and to this day, to discover how to replicate, improve and create concoctions of her own.

Valuing quality time with friends and family, Shonali has always looked for any excuse to host people. Seeing others take delight in her food has always brought her a lot of joy, and was what ultimately inspired her to start her own business. Beginning with a cookbook, she soon started conducting private cooking classes and eventually created her own line of spice blends, infused oils, and sauces. She ran into many obstacles in trying to get her business off the ground. She shares, “I did not even know where to go to figure out where to go.” Despite this, her persistence and passion for food has brought her to a point where she is ready to distribute her spices to larger grocery stores in the area.

Shonali’s Kiva loan will allow her to receive the proper health and wholesale certifications and to hire a part-time employee to assist her with in-store tastings and other outreach avenues. She is hoping that the community she has always valued and tried to support will do the same for her.

loans.use: to pay for licensing and hire additional employees

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en: Teresita is from Guingona, Ozamis City. She is 35 years old. Teresita is married and has 7 children. To make a living, Teresita owns and operates a general store that sells a variety of different products in the local community. Teresita has been in this business for 5 years and earns 4,000 PHP a month for these activities. In 2008, Teresita joined GDMPC. Teresita is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products like canned goods, noodles, sugar and coffee. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from her business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: To purchase additional products like canned goods, noodles, sugar and coffee

loans.name: Annie

texts.en: Annie lives in West Point. She is 48 years old and married with six children between 6 and 13 years old. They are in school and live at home. For the past years now, Annie has been selling rice in the market. She started this with money given to her by her husband, and learned this way of selling from her mother. She enjoys the way customers respond to her business. She is requesting a loan to purchase more rice for her business. In the future, she wants to become an international businesswoman.

loans.use: to purchase more rice for her business

loans.name: Adelphine

texts.en: Adelphine is 35 years old. She is married with four children. All her children attend school. She has been selling beans and sorghum for seven years. She wants the loan to buy more beans and sorghum for sale. The profits from the business will be used to build a house to rent.

loans.use: To buy more beans and sorghum to sell

loans.name: Marie Jeanne

texts.en: Marie Jeanne is 23 years old. She has been selling rice and soaps for three years. With the loan, she wants to buy more rice and soaps to sell. She plans to use the profits to build a house.

loans.use: To buy more rice and soap to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for new signage and air-conditioning repairs

loans.name: Enhsanaa

texts.en: Mrs. Enhsanaa lives with her husband and two children in a ger in the Uvs province, Mongolia. Her husband, Anhbayar, works at a local company; his salary is 300,000 - 350,000 MNT. Her oldest daughter, Amgalanzaya, is 19 years old, and her youngest daughter, Tumennasan, is 18 years old.  They are both college students. Mrs. Enhsanaa started a one-hectare organic vegetable and fruit farm in 2011. She has 7,000 pieces of organic seabuckthorn and 100 pieces of organic bilberry in her own courtyard. Her family members are all hardworking and careful people. She needs 3,500,000 MNT to pay for a wood fence for her organic vegetable garden.

loans.use: To pay for a wood fence for her organic vegetable garden

loans.name: Jackelina

texts.en:
Jackelina is 47 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 2 children. 

Jackelina has a store that sells hardware like saws, hammers, masking tape, and glue guns. She has had this business for 7 years. She requested a loan for 5,000 PHP to buy more items to sell.

Jackelina is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Jackelina hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy hardware to sell

loans.name: Marie Rose

texts.en: Marie Rose is 30 years old. She is married and has three children between three and nine years old. She sells clothes and has spent seven years in the business. With the loan, she wants to add more clothes to sell. The profits from the business will be used to buy more clothes to sell. The profits from the business will be saved.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Judith

texts.en: Judith is 45 years old. She sells beans and sorghum and has been in the business for 21 years. With the loan, she will buy more beans and sorghum to sell. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for the children.

loans.use: To buy more beans and sorghum to sell

loans.name: Huhii

texts.en: Mr. Huhii is 54 years old and lives with his wife and son in a leased apartment in the Han-Uul district of Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. His wife, Gantogoo, is 53 years old. She is a cook in a restaurant. His son, Munkhdelger, is 25 years old. He is freelance television producer. Mr. Huhii is employed and is also the manager of an apartment owner's association. In the past, he worked for a non-government organization. He is a hardworking and helpful person. His home is on the periphery of the town, and his wife and son work downtown. He is planning to reduce the family's expenses by buying a car that is more economical to operate.  He needs 4,100,000 MNT to purchase a Prius.

loans.use: To purchase a Prius for his family

loans.name: Ekué

texts.fr: Âgé de 37ans, Mr Ekué est père de 02 enfants tous sur les bancs d’école. Ils ont 08 et 06ans. Sa femme est infirmière. Mr Ekué quant à lui est chirurgien gynécologue. Il sert ses clients dans un hôpital et a en même temps dans un cabinet médical. Il demande auprès de WAGES un premier prêt pour acheter un écran pour son appareil d’échographie. Il voudrait créer une grande clinique de renommée mondiale et envoyer ses enfants dans une école où la médecine est enseignée au cours élémentaire.
texts.en:
Mr. Ekué is 37 years old and the father of two children. They both attend school and are 8 and 6 years old. 

His wife is a nurse. Mr. Ekué is a gynecologic surgeon. He serves his patients in a hospital and also has a private medical practice.

He is making a request from WAGES for a first time to purchase a screen for his ultrasound machine. He would like to set up a large clinic with a world reputation and send his children to a school where medicine would be taught at the elementary level.

loans.use: to purchase a screen for his ultrasound machine

loans.name: Puita

texts.en: Puita lives in West Point. She is 41 years old and married to a businessman. They have six children between 12 and 17 years old. For nine years now, she has been selling soft drinks in her community. She received money from her husband to start her business, which she learned from her mother. She likes her business because she makes more profit. She is requesting a loan to purchase more soft drinks for her business. Her plan is to build a house for her children.

loans.use: to purchase more soft drinks to sell

loans.name: Mondaymah

texts.en: Mondaymah, 48, lives in Congo town with her husband. She has four children. Three of the children are independent and only one of them stays with her at home. She has been involved in this business for the past 10 years. She sells used clothes like women's blouses and skirts and men's shirts. She learned to sell when she was younger from her parent. What she loves most about her business is when customers are buying. She started this business with a little income that she received from her husband.  She is requesting this loan to purchase more used clothes for her business. Her plan is to become an international businesswoman.

loans.use: to purchase more used clothes to sell

loans.name: Oyunbold

texts.en:
Oyunbold, 24 years old, is a coach of the fight sport and has a black belt of his sport. He has been teaching for four years, one of the skillful masters in Mongolia. 

Currently he does not have his own house.  He is living in his brother’s old house with his wife.  (He doesn't have a child, but he has a plan to have a baby as soon as possible.) 

In the winter, his house becomes cold because of the heat loss through the wall. The house was built with very thin mud walls. Therefore Oyunbold is requesting a loan to add insulation to his house walls. The loan will be used to pay for the building materials to thicken the house walls.

loans.use: To pay for building materials to thicken the house walls.

loans.name: Araba

texts.en: Araba works as a petty trader and operates a grocery shop at Abura. This she has done for 10 years now. The items in her grocery shop are milk, milo, sugar, soups, canned tomatoes, canned fish, biscuits, toffees, and other food items. She is married with six children. Araba uses her income to help her husband in the general up keep of their family. She will use her loan to purchase a variety of grocery and food items to sell. With the new profit, Araba  plans to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of grocery and food items to sell

loans.name: Davaasuren

texts.en:
Davaasuren lives with his wife and four children in a small house, in Uvs province, Mongolia. His wife Serjmaa is 39 years old. His oldest son  Altantulhuur is 16 years old; his oldest daughter Tsolmongerel is 12 years old; his youngest son Tserentogtoh is 10 years old, and his youngest daughter Otgontsetseg is 3 years old. His three older children are secondary school students. His youngest daughter stays at home. 

Davaasuren started to clean carpets in June 2012, with his wife. Now his business has four workmen. 

He is planning to expand his customer base, but to do this he needs 1,000,000 MNT to purchase additional equipment and supplies for his new business. He is an honest, hardworking, and quiet natured man.

loans.use: To purchase additional equipment and supplies for his new business.

loans.name: Batchuluun

texts.en:
Mr. Batchuluun, 52, is one of the skillful drivers of Mongolia. Since 2008, he has been operating a taxi business and before that, he worked as a driver in the state organization. Currently he lives with his wife and his 2 children in his house in the ger district: Mongolian traditional yurts and cheap houses on the boundary of Ulaanbaatar, which is the capital city of Mongolia. 

Batchuluun is a kind of preservationist man and he always cares about the environment. This time he is requesting a loan to repair the inside of his house and his low-pressure furnace in order to cut heat loss and emissions. He really worries that he uses too much coal and wood just to get his house warm inside. He has decided to cut his usage of fuel. 

With this loan, he will make wall insulation and renovate the wall borders. He believes his house will be warmer and more comfortable after the repairs. The loan he is taking will be dedicated to pay for his house and furnace repairs to reduce his home's usage of fuels. In addition, he will plant woods in his backyard unless his expenses meet his loan amount.

loans.use: To pay for repairs to his house and furnace to reduce his usage of fuel.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en: Gloria is 49 years old and lives in Kinangay Norte, Clarin. She is married with 5 children. Gloria has been in the business of selling clothing in order to make a living for 8 years, and earns 6,000 PHP per month. She has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC to purchase more clothes to sell. Gloria joined GDMPC in 2011. In the future, she hopes to be more successful in her business.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: Maribeth

texts.en: Maribeth is married with one child. She is 35 years old and resides in Tabid, Misamis Occidental. She operates a business in the agriculture sector, planting & harvesting bananas to earn a living. She has been in this business for 7 years, and earns 3,000 PHP each month. Maribeth has requested a loan of 3,500 PHP to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. In 2012, she joined GDMPC. She hopes to grow her business to improve the living conditions of their family.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise.

loans.name: La Gran Amistad  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
La Gran Amistad es un banco comunal que se encuentra conformado por 8 mujeres quienes viven por la parroquia de Cumbe en Cuenca, todas son amigas y conocidas, son mujeres responsables que luchan el día a día para sacar a sus familias adelante, su principal oficio es la agricultura, cría de animales y comercio. La parroquia de Cumbe tiene un clima frió, su arquitectura es una mezcla entre lo colonial y lo moderno, tiene amplios lugares para disfrutar de la naturaleza, mucha de su gente se dedica a trabajar en la ciudad o han migrado a diferentes partes del mundo para ejercer diferentes actividades las mismas que les permiten mejorar la situación económica de sus hogares, a pesar de todo aun mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Bernardita, es parte del banco comunal La Gran Amistad hace un año,  ella es oriunda del cantón Nabon pero por motivos de trabajo y por los estudios de sus hijos  hace 8 años vive en la parroquia Paccha y cada 28 días viaja a la parroquia de Cumbe en Cuenca para reunirse con su banco comunal y encontrarse con sus amigas, tiene 51 años de edad, está casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 12 hijos, 7 de sus hijos son casados y viven independientes, sus  5 hijos solteros tienen 17, 15, 14, 10 y 8 años de edad, dos estudian en el colegio, un hijo es discapacitado por lo que pasa en casa y sus dos últimos hijos estudian en una escuelita de la localidad. Su esposo labora como albañil. Tiene en su cantón una casa propia, pero en la parroquia de Paccha viven en una casa prestada.

Ella  se dedica a la cría de cuyes y gallinas porque no tiene mucho espacio para criar más animales, pero en su cantón Nabón cultiva sus tierras y lo que cosecha es para el consumo de su casa y para la venta.
 
Su crédito  lo va a invertir en la compra de pollos para tener más variedad de animales.
 
Su sueño es crecer en sus actividades económicas que son la agricultura y la cría de animales para así tratar de darles una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
"La Gran Amistad" is a communal bank that is made up of 8 women who live in Cumbe parish in Cuenca.  They are all friends and acquaintances, and they are responsible women who are struggling each day to provide for their families.  Most of the women work in agriculture, livestock production and retail trade.  Cumbe parish has a cold climate, and its architecture is a mix of colonial and modern styles.  There are a lot of places where one can enjoy nature.  Many of the residents work in the city or have migrated from different parts of the world in order to carry out activities that will allow them to improve the financial situation of their households.  In spite of all of this, they still maintain their culture and the traditions of their towns.

One of the members of this group is Bernardita.  She has been a member of the communal bank "La Gran Amistad" for a year.  Bernardita is a native of Nabon, but for work reasons and for her children's education she's been living in Paccha province for 8 years.  Every 28 days, she travels to Cumbe parish in Cuenca to meet with her communal bank and see her friends.  She is 51 years old and is married.  Together with her husband, she has 12 children: 7 of her children are married and live independently, and her 5 unmarried children are 17, 15, 14, 10 and 8 years of age.  Two of her children are in school, and one child is disabled and so stays in the home.  The two youngest study at a little school in the town. Her husband works as a bricklayer.  In her canton, she has her own house, but in Paccha province they live in a rented home.

Bernardita has a business raising guinea pigs and hens, because she doesn't have a lot of space to raise animals.  But in Nabon canton, she cultivates her land and she uses part of her harvest for her family's consumption, and sells the rest. She will invest this loan in the purchase of chickens so that she can have a greater variety of animals.  Her dream is to expand her economic activities, which include her work in farming and livestock production.  This way she will try to provide a better quality of life for her children.

loans.use: to buy chickens

loans.name: Bayarjargal

texts.en: Mr. Bayarjargal, 28, works as an electrician in the power plant in Dornod, an eastern province of Mongolia. He is one of the skilled staff with six consecutive years of experience. Currently he lives with his wife and his two babies in his sister’s ger, a nomadic Mongolian traditional yurt. Recently he purchased a small plot of land with their savings for his family's needs. Then he started building a small house there. But suddenly he is faced with a shortage of money to buy the building materials. The building work is in the middle stages at the moment and he really wants to complete the outside work before this winter. With babies, living in a ger is very hard and cold in wintertime. He is planning to insulate the wall of his house with this loan.

loans.use: to insulate the wall of his house.

loans.name: Alfonsa

texts.en:
Alfonsa is a 38-year-old woman from the town of Baclayon, Bohol. She is married with a 12-year-old daughter. 

Alfonsa sells fish in her neighborhood and also helps her husband make candles. She's asking for a loan worth 14000 PHP to buy paraffin wax, wick and more fresh fish to resell. 

Once her inputs are available, her increased productivity will follow. Whatever income she generates out of her business will provide her family with enough healthy food as well as on-time payments for her daughter's school fees.

loans.use: to buy paraffin wax, wick and more fresh fish.

loans.name: Bohojy

texts.en: Bohojy is a very clever boy. He graduated from school with excellence and good marks. He was one of the best pupils of his school. He likes math, computer, geography and other subjects. His hobby is listening to music. He is a student in the second course of the Ozody University of Tajikistan in the Faculty of Programming. His parents are workers. Their income is too small to pay for Bohojy’s studies at the university. Bohojy wants to be one of the best programmers in his town. He is purposeful and hardworking. Please help him to realize his dream. He is asking for a loan to pay for his studies at the university. He awaits your support.

loans.use: to pay for his studies at the university

loans.name: Claudia Milenka

texts.es: Claudia tiene 39 años vive en la Zona de San Pedro con sus dos hijas, ella es una persona muy responsable y dedicada a su actividad que es el comercio de prendas de vestir como chompas, chamarras, pantalones, etc. Se dedico a esta actividad hace 4 años ya que no podía conseguir empleo pese a que ella es egresada de la carrera de Sicología pero las circunstancias la obligaron a tomar el camino de la ventas para poder colaborar en su hogar y llevar el alimento diario, ella necesita el crédito para poder comprar mas mercadería y así poder aumentar sus utilidades ya que posee un buen mercado de clientes hace bastante tiempo.  El sueño de Claudia es poder tener un día un negocio propio de una tienda comercial para poder vender la ropa que comercializa y también poder obtener una casa propia con el fruto de su trabajo a lo largo de los años.
texts.en:
Claudia is 39 years old and lives in the San Pedro region with her two daughters.  She is a very responsible person and dedicated to her business, in which she sells garments like sweaters, jackets, pants, etc.  She started working in this business 4 years ago, since she couldn't obtain employment even though she is a college graduate with a degree in Psychology. But, circumstances obligated her to take the path of sales to be able to contribute in her home and bring in daily meals.  

She needs the loan to be able to buy more merchandise and then be able to increase her profits since she has had a good market of clients for plenty of time.  Claudia's dream is to be able to have her own business one day, a store to be able to sell the clothes she markets and also be able to obtain her own house with the fruit of her work throughout the years.

loans.use: to buy  a variety of merchandise, like sweaters, jackets and scarves

loans.name: Margarito

texts.es:
Don Margarito tiene 40 años de edad, vive con su compañera de vida y tienen un hijo. Él se dedica a la agricultura desde que tiene 15 años de edad, oficio que aprendió de su padre. También, trabaja en la crianza de cerdos desde hace 10 años y esa actividad la aprendió de su mamá. Para comprar los productos que necesita aborda un pick up, por carreteras en mal estado durante una media hora hasta que llega a su destino. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar cuatro sacos de fertilizantes, herbicidas, dos cerdos, 8 quintales de alimento para los cerdos y pago de mano de obra para su cosecha de maíz.

Con la inversión, comprara todo lo que necesita para su cultivo, para alimentar a sus cerdos y aumentar la crianza de cerdos y por consiguiente sus ingresos. Don Margarito desea aumentar su granja de cerdos en un corto tiempo, para que sus ingresos mejoren.
texts.en:
Margarito is 40 years old, lives with his life partner, and they have one son.  He has worked in agriculture since he was 15 years old, a profession that he learned from his father.  Also, he has worked raising pigs for 10 years, and he learned about this from his mother.  He makes a half hour journey in a pick up truck on bad roads in order to buy the products he needs.

He is asking for this loan from Fundación Campo to buy 4 sacks of fertilizer, herbicides, 2 pigs, 800 pounds of pig feed, and payment for laborers to help with his corn crop.

With this money, he will buy all that he needs for his crops, to feed and raise his pigs, and consequently for his income.  Margarito wants to expand his pig farm in a short time to increase his earnings.

loans.use: to buy 4 sacks of fertilizer, herbicides, 2 pigs, 800 pounds of pig feed, and payment for laborers to help with his crop of corn

loans.name: Grecelda

texts.en: Grecelda is 35 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 5 children. Grecelda has a sari-sari store (food/retail shop) that buys & sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products & beverages. She has had this business for 3 years. She requested a loan for 4000 PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks & beverages. Grecelda has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Grecelda hopes to improve her business to provide for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Ana

texts.es:
Ana tiene 35 años, tiene dos hijos con lo que vive en su casa propi, la que compró gracias a su empeño en el trabajo.
Hace 15 años que se dedica a la agricultura, cultiva cacao y café. En los tiempos de cosecha y mantenimiento (desyerbar y fertilizar), cuenta con el apoyo de jornaleros para que de esa manera logre culminar su trabajo de manera rápida. Las cosechas que obtiene en cada temporada, ósea cada 06 meses, son comercializadas en los centros de acopio, quienes le remuneran con un buen precio por cada kilogramo de su producto. Para más adelante anhela seguir cultivando plantas de cacao y café, pero en mayor cantidad de las que tiene ahora.

Este es su primer crédito con MFP y se siente agradecida con quienes hacen lo posible. En su banco comunal es una socia responsable y agradecida por la oportunidad que le brindan.
Con estos 2,500 nuevos soles arrendará un terreno con frutos de cacao para poder cosecharlos y comercializarlos luego.
texts.en:
Ana is 35 years old and has two children, whom she lives with in her own house, which she bought thanks to her strong work ethic.

She has worked in agriculture for 15 years, growing cacao and coffee.  When it is harvest time and when maintaining her crop (weeding and fertilizing), she counts on the assistance of workmen so that she can finish the work rapidly.  The harvests that she obtains in each season, or at least every 6 months, are sold commercially in the collection centers, where she is paid a good price for each kilogram of her product.  She longs to continue cultivating cacao and coffee plants, but in higher quantities than what she has now.

This is her first loan with MFP and she feels grateful to those that make it possible.  She is a responsible member in her communal bank and is grateful for the opportunity that it offers.

With these 2,500 Peruvian soles she will lease some land with cacao plants so that she can harvest them and later sell them.

loans.use: to lease some land with cacao plants so that she can harvest them and later sell them

loans.name: Erdenetsetseg

texts.en: Mrs. Erdenetsetseg, 47, runs a taxi around the districts of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She has approximately 6-7 shifts a day and this is the main income source for her family. Her husband, Batsaikhan, is also a taxi driver and he usually operates intercity passenger transportation. Currently she lives with her husband and son in their old house in the ger district of Ulaanbaatar – an area of the city with no running water, minimal roads and spotty electricity. Erdenetsetseg requested a loan to build an entrance hall to her house in order to reduce heat loss through the door. With her plans, the family will cut the usage of fuel in the winter. Also, she will use the hall to keep some house holdings and things. The loan she is taking out will be used to pay for the building materials to build an entrance hall to her house. She will build it with her husband and son themselves.

loans.use: to pay for building materials to build an entrance hall to her house to reduce heat loss through the door.

loans.name: Kong

texts.en:
Kong is 46 years old and a married mother who is responsible for four children. She lives with them and her spouse in Kampong Chhnang Province. Kong describes herself as dedicated to her work. She runs a sewing business from her home. She especially sews nets, used to protect animals from small biting insects. At the same time, Kong also owns a small pig farm with a few piglets to fatten for sale when mature. Kong would like to reinvest the profit from the two businesses in selling corn in order to make a better income in the future. 

Due to the lack of transportation for her corn trading business, Kong is asking for a loan of 2,000,000 riels (KHR) to purchase a motorcycle to support her business. She hopes that with her loan, she can provide her family with enough basic living needs, especially her children’s education.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle for her business.

loans.name: Tres Pascualas Group

texts.es:
Este Banco Comunal se llama “Tres Pascualas” está conformado por 15 emprendedores quienes se dedican a diferentes rubros, entre los cuales se encuentran; venta de ropa y carteras, venta de ensaladas, venta de verduras, venta de pan amasado, confección, imprenta, servicios entre otros. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la ciudad de Concepción.
Marta integrante del grupo del Banco Comunal, quien en la foto se encuentra de pie en primera fila, ocupando el segundo lugar de derecha a izquierda, viste un pantalón y una chaqueta de color negro, su cabello es de color castaño oscuro, es largo y lo usa suelto.
Ella se dedica al rubro de servicio de café y banqueteria, desde hace 6 años. Comenta que trabaja a pedidos de sus clientes para empresas, universidades, matrimonio y bautizos, prepara sus servicios en su casa, además se dedica a hacer repostería, trabaja todos los días y su horario lo distribuye de acuerdo a su disponibilidad.
La mercadería e insumos que va necesitando los compra en diferentes supermercados y distribuidoras a bajo costo sin perder la calidad de los productos, por lo tanto conveniente económicamente.
Con el crédito comprará mermeladas, huevos, harina, crema pastelera y chantilly, café, azúcar flor, vainilla y colorantes.
Una de las metas de Marta en su negocio es seguir creciendo e instalar un local de pastelería, para generar mayores ingresos, así con esto optar a una mejor calidad de vida.
Marta vive junto a su esposo y dos hijas de 16 y 21 años de edad quienes se encuentran estudiando, y apoyando a Maria en su negocio. Sus sueños a nivel laboral son tener un local donde pueda instalar una pastelería y ser independiente en su propio negocio.
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida de la oportunidad brindada por Fondo Esperanza, ya que le permitirá invertir en su negocio. Comenta que las capacitaciones han sido fundamentales para su negocio y también para su desarrollo personal, ya que ha aprendido a organizar y distribuir de mejor manera sus ingresos e inversiones.
Concepción, está asentada en la desembocadura del río Biobío, uno de los más grandes del país, al sur de Chile, en la región del Bíobío. Ha tenido una importante función en nuestra historia, siendo sede de importantes batallas y asentamiento relevante, especialmente durante la Guerra de Arauco, por estar en la frontera con territorio mapuche. Actualmente la ciudad posee un importante desarrollo económico y demográfico, llegando a ser considerada como uno de los núcleos urbanos, demográfico, administrativo, financiero y comercial más relevantes de Chile, después de Santiago y Valparaíso.
texts.en:
This communal bank is called "Tres Pascualas". It is made up of 15 entrepreneurs who work in different tracks, among which are: selling clothes and wallets, selling salads, selling vegetables, selling homemade bread, sewing, and printing, among other services. They all live in the city of Concepcion.

Marta, a member of the communal bank, is standing in the first row in the photo, second from the right. She is wearing pants and a black jacket. Her hair is long and dark brown, and she wears it down. She has been working serving coffee and catering for 6 years. She says that she works on orders from businesses, universities, weddings, and baptisms. She prepares her food in her house. She also makes desserts. She works every day and arranges her schedule according to her availability. 

She buys the supplies and merchandise that she needs at different supermarkets and distributors for low prices, without losing the quality of the products, which is economically convenient. With the loan, she will buy marmalades, eggs, flour, custard creme, chantilly creme, powdered sugar, vanilla, and food coloring. One of Marta's goals for her business is to keep growing and open a cake shop to generate more income and that way achieve a better quality of life.

Marta lives with her husband and her two daughters, ages 16 and 21. They are studying and helping her with the business. Her dream for her work is to have a place where she can open a cake shop and be independent in her own business. She is very happy and thankful for the opportunity given by Fondo Esperanza, since it will allow her to invest in her business. She says that the training has been fundamental for her business and also for her personal development, since she has learned how to better organize and distribute her income and investments.

Concepcion is located at the mouth of the Biobio River, one of the largest in the country, in the Biobio region in the south of Chile. It has had an important role in our history, being the site of important battles and a notable settlement, especially during the Arauco War, since it is on the border of Mapuche territory. Currently the city is undergoing important economic and demographic development, coming to be considered one of the most notable urban demographic, administrative, financial, and trade centers in Chile, after Santiago and Valparaiso.

loans.use: to buy marmalades, eggs, flour, custard creme, chantilly creme, coffee, powdered sugar, vanilla, and food coloring.

loans.name: Mededji

texts.fr: Agé de 30ans, Médard marié à une employée de bureau est père de 02 enfants dont 01 à l’école. Le premier a 05ans et le dernier 02mois. Il exerce comme activité la vente des peintures dans une boutique. Pour bien répondre aux besoins des clients il sollicite de WAGES un premier prêt pour acheter des boites de peintures. Avec les profits réalisés, il voudrait vendre des produits de quincailleries et assurer les besoins de la famille.
texts.en:
Médard is 30 years old, married to an office worker. He is the father of two children one of them attends school. The first one is 5 years old and the second one 2 months.

He sells household paint from a shop. To meet his customers demand, he is requesting his first loan from WAGES to purchase cans of paint. With the profit he'll make he would like to sell hardware items and cover his family’s needs.

loans.use: purchase cans of paint

loans.name: Khishigsuren

texts.en: Mrs. Khishigsuren, 35, runs a bakery shop in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her cakes and baked goods are delivered to the grocery stories and shopping malls in the city. She has been operating her business since 2007 and initially started it with just two staff members. She lives with her husband and her three children in the ger district – a boundary district with Mongolian traditional yurts and cheap houses. With this loan, she wants to buy organic fertilizers for growing vegetables. Her parents live in another ger district and they plant vegetables in their land plot. Before the end of September, her parents want to fertilize their planted vegetables and it is very important to have a good harvest in autumn. The loan she is taking out will be used to pay for organic fertilizers from the market.

loans.use: to pay for organic fertilizers from the market.

loans.name: Voeng

texts.en:
Pig-raising, after rice, is quite a common business for people living in the Baray district, Kampong Tom province. Voeng, a 24-year-old married woman, is working in a field to help her husband earn income for the family. She has been doing this business for almost five years and it has offered the family a positive outcome. Voeng has not been fortunate in conceiving a baby and she wishes to have one soon. 

Voeng’s spouse is currently in the business of trading firewood from his buffalo-pulled trailer. He usually buys a small cut strip of wood from a local wood industry and supplies it at the marketplaces, where he can generate an income of approximately 26,000 KHR per day.

In order to make her husband’s business more viable and profitable, Kong is asking for a loan in the sum of 5,000,000 KHR to purchase a plowing machine for many purposes – for the maintenance of the rice field and for trading firewood whenever they attach it with a trailer at the back. She hopes that this loan will have a great impact on their businesses, and enable them to attain financial stability someday.

loans.use: to purchase a plowing machine for many purposes – for the maintenance of the rice field and for trading firewood whenever they attach it with a trailer at the back.

loans.name: Kodjo

texts.fr: Propriétaire d’école, Mr Kodjo âgé de 39ans est marié à une enseignante. Ils ont 02 enfants dont 01 à l’école. Ils ont 06ans et 01an. Depuis 2006, il a crée son école dans un quartier de la place. A cause de la rigueur dans l’enseignement, les enfants viennent de parts et d’autres dans le quartier pour acquérir une bonne éducation. En plus de la création de l’école, il vend des articles scolaires. En cette période où la rentrée s’approche, les demandes deviennent de plus en plus croissante c’est justement pour cela qu'il sollicite dans notre institution un troisième prêt pour acheter des marchandises. Avec les profits, il veut réorganiser l’école, installer des outils informatiques afin d’ouvrir un cyber et prendre en charge les besoins du ménage.
texts.en:
Mr. Kodjo owns a school. He is 39 years old and is married to a teacher. They have two children one of them attends school. The children are 6 years old and 1 year old.

He set up his school in 2006 in a local neighborhood. Because of the rigor of the education, children come to attend from all sides of the neighborhood to obtain a good education. On top of setting up his school, he sells school supplies. During this back to school time, the demand is becoming ever increasing. For this reason he is requesting a third loan from our institution to purchase supplies. 

With the profit he would like to reorganize the school, install information technology tools in order to open a cyber area, and take care of the needs of the household.

loans.use: purchase school supplies

loans.name: Roert

texts.en: Roert, a mother of three children, is also one of the breadwinners in the family living in Thmor Koul district, Cambodia. She manages her one hectare of rice-cultivation farmland in order to support her household while her husband also supplements the family's income via fish catching for sale. She has been engaged in paddy farming for about one year. For this cycle, Roert has joined VisionFund as a first-time borrower. She is seeking a loan in the amount of 300 US dollars to buy fertilizer for her farmland; she will also use a portion of it to buy a grill net for supporting the fish-catching business of her husband. She hopes to make more income from her business so as to better her lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farmland

loans.name: Yaqoub

texts.en: Yaqoub is a 22-year-old single guy who is the youngest among three brothers. They live with their mother after their father passed away. He wants to support himself in his studies to avoid adding more stress to the family's financial status. Therefore, he applied for this educational loan to pay his semester fees as he is seeking to get a BS degree in chemistry.

loans.use: to pay his semester fees.

loans.name: Aliah

texts.en:
Aliah is a 52-year-old, conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband appears in her Kiva profile photo.she lives in Sana'a, Yemen. She is married and has 6 children. She has been running a gas cylinder business where she sells them around her area. 

Her husband worked in the airport tower but he got into a disagreement between him and the people at work. That led to his retirement and allocated him to the insurance so she  sells gas cylinder in order to improve her family`s living conditions . Aliah applied for a loan of 400,000 YER from AMB to buy additional gas cylinders to distribute around her area.

loans.use: to buy additional gas cylinders and distribute them around her area for her business

loans.name: Ahmed

texts.en: Ahmed is 29 years old and married. He lives in Sana`a, Yemen. He worked in a refrigerator banana store in the mornings and had a motorcycle transport business in the evenings. He has a bus that he bought six years ago to improve his family's quality of life and cover household expenses. He says that he feels comfortable because he can earn a daily income. He applied for a youth loan of 200,000 YER from Kiva's partner, AMB, to buy spare parts for his bus. He hopes to have a cars auction in the future.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for his bus

loans.name: Eric

texts.en:
Eric is a 31-year-old businessman living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. He has a stationery shop, and with the proceeds he has been able to meet the basic needs of his family. Nevertheless, he is faced with challenges in his business such as price fluctuation, customers’ delinquency and inadequate capital to purchase modern equipment.
Eric is applying for a 1,000,000  shillings loan from HOFOKAM to buy a printer to ease his workload. His business goal is to hire employees to help grow his business and expand into new markets. His personal goal is to build a permanent house for residence.

loans.use: to buy a printer.

loans.name: Srey

texts.en:
Srey is 40 years old. She is married and resides with three children in Kampot Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in animal husbandry for more than 20 years. She is involved in feeding pigs and poultry. She earns about $3 daily. She has extensive experience and is successful in her career. Her husband (who is joining her in the picture) runs a delivery service and earns about $8 per day. Two of her children are employed. They earn about $5 each day. 

Srey is requesting a loan of $1500 to purchase a trailer for her husband to run the delivery service. This purchase will help her husband earn more income. In the future, she would like to purchase a small truck to run the service and send her youngest child to a good school.

loans.use: to purchase a trailer for her husband to run a delivery service

loans.name: Rin

texts.en: Rin is 50 years old. She is married and resides with two children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in breeding pigs for more than four years, earning approximately $2 daily. Her husband is a rice farmer who earns about $2 per day. Her children are employed in a garment factory. They earn about $10 each day. Rin is requesting a loan of $1500 to purchase more farmland and fertilizer for cultivating rice. This purchase will help her generate more income to support the family. In the future, she would like to run an additional business and rebuild her house to make it more convenient for her family.

loans.use: to purchase farmland and fertilizer for cultivating rice

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.en:
Svetlana is 57 years old and lives in a small village of the Akhaltsikhe district. She has a grown son, daughter-in-law and 2 grandchildren. the family runs an agricultural business. In particular, they own a plot of land, which is cultivated and in which different kinds of vegetables are grown. In addition, Svetlana has milking cows and produces dairy products. She sells her production in the nearby villages. She works hard, but still doesn’t have enough income to make some savings and improve the living conditions of the family.

She requested a loan to repair her house. The existing house is old and damaged. Svetlana will purchase building materials and renovate her house. Then, the living conditions of the family will be improved, and they will be able to spend their evenings after a hard working day in a more comfortable environment. Svetlana hopes for your help and kindness.

loans.use: to repair her old and damaged house.

loans.name: Alozio

texts.en: Alozio is a 38-year-old businessman living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. He has a retail shop and has been in business for eight years and he is also a farmer. The challenges he is facing are customers not paying on time and unpredictable weather changes. His business goal is to expand his business into new markets and venture into mechanized agriculture. Alozio wants the loan to pay workers who are harvesting his maize garden.

loans.use: to to pay workers who are harvesting his maize garden.

loans.name: Phally

texts.en:
Phally is 48 years old. She is married and resides with five children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been selling peanuts and potatoes for more than two years, earning approximately $3 per day. Her husband is a rice farmer who earns about $3 daily. Two of her children are employed. They are a garment worker and a construction worker. They earn about $6 each day.

 In order to improve her family’s finances, Phally is requesting a loan of $1400 to purchase repair tools for her son to run a business repairing motorcycle. By doing so, her son would earn more income to financially support the family. In the future, she would like to run a business breeding pigs and help her children earn higher education. In addition, she hopes to rebuild her present house to make it more convenient for her family.

loans.use: to purchase repair tools for her son to run a business repairing motorcyle

loans.name: Apolinaria

texts.es:
Apolinaria tiene 48 años, está casada con Simeón, de 51 años. Viven en su casa propia, la que compraron durante los años que tienen de convivencia, donde habitan con sus cuatro hijos. 
Ella y su esposo se dedican a cultivar plantas de cacao. Juntos llevan 20 años realizando esta actividad y cuentan con su propia parcela. En los tiempos de cosecha, como todo agricultor, siempre pide apoyo a de jornaleros para realizar la faena. Sin embargo, sus dificultades son en las temporadas de lluvia, ya que los insectos abundan y malogran la producción, para ello necesita realizar un constante mantenimiento de sus cultivos, quitando la mala hierba y fertilizando.

Este es su primer crédito con MFP y está orgullosa por contar con este préstamo, ya que así seguirá con su labor. Asimismo, se siente contenta de tener socios de su banco comunal tan responsables.
Con los 1,000 nuevos soles comprará abono y fertilizantes para sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Apolinaria is 48 years old and is married to Simon, who is 51.  They live in their own house, which they bought during the years that they have lived together.  They live here with their four children.

She and her husband grow cacao plants.  Together they have been doing this for 20 years on their own plot.  At harvest time, like all of the farmers, they always ask for help from workmen to carry out the task.  Nevertheless, there are difficulties in the rainy season when the insects are abundant and ruin the crop production.  During this time they need to constantly maintain their crops, removing the weeds and fertilizing.

This is Apolinaria's first loan with MFP, and she is proud to count on this loan so that she can carry on with her work.  At the same time, she feels happy to have such responsible members of her communal bank.

With these 1,000 Peruvian soles, she will buy manure and fertilizers for her crops.

loans.use: To buy manure and fertilizer for her crops

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en: Samuel is a 36-year-old businessman.  He is married with three children, and lives in Bundibugyo, Uganda. He deals in mobile money services and the business is very lucrative. He has a challenge:  A poor network that leads to few or no transactions.  His dream is to use services of all five telecom companies so as to spread the risks. His personal goal is to be the biggest supplier of mobile money  service in the area and to educate his children. Samuel needs the loan to buy mobile money cards for his business.

loans.use: to buy mobile money cards for his business.

loans.name: Faith

texts.en:
Faith is a thirty year-old single mother with one child living in Kasese, Uganda. She has been an office attendant for four years. 
Her personal goals are to educate children and to build permanent house for residence. She also has a plan to venture into farming  and specifically grow coffee so as to increase her sources of income.
Faith is requesting a loan to buy land to grow coffee.

loans.use: to buy land to grow crops.

loans.name: Fruitful Center Group

texts.en:
Daniel is married with two children. He is 28 years old and lives in Tukuran, Z.D.S.

Daniel is a farmer and grows a form of rice crop. He has been doing this for five years. He has requested a loan of PHP 50,000 to purchase fertilizer for his rice crop.

Daniel has been member of PMPC for four years.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for his rice crop.

location.town: Pagadian-Upper Bayao Tukuran Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Oliver

texts.en: Oliver is a 28-year-old married woman with three children living in Kagadi, Uganda. She is a teacher by profession and has been in service for a period of 7 years.She would like to educate her children up to the university and build a permanent house. Oliver wants a loan to buy cement, iron sheets, sand and bricks for building her house.

loans.use: to buy cement, iron sheets, sand and bricks for building her house.

loans.name: Analia

texts.en: Analia is forty-four years of age, married and has six children, presently living in New Village, Tambulig, Zamboanga del Sur.  Analia has been running her general store businessfor more than four years.  She has been a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative for one year. Analia has continued her good performance for the third loan. She requested a loan amount of eighteen thousand pesos to purchase more stocks for her general store.  In the future, Analia hopes that she can earn more than she need to support her living financially.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her general store such as toothpaste, beverages and dry goods

loans.name: Cheang's Group

texts.en: Cheang is a 42-year-old mother of four children, three of whom have their own employment. The rest of her family is residing in Pursat province's Bakan district, where rice crop production is one of the common businesses among the villager. She makes a living from her one hectare of rice field while her husband is not only helping with her paddy farm but also works for others for a fee to better support the household. She has been engaged in this business for 22 years, earning about 5,800 KHR per day. Cheang's group consists of three members, all of them are first loan cycle clients and she is the group leader. She and one of her fellow group member are applying for 500,000 KHR each whereas the remaining co-member is seeking 1,000,000 KHR. Cheang will use her loan portion to buy fertilizer and to pay the plowing fee for her farmland. She expects to gain more yield so she can improve the standard of living for her family.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and to pay the plowing fee for her farmland

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy 15 sheets of zinc, to install a new roof over his bedrooms.

loans.name: Nasareth Group

texts.es:
El grupo Nasareth lo conforman tres personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras una de ellas es Damaris quien se dedica al comercio de ropa desde hace 5 años el cual inicio con su propio dinero y con el crédito desea aumentarlo.
Las otras integrantes son Ramona quien se dedica a la venta de tortilla y Erika quien se dedica a la venta de ropa.
texts.en:
The group “Nasareth” consists of three hardworking and enterprising individuals. One of them is Damaris, who has been selling clothes for five years. She started her business with her own money and will use this loan to help it grow.

The other members are as follows: • Ramona sells tortillas. • Erika sells clothes.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Archangel

texts.en:
Archangel is 34 years old and lives in the town of Kasese in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. He is married and has 2 children, one currently in school. For the past 2 years, Archangel has been working hard to manage his retail shop, which sells dry beans, maize flour and sugar. 

To help expand his business, Archangel has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings (UGX) from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more essential commodities such as sugar, dry beans and maize flour for resale, and will help Archangel to generate greater profits and pay for his children's medical bills. Archangel hopes that, in the future,he will be able to expand the business into a wholesale shop. 

Archangel is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP)The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Archangel who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more essential commodities such as sugar, dry beans and maize flour for resale

loans.name: Jill

texts.en: Jill is from Kinuman Norte, Ozamiz City. She is 36 years old and is married with 3 children. To make a living, Jill plants, harvests and sells corn. Jill has been engaged in her business for 2 years and earns 3,000 a month from these activities. In 2011, Jill joined GDMPC. Jill is requesting a loan of 7,000 which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. She plans to use the additional revenue generated by the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy animal feed for the pigs

loans.name: Godfrey

texts.en:
Godfrey is 29 years old and lives in the town of Lyantonde in the Mbarara region of Uganda. He is married and has one child. For the past four years, Godfrey has been working hard to manage his small business, which sells cosmetics. 

To help expand his business, Godfrey has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more cosmetic lotions and hair extensions for resale, and will help Godfrey to generate greater profits and pay for the family’s basic needs like food and medical expenses. Godfrey hopes that in the future he will be able to sell high-quality cosmetics and start a wholesale shop. 

Godfrey is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Godfrey who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more cosmetic lotions and hair extensions for resale.

loans.name: Sylvia

texts.en:
Sylvia is 20 years old and lives in the town of Kamwenge in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. She is married and has one child. For the past two years, Sylvia has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells sugar, salt, soap and rice. 

To help expand her business, Sylvia has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more essential goods like sugar, soap, salt and rice for resale, and will help Sylvia to generate greater profits and improve her business by buying more items like more sugar, soap and rice for resale. Sylvia hopes that in the future she will be able to build a house of her own. 

Sylvia is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more essential goods like sugar, soap, salt and rice for resale

loans.name: Charles

texts.en: This is 44-year- old Charles.  He is married, and has two children aged 20 and 25 years. He has two additional dependents living with him as sales assistants.  In 2002, Charles established his fish business. He began his business because he wants to help in bringing up his family. Working seven days-a-week and 15 hours per day, he earns about Le 1,000,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of Le 3, 000,000. Charles now requires this loan in order to increase his stock of fish to be transported to the provinces for sale which will increase his   profits. In the future, Charles plans to erect a house, and educate his children. He is thanking you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more bags of fish.

loans.name: Neneth

texts.en:
Neneth, aged 24, is married with five children. She lives in the Philippines. Neneth buys and sells vegetables to earn a living. She has been doing this for six years and every month she earns 4,000 PHP from this work. 

Neneth has requested a loan of 8,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer. She has been a member of GDMPC since 2011. In the future, Neneth hopes to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more grown pigs to resell.

loans.name: Tassie

texts.en:
