This is 51-year-old Tassie. She is married and has three children, age 26, 20 and 16. 

In 2009, Tassie established her provisions business. She began her business because she wanted to support her family. Working six days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about SLL 800,000 every month from this business. 

She would like a loan in the amount of SLL 4,500,000. Tassie has already received and successfully repaid her first loan and now requires a new loan to buy 5 cartoons of peak milk powder,5cartoons of ovaltine,5 cartoons of tea leaf 5 cartoons of salad cream and 5 cartoons of ketch up. In the future, Tassie plans to open more outlets, build more houses and send her children to the university. She is thanking you for your support.

loans.use: to 5 cartoons of peak milk powder,5 cartoons of ovaltine,5 cartoons of tea leaf,5 cartoons of salad creamand 5 cartoons of ketch up

loans.name: Ellen

texts.en: Ellen, 48 years old, is married and has 2 children, aged 22 and 20 years. She has 2 additional dependents who live with her.  In 1997, Ellen established her drinks business. She began her business because she wants to assist her husband in their family affairs. Working 7 days a week and 15 hours a day, Ellen earns about SLL 600,000 every month from her business. She would like a loan in the amount of SLL 3,000,000.She would like to buy 50 cartoons of soft drinks,50 crates of beer,50 crates of stout and 50 crates of maltina.  In the future, Ellen plans to erect another house. Presently she is educating her children with the profits of her business and she hopes to continue until they finish university. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: 50 cartoons of soft drinks,50 cartoons of beer,50,cartoons of stout

loans.name: Abdul Rahman

texts.en: This is 30yrs- old Abdul.  He is married, and has 1 child aged 5yrs-. He has 1 additional dependent, living with her as a Sales Assistant.  In 2005, Abdul established his mobile phone credit card   business. He began his business because he wants to   take care of his family.Working 7 days a week and 11hrs a day, he earns about Le 800,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of Le 4,500,000 . Abdul has already received and successfully repaid his first loan and now requires a new loan which will enable him to open more telephone call center branches  to the provincial towns. In the future, Abdul plans to complete his 3 bedroom house. He is thanking you for your support.

loans.use: to open more telephone call centers

loans.name: Las Amelias  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
Las Amelias es un banco comunal conformado por amigas y conocidas, son 7 mujeres y 1 hombre que luchan día a día para sacar adelante a sus familias y mejorar la estabilidad económica de sus hogares. Viven por diferentes lugares de la ciudad de Cuenca, el centro de esta ciudad es una mezcla de lo colonial y lo moderno, su gente es amable y de un corazón muy cálido, mantienen aun la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos, su gastronomía cautiva el paladar de quienes la visitan.  

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Blanca, forma una parte del banco comunal hace 4 años, vive por los alrededores de la parroquia de Turi en Cuenca, tiene 40 años, es viuda y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 8 hijos, dos de sus hijos son mayores de edad, están casados y viven independientes, 2 trabajan y le ayudan  económicamente, una de sus hijas estudia en el colegio y sus 3 últimos  hijos estudian en una escuelita de la ciudad. La casa en la que vive es de su propiedad la misma que la ha construido en unión conyugal.

Doña Blanca labora tiene un puesto en un mercado de la ciudad en donde vende verduras, labora sin un horario fijo ya que es su propio jefe. En su casa cría animalitos como son cerdos, cuyes, pollos y vacas.

Su nuevo crédito es para invertirlo en la compra de cerdos, pollos y alimento para sus animales.

Su meta es  tener un local para vender carne.
texts.en:
“Las Amelias” is a Communal Bank that consists of seven women and one man who are friends and acquaintances. They strive day after day to move their families forward and improve the financial stability of their households. The members live in different areas of the city of Cuenca. The central part of the city is a mix of the colonial and the modern. Its people are friendly and warm-hearted. They have maintained the culture and tradition of their ancestors. The local food captivates the palates of those who visit this area.

One of the members of this group is Sra. Blanca, who joined the Communal Bank four years ago. She lives on the outskirts of Turi Parish in Cuenca. Blanca is 40 years old, widowed, and has eight children. Two of them are grown, married, and live independently. Two other children work and help her financially. One of her daughters is in high school and the three youngest children attend an elementary school in the city. She owns the house she lives in and it was built while she was married.

Doña Blanca manages a stand at the city market where she sells vegetables. She is her own boss and does not work according to a set schedule. At home, she raises animals such as pigs, guinea pigs, chickens, and cows. Her new loan will be invested in the purchase of pigs, chickens, and feed for her animals. Her goal is to open a butcher shop where she can sell meat.

loans.use: to buy pigs, chickens, and animal feed.

loans.name: Altantsetseg

texts.en:
Altantsetseg, aged 31, lives with her husband and two children in a small house in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her husband, also aged 31, is in the trucking business. Their two children stay at home. When Altantsetseg was a knitter at GOVI LLC, she acquired experience in the wool and cashmere production business. 

Altantsetseg is now running a knitwear production business as a sole proprietorship. She is planning to run her knitting business with her younger sisters. Soon it will be getting cold so she is planning to install heating for her workplace. Altantsetseg is an accountable and handy person. She is asking for a loan of 5,000,000 MNT to purchase heating for her workplace and a knitting machine.

loans.use: To purchase heating for her workplace and a knitting machine

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy plastic slippers and ladies shoes

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet, aged 44, is from Antequera, Bohol. She is married with four children: the eldest is 24 and the youngest is nine. Juliet's husband works as a farmer and a carpenter to earn a living. She helps augment their income by operating a sari-sari  (variety) store that sells detergent, chips, noodles, seasonings and toiletries. 

Juliet is requesting a loan of 7,000 PHP to buy bulk supplies of noodles, toiletries, seasonings, chips, etc. The loan will be her additional capital so she can expand her business and earn more. Her income will pay for her children's daily consumption and school fees.

loans.use: to buy bulk supplies of noodles, toiletries, seasonings, chips, etc.

loans.name: Baindu's Group

texts.en:
This is 40-year-old Baindu. She is married and has four children aged 22, 19, 16 and 13. She has two additional dependents, who live with her because both of them are schooling.  

In 2007, Baindu established her provisions, drinks and water business. She began her business because she wants to support her children’s education, and that is her only source of livelihood. 

Working seven days a week and 15 hours a day, she earns about Le 570,000 (Sierra Leone leones) every month from this business. 

She would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000. Baindu requires a loan in order to buy provisions (cocoa powder, Ovaltine, milk, butter, mayonnaise, etc.). She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 260,000. 

In the future, Baindu plans to educate her children, to develop their plot of land and to acquire a shop in an area concentrated with businesses. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy provisions (cocoa powder, Ovaltine, milk, butter, mayonnaise, etc.).

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for the maintenance

loans.name: Braulita

texts.en:
Braulita is 51 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. Braulita has been making and selling school and office uniforms for 12 years. 

She has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy fabrics for making school and office uniforms. Braulita has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fabrics for making school and office uniforms

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma, aged 37, is married with two children and lives in the Philippines. She has a food/retail shop or sari-sari store where she buys and sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products and beverages. Thelma has had this business for six years. 

She has requested a loan of 6,000 PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages. Thelma has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. In the future, she hopes to improve her business so she can support her children's education.

loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora is a 32-year-old married woman and the mother of three young children. She lives in Bohol, Philippines. Leonora has been in the fish selling business for more than five years. This is the source of her income.

Leonora is in need of additional capital for her business. She is asking for a loan of 15,000 PHP to buy more fish to sell to the people in the community. In the future, Leonora hopes to make her business a success.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Charles

texts.en: Charles is a 47-year-old married man with 12 children living in Kasese, Uganda. After accumulating 800,000 shillings from his personal savings, Charles set up a clothing shop in order to earn more income for the family. The business has been profitable as it is currently worth 3,000,000 shillings. His hardships are inadequate capital to purchase stock, price fluctuations and inflation. His personal goals are educating his children and buying a car, while his business goals are expanding his business into new markets and diversifying his business to include farming. Charles is requesting money to buy clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Edwin Ramón

texts.es:
El joven Edwin de 23 años, casado, Habita en la Colonia Jerusalen, Ganadero y Agricultor, desde muy pequeño se ha dedicado a realizar los trabajos de campos en su unidad de produccion que heredo de sus padres quienes le han enseñado a ganarse la vida por si solos, él obtiene sus ingresos de la comercializacion de leche y venta de Ganado. Es un joven responsable, de buena familia muy reconocida en la zona y de buenas costumbres.
Solicita su primer crédito para compra de Materiales de construccion ya que necesita hacerle mejoras a su vivienda como es la construccion de un cuarto y de esta manera darle mejor comodidad a su pequeña familia. 

Su mayor sueño es que a su familia no les falte el pan de cada dia e ir acondicionando mejor su finca y vivienda poco a poco.
texts.en:
Edwin is a young man who is 23 years of age and married. He lives in the subdivision of Jerusalen where he works as a farmer and rancher. Edwin has engaged in farm work from a very young age. The land on which he produces was passed on to him by his parents, who taught him how to earn a living and become self-sufficient. Edwin generates his income from selling milk and cattle. He is a responsible young man who comes from a well-known and respectable family in the area.

Edwin is requesting his first loan so that he can buy the construction materials that he needs to improve his home. He plans to add a room so that his small family can be more comfortable. His greatest wishes for his family are to see them not lacking in their basic needs and to make gradual improvements to both his farm and his home.

loans.use: to buy construction materials in order to build a bedroom.

loans.name: Veneranda

texts.en:
Veneranda is 59 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. Veneranda has a videoke (karaoke) shop that offers different kinds of songs. She has had this business for six years. 

Veneranda has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to pay for the maintenance of her videoke (karaoke) machine. She has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Veneranda hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to pay for the maintenance of her videoke (karaoke) machine

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for vehicle maintenance and to buy accessories for his motorcycle taxi.

loans.name: Azucena

texts.en:
Azucena, aged 47, is single and lives in the Philippines. She has a food/retail shop or sari-sari store where she buys and sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products and beverages. She has had this business for 29 years. 

Azucena has requested a loan of 7,000 PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Azucena hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Valent

texts.en:
Valent, aged 49, is married and has two children, aged 19 and 14. Both of his children go to school; one is attending high school and the older one is studying literature at university. Valent had worked as a forest policeman in his region in south-eastern Albania until seven years ago when he was laid off from the position. He searched for other similar jobs but, with an extremely high unemployment rate in his city, it became impossible for him to find a job. He and his family very soon found themselves below the poverty line because they lived in the city and had no other means of living. 

Valent then bought a taxi and has been working these past years as a taxi driver. He is now requesting a loan to repair the taxi so that he can soon start running it again. He is aware that this loan will be posted on Kiva and he hopes that lenders will be kind enough to lend to him.

loans.use: To repair his taxi

loans.name: Lucena

texts.en:
Lucena is a 50-year-old married woman from Bohol, Philippines. She has three children who are still in school. Together with her husband, Lucena runs a tricycle repair and vulcanizing shop. This is the source of their income.

Lucena works hard to support her husband in meeting their family's needs. She joined CEVI because she wanted to gain access to the financial services offered by the organization. She is requesting a loan of 12,000 PHP to buy materials for their tricycle repair and vulcanizing shop. With this loan, they will be able to cater to more customers.

Lucena hopes to make their business a success so that it will generate more revenue for their needs and other expenses.

loans.use: to buy materials for their tricycle repair and vulcanizing shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy snacks, candies, wheat flour, cooking oil, etc.

loans.name: Mashine Ya Maji Group

texts.en:
Edward, aged 34, is married with two children one of whom goes to school and the other is still too young. He has been running a carpentry business for four years now. Edward works from 7am to 6pm daily and he is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be his third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans to buy more wood for his business and he has successfully repaid all his loans. Edward hopes for a loan to buy more stock of wood. His dream is to one day be a big trader of carpentry products.

He will share this loan with his loan group "Mashine Ya Maji" which totals 14 members who will hold each other accountable for repaying the loan.

loans.use: to buy more stock of wood.

loans.name: Kokou

texts.fr: Reporteur de profession, Mr Kokou âgé de 38ans est marié à une revendeuse et ils ont 03 enfants dont 02 scolarisés. Le premier a 12ans et le dernier 04ans. Il a une ancienneté de 09ans dans cette activité et le fait avec joie. Une personne l’aide dans l’exercice de son activité. Vu que son activité s’améliore de jour en jour, il sollicite de wages  un troisième prêt pour acheter des caméras pour tournage. Avec les profits, il voudrait avoir un grand studio de reportage et permettre à ses enfants de mieux aller à l’école.
texts.en:
Kokou, age 38, is a professional reporter.  He is married to a reseller with whom he has three children. Two of his children attend school.  His oldest child is 12, the youngest is 4.

Kokou has been working as a reporter for nine years and he enjoys his job.  One person works as his assistant.

Since his business is constantly improving, he is requesting a third loan from WAGES for the purchase of video cameras for film making.  He would like to use the profits from his activity to open a large reporting studio and to better provide for his children's education.

loans.use: to buy video cameras.

loans.name: Valbona

texts.en:
Valbona, aged 34, is married and has four very young children. She emigrated to Greece at a very young age but four years ago she returned and started to live in her small town in south-eastern Albania. Valbona has been operating her own dairy farm ever since and has established a very steady clientele. 

This is her third loan: the previous ones have been repaid. “It was difficult to create this business with my own money, because I am the only financial provider for my whole family and having little children you’ve got more expenses, I think. This is why I very much appreciate the help I’ve got from VisionFund Albania in establishing and maintaining my business,” she said.

The loan for which Valbona is now applying is to renovate the dairy farm premises.

loans.use: To renovate the dairy farm premises

loans.name: Laurensio

texts.en:
Laurensio, aged 29, is married with two children who are both of school-going age. He sells maize, groundnuts, beans and other cereals. He also has a garden where he grows maize and beans. Laurensio started his business three years ago with the aim of supporting his family. He had become a father and his family were looking up to him.

Laurensio is requesting a loan of 2,000,000 UGX so he can purchase more beans to sell. The season has set in and his vision is to restock before the prices go high. He hopes to make good profits from the loan. Laurensio plans to open his own store and to have capacity to store beans and wait for a better price. He also plans to plant pine trees on his piece of land which would preserve the environment and earn him income in the future. With hard work, Laurensio hopes that his family will have a better life in future.

loans.use: to purchase more beans to sell

loans.name: Salimakhon

texts.en:
Salimakhon is married and has three children. She has always wanted to provide them with a good education. Since her husband’s income is not enough to provide the family with a good quality of life, Salimakhon decided to start a new business sewing national dresses for women in order to generate an income which she can contribute to her household’s finances. 

Salimakhon studied at a course run by ‘To get ahead’, a women's organization, and learned enough business skills. She will be a very successful businesswoman as she is hard-working and smart. She is asking for a loan of 2,000 somoni to buy a sewing machine for her new business. Through using the loan and from her business, she will have a source of income so that her family can have a good quality of life and better financial opportunities to progress. Salimakhon awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine for her new business

loans.name: Joann

texts.en:
Joann, aged 21, is married with one child and lives in the Philippines. She has a food/retail shop or sari-sari store where she buys and sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products and beverages. She has had this business for two years. 

Joann has requested a loan of 4,000 PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Joann hopes to improve her business so she can support her child's education.

loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Khayrinisso

texts.en:
Khayrinisso is married and has four children. She is 47 years old and has decided to start a new farming business so she can generate an income and contribute to her household’s finances. If you will help her with a loan, she would be able to buy seeds. Khayrinisso studied a course at ‘To get ahead’, a women's organization, and learned enough business skills. Her children will help her with the business. She will be a very successful businesswoman as she is hard-working and smart. 

Khayrinisso is requesting a loan of 2,000 somoni to buy seeds for her new business. Through using the loan and from her business, she will have a source of income so that her family can have a good quality of life and better financial opportunities to progress. Khayrinisso awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy seeds for her new business

loans.name: Améyo

texts.fr: Ameyo vit avec ses 03 enfants et son mari revendeur à Lomé. Les enfants sont âgés de 15, 11, 03ans et deux sont sur les bancs de l’école. Améyo est tresseuse de profession et vend en même temps des charbons de bois à domicile. Pour renforcer son stock et mieux répondre aux besoins des clients, elle sollicite de WAGES un premier prêt pour acheter des sacs de charbons de bois. Elle veut épargner les profits, devenir grossiste et 	voir une famille financièrement stable.
texts.en:
Ameyo lives with her three children and her husband, a reseller, in Lomé. The children's ages are 15, 11, and 3 years old. Two of them go to school.

Améyo is a professional braider. In parallel, she also sells charcoal at her home. In order to bolster her stock and better meet customer demand, she's seeking a loan from Kiva's partner, WAGES, in order to buy sacks of charcoal.

She wants to put money away, become a wholesaler, and see her family in a stable situation financially.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Dédé

texts.fr: Femme d’un pasteur, Dédé âgée de 48ans est mère de 04 enfants tous à l’école. L’ainé a 21ans et le dernier 13ans. Pour aider son mari dans les charges du foyer, elle vend depuis 2003 des bazins, des boubous, chaussures et de la bouillie à domicile et de façon ambulante. Elle veut rendre son activité pérenne c’est pour cela, elle sollicite un troisième crédit dans notre institution pour acheter des bazins, des chaussures et du maïs (pour la bouillie). Avec les profits réalisés, elle compte augmenter son fond de roulement, avoir une boutique de prêt à porter et assurer la scolarisation de tous ses enfants.
texts.en:
A pastor's wife, Dédé, age 48, is the mother of four school-attending children. The eldest is 21, the youngest is 13 years old.

In order to help her husband with the household expenses, she's been selling, since 2003, "basin" fabrics, boubous, shoes, and porridge, at her home and as a traveling saleswoman.

She wants to sustain her business, and for this reason, she's seeking a third loan from Kiva's partner, WAGES, in order to buy "basin" fabrics, shoes, and corn (to make porridge).

With her profits, she intends to increase her working capital, get a ready-to-wear shop, and ensure all her children can attend school.

loans.use: to buy "basin" fabrics, boubous, shoes, and corn

loans.name: Sas' Group

texts.en:
Sas is a 38-year-old mother of eight children, some of whom are students, some stay at home, and the remaining son is a paid worker. Sas runs a tiny stall selling costume jewelry in her local area. She has been engaged in this business for 10 years, saving about 18,000 KHR on average per day after her daily expenses. 

This is the first loan for Sas' group consisting of two female members - Sas is the group leader. Both of them are applying for 700,000 KHR each. For Sas as the leader, she will use her loan’s portion to buy more costume jewelry for resale. She hopes to earn more income to keep her children in school until a higher level.

loans.use: to buy more costume jewelry to sell

loans.name: Antonieta

texts.en:
Antonieta is from Gata Diot, Clarin. She is 50 years old.  Antonieta is widowed and has 4 children. To make a living, Antonieta owns  and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. Antonieta has been engaged in her business for 11 years and earns PHP 11,000 a month for these activities. 

In 2007, Antonieta joined GDMPC. Antonieta is requesting a loan of PHP 35,000 which will be used to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, sugar and coffee. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, sugar and coffee

loans.name: Byambatumur

texts.en:
Mrs. Byambatumur, 42 years old, lives with her three children in a house in the Suhbaatar district of Ulaanbaatar. Her oldest son helps with her business, her youngest son is in secondary school, and her daughter is a teacher at the University. 

Byambatumur and her older son have prior business experience dating back to 2002, when they were in the electronic goods retailing business. Now her son will operate the electronic goods retailing business and she is planning to start a retail clothes business. She turns a car into a make-shift shop to sell clothes in Ulaanbaatar. She would like to expand her business by increasing the variety of goods she sells. Byambatumur needs 3,000,000 MNT to purchase more inventory. She is a hard-working woman who says ''I will spend the profit from the business for my youngest son's tuition.''

loans.use: To purchase more inventory

loans.name: Nubia

texts.es:
Doña Nubia tiene la edad de 57 años, es comerciante de venta de ropa, en su casa de habitación y ambulante, negocio que inicio hace siete años, para apoyar  a su familia con los gastos. Es casada, sus hijos independientes, una de ella vive en su casa y trabaja en un mercado de la capital, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien labora como guarda de seguridad.
Hoy en día, quiere mejorar su vivienda, al hacer un muro perimetral en la parte de enfrente, logrando una mejor seguridad para su familia y su propiedad. Pues a un le falta mucha condición a su pequeña casa, pero le es necesario el muro debido a que hay muchos delincuentes en el barrio, y muchos robos, Haciéndose posible esta mejora con financiamiento en Afodenic, siendo  a plazos accesibles.
Comprara materiales en construcción como: piedra, arena, cemento, hierro, tablas de madera, clavos y comenzar la obra.
texts.en:
Nubia is 57 years old. She is a merchant who sells clothes from her home and as a street vendor. She started this business seven years ago to help pay the family's expenses. She is married and her children are grown. One of them lives with her in her homse and works at a market in the capital. She has her husband's help; he works as a security guard. 

Today she wants to do some home improvement by building a wall around the front. This will bring more security to her family and her property. Her house still needs a lot of work, but the wall is ncessary because of their is a lot of crime in the neighborhood and a lot of theft. This improvement is made possible with a loan in Afodenic, with ease of payments.

She will buy construction materials such as: stones, sand, cement, iron, wood planks, and nails. She will also pay for starting the work.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to build a wall in front of her house.

loans.name: Komivi

texts.fr: Komivi est âgé de 49ans. Il est marié à une revendeuse et n’ont pas d’enfants. Il est dans le domaine du transport (chauffeur) depuis 25ans. Son véhicule est en panne et cela l’empêche de travailler c’est pour cela, elle sollicite de WAGES un troisième prêt. Avec ce montant, il veut réparer son véhicule. Il voudrait répondre plus au besoin des clients et mieux s’occuper de sa famille.
texts.en: Komivi is 49 years of age, married to a reseller, and has no children. He works in the transport field (as a driver), and has done so for 25 years. His vehicle is currently broken down, and this means he cannot work. As a result, Komivi has requested a third loan from WAGES, which he will use to repair his vehicle. He would like to be able to better meet his customers’ needs, as well as to look after his family more.

loans.use: To repair his vehicle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy animal feed for the pigs

loans.name: Homégnon

texts.fr: Gérant d’un bar, Mr Homégnon est âgé de 36ans. Il est aidé par 01 personne  et exerce son activité depuis 2003. Il est à son septième crédit dans notre institution et ce prêt lui servira à acheter des boissons. Il veut réinvestir dans l’activité, avoir un autre bar pour plus de profit, construire sa maison.
texts.en:
Homégnon is a bar manager, and is 36 years of age. He is helped by one other person in his bar, and has had this business since 2003. 

This is Homégnon’s seventh loan with this institution, and it will be used to buy drinks. He plans to reinvest in his business, have another bar so that he has more profits, and build his own house.

loans.use: to buy drinks.

loans.name: Mujeres Progresistas  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
Mujeres Progresistas es un banco comunal que está conformado por 7 socias quienes viven en diferentes lugares de la ciudad de Cuenca, ciudad que se encuentra bañada por 4 ríos, tiene varios lugares para disfrutar de la naturaleza, su centro se mezcla entre lo colonial y lo moderno, su gente es amble y muy trabajadora al igual que nuestras socias que a pesar de las adversidades, ellas nunca dejan de sonreír y darle gracias a Dios por un día más de trabajo para mejorar la estabilidad de sus familias.

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Ana, es una mujer emprendedora que se encuentra en el tercer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal. Es casada y tiene 33 años, en su unión conyugal ha concebido 2 hijos de 16 y 14 años de edad que estudian en un colegio de la ciudad. Su esposo labora fuera de la ciudad ya que ha migrado en busca de mejores oportunidades para sacar adelante a su familia, la casa en la que vive es de su propiedad siendo el fruto del trabajo conyugal.

La Señora Ana pasa en casa dedicada a su familia, pero para aportar a la economía de su hogar se dedica a la cría de gallinas y cuyes, labora también en la agricultura y sus cosechas las vende en un mercado de la ciudad.

El dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de semillas, abono y pollos para continuar creciendo en su negocio.
 
Su meta es tener una tienda de abarrotes.
texts.en:
Mujeres Progresistas is a communal bank made up of 7 members who live in different places in the city of Cuenca. This city is bathed by 4 rivers and has different places to enjoy nature. Its city center is mixture of colonial and modern. It's people are kind and very hardworking, like our members. Despite adversities, they never stop smiling and thanking God for one more day of work to improve the stability of their families.

One of the members of this group is Ana. She is an enteprising woman who is on her third loan in the communal bank. She is married and 33 years old. In her marriage she has had 2 children, aged 16 and 14. They go to high school in the city. Her husband works outside the city because he has migrated to seek better opportunities to get his family ahead. The house they live in is their property, the fruit of their work as a couple.

Ana spends her time in her house, dedicated to her family. To contribute to the family finances, she raises chickens and guinea pigs. She also farms and sells her harvests in the city market. 

She is going to invest the money in buying seeds, fertilizer and chickens in order to keep growing her business.
 
Her goal is to have a grocery store.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer and chickens.

loans.name: Adidjatou

texts.fr: Adidjatou est âgée de 51ans. Son mari est retraité et ils ont ensemble 04 enfants. L’ainé a 32ans et le dernier 23ans. Elle est revendeuse de potasse dans un marché de la ville de Lomé et à domicile. Elle est une ancienne cliente de WAGES et est à son quatrième crédit. Ce montant qu’elle sollicite, lui servira à acheter de la potasse. Avec les profits, elle veut agrandir l’activité  et assurer les besoins vitaux de la famille.
texts.en:
Adidjatou is 51 years of age. Her husband is retired, and together they have four children. Their oldest child is 32, while the youngest is 23 years of age. 

Adidjatou works reselling potash in a market in the city of Lomé and from home. She is a long-standing WAGES client, and is on her fourth loan. The amount requested will be used to buy potash. With her profits, Adidjatou plans to expand her business and provide for her family’s basic needs.

loans.use: To buy potash.

loans.name: Miguel Antonio

texts.es:
Miguel tiene 27 años, vive al lado de su tía desde hace ya 12 años y la quiere muchísimo como si fuera una madre, su vivienda se ubica en la ciudad de Ica, ciudad que se caracteriza por tener un clima cálido y acogedor, asimismo se desarrolla la agricultura, en especial el cultivo de algodón, esparrago, uva, entre  otros. Miguel es un joven muy trabajador, el se dedica a sus labores como chofer de carga pesada, el labora alrededor de 8 horas al día, ya que con el fruto de su trabajo puede apoyar a su tía con los gastos del hogar.

Miguel está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá realizar la construcción de una pared ´para poder cercar la casa de su tía ya que con ello podrá tener más seguridad en la vivienda y el podrá seguir trabajando y luchando para hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Poder ayudar a su tía a terminar de construir su vivienda”.
texts.en:
Miguel is 27 years old. He has lived with his aunt for 12 years and loves her very much, as if she were his mother. His house is located in the city of Ica. It is a city characterized by its warm and pleasing climate. There is a lot of farming there, especially cotton, asparagus, grapes and more. Miguel is a hardworking young man dedicated to his job as a truck driver. He works around 8 hours a day, since with his work he is able to help his aunt with the household expenses.

Miguel is very grateful to the Kiva lenders because thanks to the help they have offered he will be able to build a wall to enclose his aunt's house in order to have more security. He will also be able to keep working and fighting to make his biggest dream come true: being able to help his aunt finish building her house.

loans.use: to build a wall

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr: Madame Afi est mariée à un électricien Auto-Moto. Elle a 03 enfants tous scolarisés. L’ainé a 15ans et le dernier 08ans. Elle a appris la couture. A la fin de son apprentissage, elle exerce son activité à domicile en 2009. En plus de son activité de couture, elle vend des pagnes. C’est pour l’achat des pagnes, qu’elle sollicite l’aide de WAGES. Elle voudrait agrandir son stock, avoir une boutique de vente de pagnes et assurer l’épanouissement de la famille.
texts.en:
Afi is married to a car and motorbike electrician, and has three children, all of whom are at school. Her oldest child is 15, while the youngest is 8 years of age.

Afi learned the sewing trade and, at the end of her apprenticeship in 2009, began working from home. In addition to her sewing business, she also sells “pagnes” [traditional wrap-around cloth]. She has requested assistance from WAGES to buy pagnes. Afi would like to increase her stock, have a store where she can sell pagnes, and make sure that her family gets ahead.

loans.use: To buy “pagnes” [traditional wrap-around cloth].

loans.name: Dodji

texts.fr: Dodji est un jeune homme célibataire de 28ans. Il est revendeur de chaussures dans une boutique et rencontre par moment de la concurrence sur le marché. Il est dans ce domaine il y a 04ans et sollicite un second crédit dans notre institution pour acheter des chaussures. Il veut réinvestir dans l’activité, avoir d’autres boutiques et disposer un pouvoir d’achat au dessus de la moyenne pour fonder un foyer plus tard.
texts.en: Dodji is a young, single man who is 28 years of age. He works reselling shoes in a store, and currently faces competition in the market. He has worked in this field for four years, and has asked for a second loan from this institution to buy shoes. Dodji plans to reinvest in his business, have more stores, and have above-average purchasing power, so that he can have a home in the future.

loans.use: To buy shoes.

loans.name: Sédikatou

texts.fr: Sédikatou est veuve de 51ans. Elle a 03 enfants  tous à l’école. Le premier a 30ans et le dernier 24ans. Elle est revendeuse de profession. Elle vend à domicile des produits de mercerie. C’est pour renforcer son troisième prêt, elle va acheter des produits de mercerie. Avec les profits qu’elle va réaliser, elle veut élargir l’activité tout en assurant les besoins vitaux de la famille.
texts.en:
Sédikatou is a 51-year-old widow, and has three children, all of whom are at school. Her oldest child is 30, while the youngest is 24 years of age. She works as a reseller, selling haberdashery products from home.

Sédikatou has requested a third loan to buy haberdashery items. With the profits she makes, she plans to expand her business, while still making sure to provide for her family’s basic needs.

loans.use: To buy haberdashery items.

loans.name: Fati

texts.fr: Veuve de 40ans, Madame Fati est mère de 02 enfants. Ils sont âgés de 20 et 17ans et ne vont plus à l’école. Pour prendre en charge les besoins de la famille, elle vend depuis 1998 des céréales. Son activité se déroule à domicile et au marché. Avec ce quatrième crédit qu’elle sollicite dans notre institution, elle va s’approvisionner dans les marchés de l’intérieur. Elle veut épargner les profits et assurer les besoins vitaux de la famille.
texts.en:
Fati is a 40-year-old widow and mother of two children, ages 20 and 17, who no longer attend school. She has been selling cereals since 1998 in order to be able to provide for her family's needs.

Fati conducts her business both from home and at a market. With this fourth loan that she is requesting, she will stock up on inventory at the central markets. She wants to save her profits and guarantee the basic needs of her family.

loans.use: to purchase cereals

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Nadzi

texts.en:
This is 28-year-old Nadzi.  She is married and has two children, all of whom are in school.

In 2010, Nadzi established her charcoal business.  She began her business because she wanted to assist her husband in taking care of the children. Working seven days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about KES 7,000 every month from this business.

She would like a loan in the amount of KES 10,000.  Nadzi now requires this loan in order to buy four sacks of charcoal for sale, so as to meet the needs of her customers.  In the future, Nadzi plans to open more businesses.  She is thanking you for your support.

loans.use: to buy four sacks of charcoal for sale

loans.name: Nadège Flore

texts.fr: Nadège est une jeune femme de 25 ans, mariée et mère de 03 enfants un scolarisé  .Elle a aussi 03 autres personnes à sa charge.Elle est coiffeuse et exerce son  activité dans un quartier de la place depuis 05 ans.Son esprit créatif,son savoir faire et son dynamisme lui ont valu une grande clientèle qu' elle a du mal à satisfaire à cause de la rupture permanente des stocks de marchandises.Elle sollicite un crédit pour augmenter ses stocks de marchandises(achat des mèches, greffes, huiles de traitement...)afin de satisfaire sa clientèle grandissante.les bénéfices générés l'aideront à reinvestir dans son activité et mieux éduquer ses enfants.
texts.en:
Nadège is a 25-year-old young woman, married and the mother of 3 children, one of whom attends school. She also has 3 other dependents under her care. Nadège is a hair stylist and has been working in a neighborhood of the square for the last 5 years.

Nadège's creative spirit, her knowledge, and her dynamic personality have won her such a large customer base that she has trouble meeting demand because she is often out of stock of her merchandise. She is requesting a loan to increase her inventory of merchandise (purchasing hair extensions, hair weaves, treatment oils, etc.) in order to meet the growing demand of her customers. The profits generated will help her to reinvest in her business and to better educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase small materials (hair extensions, hair weaves, etc.)

loans.name: Erdenebat

texts.en:
Mr Erdenebat is 38 years old and lives with his wife and two children in a small private house in Ulaanbaatar.  His profession is an electrician, but he has never worked in his profession.  He is a quiet-natured and helpful person.  His wife helps in his business, and his two children stay at home.  

He started his pastoral cattle breeding business in 2002 and is still running it.  He has improved his business by building a shed for his cattle.  Now he is building a new house for better living conditions for his family.  He needs some materials to finish the house so he is requesting 3 000 000 MNT to purchase construction materials, including vacuum windows and insulation.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials, including vacuum windows and insulation

loans.name: La Verite Group

texts.fr: La cliente Kavira est Conseillère de groupement de crédit La Vérité, Femme courageuse, entrepreneur, âgée de 32 ans, mariée, mère de 4 enfants. Tous ses enfants étudient sauf le cadet. Son mari est un chômeur. Elle est  vendeuse de denrées alimentaires. Elle commença son entreprise avec le fonds propre reçu de son mari, il ya environs 5 ans.  Alors, elle bénéficia le premier  crédit de l’IMF Hekima pour fonds additionnels vers les années 2010. Dit-elle,  cette activité fait grandir ses enfants. Les bénéfices de son activité servent d’épargne, d’alimentation et scolarité. Cependant, elle vient d’obtenir  son  7eme  cycle de crédit. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir d’approvisionner des farines, huiles, haricots, etc., le reste d'argent lui servira de payer les fournitures scolaires de ses enfants. En plus, elle ambitionne construire confortablement une maison d’habitation. La cliente remercie Hekima et ses partenaires pour  les actions d’autonomisation de pauvres femmes à faible revenu. Il sied de signaler qu’une cliente porte son bébé.
texts.en:
Kavira is the head of the La Vérité (The Truth) loan group. She is a brave and entrepreneurial woman, is 32 years of age, and is mother to four children. All of her children are at school, except for the youngest, and her husband is a driver.

Kavira works selling food items, and began her business using funds received from her husband about five years ago. She then benefitted from her first loan from the Hekima microfinance institution around 2010, which gave her additional funds. She said that this helped her raise her children. The profits generated by her business allow her to save, as well as to school and feed her family.

However, Kavira has now applied for a seventh loan. This new loan will be used to buy supplies of flour, oil, beans, etc., and the rest of the money will be used to buy school items for her children. She also plans to build a home. Kavira thanks Hekima and its partners for the steps they take to help poor women with low income become more autonomous. Please note that one of the clients in the photo is carrying her baby.

loans.use: To buy flour, oil, beans, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase small supplies (bags of flour, drums of oil, bags of beans, etc.)

loans.name: Augustine

texts.en:
Augustine is a forty eight year old married man with six children hailing from Kasese, Uganda.  Four years ago he decided to venture into commercialized farming since agriculture is the backbone of the Ugandan economy and he says it was a wise decision.  With the proceeds he has been able to pay school fees for his children and buy more land.

Like all farmers he is faced by challenges in unpredictable weather changes and inadequate capital to purchase modern farming equipment.  His dream is to educate his children up to the University level and to own at least 50 acres of farm land.  Augustine intends to use the loan facility to buy land for farming.

loans.use: to buy land for farming.

loans.name: Verginia

texts.en:
Verginia is 52 years old and lives in the Philippines.  She is married with 5 children.  Verginia buys and sells dried fish in her community.  She has had this business for 6 years. 

She requested a loan for PHP 4,000 to buy stocks of dried fish to resell.  Verginia has been a member of HSPFI since 2010.  In the future,Verginia hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of dried fish to resell

loans.name: Marceline

texts.fr: Marceline est une femme mariée de 35 ans. Elle est commerçante dans un marché de la pl0ce depuis 9 ans ou elle vend le pistache. son activté fonctionne normalement .Elle a un bonne connaissance des fournisseurs, et surtout de sa clientèle qu'elle a acquise au fil du temps grâce à son expérience dans ce domaine. Elle souhaiterai augmenter son stock de marchandises en achetant son pistache en gros (sacs) pour détailler ensuite ceci rapporte plus et lui permettra de mieux satisfaire la demande constante de sa clientèle et d'éviter les ruptures de stocks. Elle économisera son bénéfice pour non seulement agrandir son activité en réinvestissant une grande partie de son bénéfice,mais aussi subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en: Marceline is a 35-year-old married woman. She has been selling goods at a local market for 9 years, where she sells pistachios. Her business is operating normally. She knows the suppliers well, and knows the customers that she has acquired over time - thanks to her experience in her line of work - especially well. She would like to increase her product inventory by buying pistachios wholesale (by the bag) in order to resell them retail. This would generate more earnings and would enable her to satisfy her steady customer demand and avoid stock shortages. She will save her profits so that she can both grow her business by reinvesting in it and take care of her family's needs.

loans.use: to buy bags of pistachios

loans.name: Karorero Group

texts.fr:
Daniel fait partie du groupe Karorero  et  habite à Gitega. Il a 55 ans et sa femme  est cultivatrice. Ensemble ils ont  9 enfants, âgés de  14 à 33 ans, dont  8 étudient.

Il fait le commerce de chèvres depuis  29 ans. 

Il est à son cinquième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il va  augmenter son capital et acheter beaucoup de chèvres à revendre pour  gagner plus.
texts.en:
Daniel is part of the Karorero group, and lives in Gitega. He is 55 years of age, and his wife is a farmer. Together they have nine children, aged between 14 and 33. Eight of their children are at school.

Daniel has worked buying and selling goats for 29 years, and this is his fifth loan with Turame. With the Kiva loan he obtains, he will increase his capital and buy lots of goats, which he will resell to earn more.

loans.use: To increase his capital and buy lots of goats, which he will resell to earn more.

loans.name: Hodari Group

texts.fr: La cliente Mawazo, doyenne du groupe Hodari, femme dynamique, âgée de 45 ans, veuve et mère de 11 enfants. Son mari fut décédé suite à une maladie subite. La cliente est vendeuses des souliers et  d’habit dames. Elle commença ses activités avec son fonds propre reçu par son défunt mari. Elle expose ses marchandises dans un marché au centre ville. La cliente évoque l’insuffisance du capital rotatif. Ce nouveau crédit va lui servir de payer 20 pairs de souliers. Elle souhaite voir ses enfants grandir, construire une belle maison et accroitre son entreprise. Ainsi, elle remercie Hekima et ses partenaires pour soutenir les pauvres femmes non bancables.
texts.en:
Mawazo, the head of the Hodari group, is a dynamic woman who is 45 years of age. She is a widow, and is mother to 11 children. Her husband died following a sudden illness.

Mawazo works selling shoes and women’s clothing, and began her business with her own funds which she received from her deceased husband. She displays her merchandise in a market in the center of town, and mentions that she has insufficient working capital. 

Mawazo will use this new loan to buy 20 pairs of shoes. She wants to see her children grow, build a nice house, and expand her business. She also thanks Hekima and its partners for their support of poor women who cannot avail of traditional banking methods.

loans.use: To buy 20 pairs of shoes.

loans.name: Yannick Duplexe

texts.fr: yannick est un homme âgé de27 ans.Il gère un sécrétariat où il exerce son activité depuis 02 ans.son acceuil chaleureux,les prix pratiqués et son enthousiasme lui ont permis d'accroître une clientèle considérable au fil du temps.Suite au deséquilibre entre l'offre et la demande,il sollicite un crédit pour agrandir son activité(achat du petit matériel informatique).Les bénéfices générés lui permettront de recruter le maximum de personnel,étendre son activité et subvenir aux besoins de sa petite famille.
texts.en:
Yannick is a 27-year-old man, who has run a secretarial services business for two years. His warm welcome, affordable prices and enthusiasm have meant that he has built up a considerable customer base over time. 

As a result of an imbalance between supply and demand, Yannick has requested a loan to expand his business (by buying minor IT equipment).The profits generated will allow him to recruit a large number of personnel, expand his business, and provide for his small family.

loans.use: To expand his business (by buying minor IT equipment).

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is 63 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has six children. 

Lolita  has a food/retail shop or sari-sari store that sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products and beverages. She had this business for 16 years. 

She requested a loan for 5,000 PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages. Lolita  has been a member of HSPFI since 2006. In the future, Lolita hopes to improve her business for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Marie Thérèse Claudine

texts.fr: Marie Therese est une femme mariée de 39 ans mère d'enfants. Elle est commerçante dans un marché de la place depuis 10 ans déjà. Elle vend les vivres frais(plantains et banannes)selon les saisons.la vente des plantains est une activité qui rapporte, mais la petitesse de son stock de marchandises entraine de nombreuses ruptures et ne lui permet pas de satisfaire convenablement sa clientèle. Ce crédit lui permettra alors de s'approvisionner en grande quantité afin de répondre à la demande de ses clients et de ce fait d'augmenter ses ventes et son bénéfice. Elle réinvestira une partie de ce bénéfice dans son activité afin de devenir grossiste dans la vente des plantains et l'autre pour subvenir aux besoins de sa famille (nutrition et éducation).
texts.en:
Marie Thérèse is a 39-year-old married woman and mother. She has worked selling fresh food (bananas and plantains, depending on the season) in a local market for ten years. 

Plantain selling is a profitable business, but her low stock levels mean that she often runs out, and she can therefore not always easily satisfy her customers. This loan will allow Marie Thérèse to buy a large quantity of supplies, so that she can meet her customers’ requests and, therefore, increase her sales and income. She plans to reinvest part of her profit in her business so that she can become a plantain wholesaler. The rest will be used to provide for her family (food and education).

loans.use: To buy a truckload of plantains.

loans.name: Thereza

texts.en:
Thereza is a 48-year-old married woman with three children living in Kasese, Uganda.

After assessing the lucrative nature of the transport sector, she decided to invest in motorcycle transport and with the income earned, she has been able to buy land and pay school fees for her children. Thereza's courage is such as you can rarely find, given the cultural set up that women are not supposed to ride motorcycles, but she does.

She has been in business for three years. Her major challenges are high fuel costs and the poor road network, while her business dream is to hire out the motorcycle and venture into farming if she gets enough capital. Thereza intends to use the loan to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Ub

texts.en:
Ub is 36 years of age and he continually manages a rice-farming business as a primary source of income. Earnings from this business are a great help in supporting their living needs and educating his two school-aged children. Ub has been in this occupation for more than 24 years, generating approximately 30,000 KHR per day. During his entrepreneurship, Ub improved his business gradually and he dreams of experiencing financial stability some day.

Ub would like to acquire a loan as additional working capital in the amount of 1,500,000 KHR to purchase fertilizers for his crops. Through these supplies and his hard work, he hopes to have a fruitful harvest and thus increase his household income.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers for his crops.

loans.name: Lia

texts.en:
Lia is from the Gardabani district of East Georgia. She is 34 years old, married and lives with her husband and two children. Her husband works at the Ministry of Internal Affairs of Georgia and gets a monthly income. 

Lia runs a family agricultural business. In particular, she owns three milk cows and pigs. Lia milks her cows twice a day and produces cheese, which is sold locally. The family sells piglets as well. Lia is a very hardworking woman, with a great desire to get ahead. 

She requested a loan to build a cattle-shed for her pigs. The existing one is very small and it’s already impossible to keep livestock there. With this credit, Lia will purchase building materials and expand the cattle shed. After the cattle shed is built, Lia will purchase additional pigs, raise them and sell them during winter season. This will increase the income of the family. With the increased income, Lia will improve the living conditions of her family. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to build a cattle shed.

loans.name: Masika

texts.en:
Masika lives in Kisauni Town with her husband and three children, all of whom are in school. 

Masika has been involved in her business for the past 12 years: She sells dumplings and peas from her home. She is proud of her business because she makes a profit, and with the profit, she buys more goods to improve her business. She also feels independent. 

She is requesting this loan to purchase wheat flour, cooking oil, baking powder, and five kilograms of peas. Her plan is to educate her children and build a rental house.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour, cooking oil, baking powder, and five kilograms of peas.

loans.name: Felisters

texts.en:
Felisters works hard to support her family. She is married and has a tailoring business in the town of Kisauni. She requested a KES 20,000 loan through Yehu to buy more clothing material and sewing thread. She has been in this business for 2 years. She says she obtained the skills after attending a tailoring and dressmaking college in her community.

In the future, Felisters would like to save enough money to expand her business and open a kiosk. She is working hard to support her family: her husband and her single child who is the source of joy to their marriage.

loans.use: to buy more clothing material and sewing thread.

loans.name: Marie Paule

texts.fr: acsMarie Paule est une femme de 48 ans mariée, mère d'enfants. Elle exerce une activité de commerce en détail où elle vend des vivres frais et secs (riz, haricots, arachides, tomate, huile...) dans un marché de la place en fonction des saisons. Elle aimerait agrandir son activité en achetant ses produits en gros (sacs), çalui évitera les ruptures de stocks qu'elle a tout le temps. ce crédit lui permettra non seulement de satisfaire sa clientèle déjà grandissante, mais aussi d'augmenter ses bénéfices. Bénéfices qui lui permettront de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille dont elle a la charge en partie, économiser pour leurs scolarités et avec le temps, d'agrandir son fond de commerce et ouvrir une alimentation.
texts.en:
Marie Paule is a 48-year-old married woman and mother. She works selling fresh and dried food (rice, beans, peanuts, tomatoes, oil) on a retail basis. She works in a local market, and her job is seasonal. 

Marie Paule would like to expand her business by buying wholesale products (sacks), which will help her avoid her current constant stock shortages. This loan will not only allow her to satisfy her already growing customer base, but also to increase her profits. She will use these profits to provide for her family (part of which is under her care), to save for their education and, in time, to increase her working capital and open a food store.

loans.use: To buy two sacks of rice, drums of oil, and a sack of peanuts.

loans.name: Tseveenrolom

texts.en:
Tseveenrolom is 38 years old and lives with her husband and three children in a ger, a Mongolian yurt, in the Uvurhangai province of Mongolia. Her husband, Munhsaihan, is 39 years old and is a stoker for a private company. Her three children go to the local secondary school. 

She started her own hairdressing business in 2008. Now, her business is sustainable and has many regular customers who compliment her work and identify her as a diligent woman. 

She is requesting 600,000 MNT loan to purchase felt underlining for her ger. Tseveenrolom's goal is to increase her profit and save money to build a house.

loans.use: To purchase a felt underlining for her ger.

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.en:
Magdalena is a merchant from Talibon, Bohol, Philippines. She has run a sari-sari or convenience store for more than five years now. This is the source of her daily income.

Magdalena is in need of additional capital for her business. She is asking for a loan of 12,000 PHP to buy more stock to sell in here store such as canned goods, rice, soda and other snack foods. Through this loan, Magdalena will be able to cater to more customers in her place.

In the future, Magdalena hopes to expand her current business so that it will continue to generate income necessary for the needs of the family.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell in her store such as canned goods, rice and soda.

loans.name: Purevodrj

texts.en:
Mr Purevodrj lives with his two sons in a ger in Uvurhangai province, Mongolia. His wife is deceased. His older son, Baljinnyam, is 9 years old and his younger son, Baljinnyam, is 6 years old. Both are  secondary school students. 

Mr Purevdorj started to fix cars in his own courtyard in 2000, and he has continued to work at the same place since then. Consequently, he has many years of business and practical experience. 

Uvurhangai province's air is very polluted in the winter season from the exhaust of automobile gasoline engines. He is planning to convert engines from gasoline (petrol) to compressed natural gas (CNG) and LPG. He is a quiet-natured and hardworking man, and he needs 1,500,000 MNT to purchase equipment that he will use to make a natural gas car.

loans.use: To purchase equipment that he will use to make a natural gas car.

loans.name: Meralin

texts.en:
Meralin runs a sari-sari store in Bohol, Philippines. She has two young children, ages six and five. 

Meralin is in need of additional capital for her business. She is asking for a loan of 8,000PHP to buy canned goods, noodles, soda, snack foods and other home use products to sell in her store. Having more offerings in the store will bring in more customers.

In the future, Meralin wants to improve her business and save for the future schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy more canned goods, noodles, soda, snack foods and other home use products to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
Halima is still in her clothes-selling business. She is happy for the support given by both Yehu and Kiva, which she hopes will continue. 

Halima is taking out another loan so as to improve her business. She aims at opening other outlets. Thanks to her hard work, she has been able to help her husband support the family. With this new loan, she will be able to purchase bales of khangas (traditional dresses) for sale. In this way, she will continue providing for her family.

loans.use: to purchase bales of khangas, a traditional type of dress, for sale.

loans.name: Dairy

texts.es:
Dairy tiene 21 años y nació en Arauca. En estos momentos está estudiando ingeniería electrónica en la Universidad Industrial de Santander, una de las mejores universidades de ingeniería en Colombia. Todo esto, gracias a que ha logrado importantes descuentos en su matrícula por su excelente rendimiento académico y ya que también vive en uno de los barrios con menores recursos de Bucaramanga. 

Dairy vive con su madre que se encuentra desempleada, y es la mayor de 3 hermanas. Ahora quiere solicitar este préstamo con Kiva porque es la única manera que tiene para poder pagar el curso de preparación e inscripción al examen del TOEFL, que son los primeros pasos para poder lograr su sueño.

La siguiente es su historia:

El hombre no termina de soñar hasta que limita su propia existencia. Visualizo mi juventud como la oportunidad más grande de soñar y de atreverme sin ningún reparo a cumplir todo lo que me he propuesto. Es ahí, en medio de mis objetivos e ilusiones, donde  concibo el conocimiento como la mayor riqueza en cuanto a que es invaluable, impermutable, memorable y digna de considerarse como la fortuna de la que no puede despojarse al ser humano.

Está entre mis aspiraciones como estudiante la idea de adquirir e interiorizar todo lo que aprenda para así mismo, luego de haberme formado  y logrado en un ámbito de  estudios más avanzados, poder emprender un camino de regreso a mi país y aplicar de una manera sólida y ejecutable dichos conocimientos. De esta manera poder aportar en el desarrollo tecnológico, económico y social; tres factores que hoy por hoy son esencialmente  fundamentales para el desarrollo íntegro de un país.

Soy una  estudiante con buenos resultados académicos, dispuesta a trabajar en forma paralela con el desarrollo tecnológico del país, con muchos deseos de integrar lo que he aprendido con nuevos saberes que puedan contribuir a mi formación académica y espiritual. Creo que nunca se termina de aprender y que cada día tenemos el deber de aprovechar cada momento que nos brinda la vida y el tiempo para cultivar el saber. El mundo del conocimiento es un mundo abierto a quién quiera  irrumpir en él y yo estoy dispuesta a hacerlo.
texts.en:
Dairy, age 21, was born in Arauca.  At this time she is studying Electrical Engineering at the Universidad Industrial de Santander, one of the best engineering universities in Colombia.  This is all thanks to the important tuition discounts she managed to get because of her excellent academic performance and because she lives in one of the neighborhoods with the least resources in Bucaramanga.

Dairy lives with her mother, who is unemployed.  She is the oldest of three sisters.  She now wants to request this loan from Kiva because it is the only way she has to be able to pay for the preparation course and registration for the TOEL exams, which are the first steps to being able to fulfill her dream.

The following is her story:  

Man does not stop dreaming until he limits himself.  In my youth I visualized the biggest opportunity to be dreaming and to dare, without qualms, to complete everything I had proposed to do.  It is here, in the middle of my objectives and hopes, where I realize that knowledge is the greatest wealth.  It is invaluable, constant, memorable, and worthy of being considered to be the fortune that cannot be taken away from people. 

It is among my aspirations as a student to acquire and internalize everything that is learned.  Later, after having done this in an atmosphere of more advanced studies, I want to able to undertake a path of returning to my county and applying, in a sound and executable way, said knowledge.  In this way I will be able to contribute to the country’s technological, financial, and social development.  These are three factors that are now essentially fundamental to the complete development of a country.

I am a student with good academic credentials.  I am prepared to work closely with the technological development of the country.  I will do so with a great desire to integrate what I have learned with new knowledge that can contribute to my academic and spiritual formation.

I believe that you never stop learning.  Every day we have the obligation to take advantage of each moment life gives us and the time to cultivate knowledge.  The world of knowledge is open to anyone who wants to enter it, and I am prepared to do so.

loans.use: to pay the application expenses for her Master's Degree studies in Environmental and Energy engineering.

loans.name: Gnem

texts.en:
Gnem is 43 years old, married, and has four children. She operates a hog-raising business from the Baray district to support her living. Two of her younger children help in developing the business besides their class schedule, while the other two are employed as paid workers in a neighboring country and send their remittances as the family’s support. 

Gnem is taking out a loan from HKL and Kiva to make improvements to her hog-raising business. She will use the loan to purchase 10 piglets and feed for fattening them. She hopes that this time, she will be able to enlarge her profit for the welfare of the family. In the future, she dreams of having a big pig farm and ensuring a bright future for her two school-aged children.

loans.use: to purchase 10 piglets and feed for fattening them.

loans.name: Marabella

texts.en:
Marabella is a 52-year-old married woman from Talibon, Bohol, Philippines. She has been engaged in a sari-sari or general store business for more than two years now. 

She joined CEVI because she wanted to gain access to the financial services offered by the organization. Marabella is asking for a loan of 12,000 PHP to buy more merchandise to sell such as snack foods, canned goods, detergents, personal care products and others. She believes that this loan could help her realize her dream of improving her business and her income as well.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise to sell such as snack foods, canned goods, detergents, personal care products and others.

loans.name: Heak

texts.en:
Heak is 29 years of age and lives in the Baray district with her spouse and three children who attend school. To make a livelihood, she is in the farming business, where the major income is made to cover her daily costs. She has been doing this for over 10 years now. She has her husband who always gives great assistance in maintaining this type of business.

Due to insufficient capital, she is now asking for a loan of 700,000 KHR to purchase fertilizers to apply on her rice crops. This purchase will give a good growth to her rice, thus offer a higher production. Someday she hopes to experience a better quality of life as she strives to work harder.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers to apply on her rice crops.

loans.name: Purevsuren

texts.en:
Mrs. Purevsuren, 42 years old, lives with her mother and son in an apartment in the Khan-uul district of Ulaanbaatar city. Her son is a high school student.  

Since 1995, Purevsuren has worked in the "National Center for Infectious Diseases With Natural Foci" as a laboratory technician. Now, however, she is planning to start her own private business selling beauty products. 

She needs 2,000,000 MNT to purchase beauty product inventory for her retail beauty shop. She is a hardworking woman who says, ''I will spend the profits from my business on my son's tuition.''

loans.use: To purchase beauty product inventory for her retail beauty shop.

loans.name: Oung

texts.en:
Oung, 24, is a hard-working woman who dedicates herself to a rice farming business as her main source of income. She owns around two hectares of farmland, on which she grows and harvests rice. She can earn about 8,000 KHR per day, whereas her husband earns 16,000 KHR from a recycling business. 

Oung is requesting a loan of 1,200,000 KHR to purchase a used motorcycle, which can be used both for home use as well as for the recycling business (transporting recycled materials back and forth to the market). She hopes this loan will be approved, so that she can better her standard of living. She is hoping for financial stability someday.

loans.use: to purchase a used motorcycle, which can be used both for home use as well as for a recycling business (transporting recycled materials back and forth to the market).

loans.name: Salim

texts.en:
Salim lives in the Mombasa area of Coast province, Kenya. She owns a restaurant, a business she has been operating for some time now. She also sells food stuffs from her home.

Salim is applying for a new loan of 50,000 Kenya shillings to purchase flour, meat, food flavoring, and other necessary items. The extra income from this loan will be saved to expand the business.

loans.use: to purchase flour, meat, food flavoring, and other necessary items.

loans.name: Felisa

texts.en:
Felisa is a 43-year-old married woman with four children. The oldest is 15 and the youngest is 3. Felisa has been in the business of hog raising and basket weaving for 2 years now.  Her husband drives and does work as a carpenter to help in raising their family.

She is asking for a loan of 8,000 PHP to buy commercial feed and piglets so she can increase her income. Her profit will be for her family's healthy diet and school fees. 

In the future, Felisa would like to have a bigger barn for her hogs and have other business options to make a better profit for her family.

loans.use: to buy commercial feed and piglets

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.en:
Jacqueline is 32 years old with three children living in Masindi, Uganda. Jacqueline set up a spare parts shop in order to bring building materials nearer to her community and also earn income to support her family. Since there are only three people dealing in the business in her village, she is assured of customers. She is faced with the challenges of inadequate capital to meet the high demand and theft.

Jacqueline never got a chance to go to the University but wishes to educate her children to attain degrees as a minimum qualification and buy land to grow crops. She is requesting a loan to buy spare parts to sell.

loans.use: to buy spare parts to sell

loans.name: Mwanaisha

texts.en:
Mwanaisha has been managing her preparatory school for the past 5 years and she is loved by all her companions there. Her husband, who works as a teacher, helps with the family expenses. Mwanaisha is a very honest and responsible person.

She is requesting a loan to renovate some classrooms. Her biggest dream is to improve her school and attract more pupils.

loans.use: to renovate some classrooms

loans.name: Nila

texts.en:
Nila runs a sari-sari or convenience store in their place in Bohol, Philippines. She has been engaged in this business for more than five years now.
As of this time, Nila needs funds for the expansion of her business. She is asking for a loan worth 6,000 PHP to purchase more stock to sell such as detergents, shampoo, snack foods, canned and dry goods, etc. Nila believes that if she will be provided with financial support through this loan, she can finally make dreams come true.

In the future, Nila wants to see her business be a successful one.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell such as detergents, shampoo, snack foods, canned and dry goods, etc.

loans.name: Jasmin

texts.en:
Jasmin is 23 years old and from the community of Maribojoc, Bohol.  She is married with two young children ages 1 and 2. She is helping her husband, who is a farmer, by buying and selling coconut wine. She is determined to make her business successful.

She is asking for a loan to buy more coconut wine, tungog (food coloring that gives coconut wine its maroon color and bitter taste that helps the natural fermentation) and five-gallon containers. This way she can accommodate more orders from her customers.

In the future, she hopes to have another means to earn an income for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy more coconut wine, food coloring and five-gallon containers

loans.name: Nino

texts.en:
Nino is from Gardabani district, East Georgia. She is married and lives with her husband, David. David takes wood from the forest and sells it in his village and nearby villages. 

Nino runs a small dairy business. In particular, she has a milk cow and produces cheese, which is sold locally. Nino has been involved in this type of business for over ten years and has a rich experience in her job.

She has applied for this loan to increase the number of cattle. With the requested loan, she plans to purchase additional milk cows. This will allow Nino to obtain more milk for her dairy and increase the sales of her production. Nino will have an opportunity to increase her income and improve the family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase milk cows.

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en:
Analiza is a 46-year-old farmer from the town of Trinidad, Bohol. She grows rice for an income. She is working hard to support the needs of her four children ages 10, 14, 18 and 19. Analiza is dependent on her harvest after every four months to support her family. 

She is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer for her farm so she can have a good harvest of rice for both consumption and profit.
 
In the future, she hopes to till more land so she can farm more crops for her children's needs.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Chot

texts.en:
Chot is 53 years old and married with eight children. It’s quite a big family, which sometimes causes her to experience financial difficulties due to the high cost of commodities. Chot, however, tries hard to be dedicated to her retail business, from which she is able to make approximately 32,000 KHR each day. She loves doing her business because she can build a good communication with people in her community. She has been operating this since 2010. 

Chot plans to increase stock of her merchandise to satisfy her customers’ needs, but due to inadequate capital, she is asking for a loan of 1,500 USD to purchase items such as noodles, spices, powders, shampoos, beverages, snack foods, cosmetics, kitchen supplies, and other household products to sell. She says that the loan will enable her to improve her current stock, and she hopes that she will become successful in the future.

loans.use: to purchase items like noodles, spices and shampoos to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Andrea

texts.en:
Andrea is 50 years old and a mother of 3 children. She and her family live in the municipality of San Miguel, Bohol. She is used to farming, since having her family this has been their source of livelihood. Like most couples, she and her husband work together and strive hard to meet the needs of their family. 

She realized that she could do better with her farming if given financial assistance. She requested a loan to be used in buying quality seedlings, fertilizer and to pay for labor. The extra income that Andrea can get from this will be used for her family’s daily consumption and reinvestment in the business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, quality seedlings and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Thath

texts.en:
Thath lives in a peaceful village of Baray district with her single child, while her older child is settled for marriage and lives separately. Thath is 48 years old and a widow who devotes her full attention to a rice farming business. It’s the sole source of her income. She also has her child help her manage their rice field. She has been in this business for almost 10 years, earning approximately 8,000 KHR each day.

Thath would like to gain access to financial support to make her business more profitable, so she needs additional capital of 300 USD to purchase a plot of farmland. She hopes to increase to a higher production from her rice field in years to come. With the generated income, she will reinvest back to her business to further develop it towards the attainment of her goals.

loans.use: to purchase a plot of farmland.

loans.name: Damdin-Ochir

texts.en:
Damdin-Ochir is a 23-year-old guy who lives with his mother and sister in the outer ger district, which lacks basic infrastructure, of Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. His family lives in a small house, which is very old. The windows and some parts of the house let the wind blow through, so the house needs some renovation work. Thus he requests a Kiva loan from kind lenders. 

With this loan he will purchase the necessary construction materials to make better living conditions for his sister and mother. He is the only man of his family, so he is very hardworking and ambitious to have a good life.

loans.use: to renovate his old, unsafe house.

loans.name: Anecita

texts.en:
Anecita is a 47-year-old married woman and a mother of six children from Bohol, Philippines. She has been in the fishing business for more than five years now. Her husband works as a fisherman. This is the source of their income. She works hard to support her husband in meeting the needs of the family. 

Now she is asking for a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy fuel and to pay for the repair of the fishing boat. With this, her husband will be able to enhance his daily catch, thus allowing them to sell more fish to the market.

Anecita dreams of improving their lives. Moreover, she wants to continue to send her children to school for better learning and education.

loans.use: to buy fuel and to pay for the repair of the fishing boat.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en: Anita is 45 years old. She supports her family by farming rice. She is married with three children ages 7, 12 and 14. She and her family live in San Miguel, Bohol. She and her husband helped each other in tilling the land hoping for a good harvest. She applied for a loan to buy fertilizer, pesticides, quality seedlings, and to pay for labor. They are expecting a better yield on their crops for having the means now to buy the needed farming maintenance. Any income derived from this business will be spent on her family's daily consumption and future business investment.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, pesticides, quality seedlings and pay for labor

loans.name: Yaovi

texts.fr: Yaovi est un jeune revendeur d’huile à moteur  âgé de 25 ans. Père de 02 enfants dont un (01) seul est scolarisé, il a débuté cette activité en 2010 et ne dispose que d’un étalage précaire.
