Por lo general trabajan durante todo el día y solo los fines de semana descansan y se dedican a su hija. En temporadas de cosecha tiene a cargo a peones que contratan para que les faciliten el trabajo.

Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, por lo que se compromete a cumplir con sus respectivos pagos; además, agradece a su banco comunal por la transparencia y veracidad de sus miembros.
Con estos 4,000 nuevos soles podrá realizar el mantenimiento de su terreno de cultivo. Contratará jornaleros para que quiten la mala hierba y abonen sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Octavia is 39 years old and her partner Revelino is 33. They have a five-year-old daughter together. They own the house where they live and purchased it together.
 
They have been growing cocoa beans for twenty years. Octavia is very happy with what she has achieved so far, and she aspires to expand her plantations into other areas so that she can sell her products to wholesale dealers, which would minimize transportation costs, since they would come to her farm to make their purchases. She gets up as eagerly as ever every morning and, along with her husband, goes to their plot of land to take care of their crops. During the harvest season she is in charge of the laboreres they hire in order to facilitate the work.

This is her second loan with MFP, and she promises to comply with each of her payment terms. She would also like to thank her communal bank for their transparency and the honesty of its members.

These 4,000 nuevos soles will allow her to perform maintenance on her land. She will hire laborers to pull weeds and fertilize her crops.

loans.use: to hire laborers to pull weeds and fertilize her crops.

loans.name: Anali

texts.es:
Anali tiene 26 años, es una mujer muy trabajadora y sobre todo con muchas ganas de salir adelante y mejorar su calidad de vida, ella vive en la ciudad de Nazca, ciudad que se caracteriza por su clima cálido y por tener muchos lugares turísticos como “Las Líneas de Nazca”, los “acueductos de Cahuachi”, entre otros. Día a día Anali trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de abarrotes y venta de polo en la pequeña bodega que tiene en su vivienda, ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy amable con los clientes y sobre todo porque ofrece productos a buen precio y de calidad.

Anali está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar más mercadería para su negocio como leche, huevos al por mayor, gaseosas, arroz, azúcar, entre otros; así de esta manera ella podrá tener más variedad de productos y mejorar sus ingresos, lo que le permitirá seguir luchando cada día para hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Tener su casa propia”.
texts.en: Anali is twenty-six years old. She is a very hardworking woman and wants above all to prosper and improve her quality of life. She lives in Nazca, a town known for its warm climate and its many tourist attractions, such as the Nazca lines or the Cahuachi aqueducts. Anali works every day at her small grocery shop in the small cellar she has in her house. She attributes the success of her business to her amiable character and to the fact that she sells quality products at affordable prices. Anali is very grateful to Kiva lenders since, thanks to their help, she will be able to buy more supplies wholesale for her shop, such as milk, eggs, soft drinks, rice, and sugar. This way, she will be able to offer more variety and improve her income, which will allow her to keep working every day towards her greatest dream: having a house of her own.

loans.use: to buy more supplies for her shop.

loans.name: Ganbaatar

texts.en:
Mr. Ganbaatar, age 38, is a master tailor. His wife is also a seamstress; she sews baby and work clothes from her home. They live with their four children in a makeshift house located in Darkhan, the second largest city in Mongolia. 

Soon a new academic year will start in Mongolia. Mr. Ganbaatar and his wife want to increase their working capital so they can increase their sales volume. It is really important to improve their business and life. The loan he is taking will be used to buy fabrics for tailoring.

loans.use: To buy fabrics for tailoring.

loans.name: Buenaventurada

texts.en:
At age 58, Buenaventurada is still strong enough to manage her rice farm. She is married with seven grown children. She and her family live in San Miguel, Bohol. Her husband does the major farming tasks while she assists him in keeping their land free of weeds and pests. This business has provided income and food for her family even when her children were still young. 

Buenaventurada is asking for a loan of 14,000 PHP to buy quality seedlings, fertilizers and pesticides and to pay for labor. In the future, she hopes to retire in comfort. She uses her income now to save for her family's future needs.

loans.use: to buy quality seedlings, fertilizers and pesticides and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Lexy Lorena

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Camino Al Progreso se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

Aquí vive la señorita Lexi, tiene 23 de edad, está soltera y  vive en casa de sus padres.
 
Ella estudia para Licenciada en Ciencias De La Educación en una Universidad De Manta, también tiene una tienda en su casa en la cual además de vender productos de primera necesidad también vende artículos de bazar, útiles escolares, helados entre otras cosas, trabaja todos los días desde las 6h30 hasta las 16h00, desde esa hora hasta la noche su papá se hace cargo del negocio ya que ella  tiene que ir a su Universidad, lleva en su tienda ya por 6 años y que le ha ido muy bien, ella con lo que gana en su negocio les ayuda a sus padres y también se ayuda con sus estudios.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir mas su tienda, va a comprar productos de primera necesidad y útiles escolares. Lleva en el Banco Comunal 3 años  y le gusta porque con los créditos ha podido seguir en su negocio y estudiar al mismo tiempo.
 
Sus metas son seguir adelante en su negocio  y terminar su Licenciatura.
texts.en:
The “Camino Al Progreso” (Road to Progress) communal bank meets every two weeks in Montecristi Canton that’s known for its pre-colonial culture and for its crafts that are renowned both nationally and internationally; it’s where the famous straw hats come from.

Lexi, 23, lives here.  She’s single and lives in her parents’ house.  She is studying to get her bachelor’s degree in education at a university in Manta and also has a store at home where she sells basic staple items, school supplies, frozen treats and other things.  She works every day from 6:30am until 4pm.  From 4pm until nighttime her father takes care of the store because she has to go to the university.  She’s had the store for six years now and has done very well.  She uses what she earns from her store to help her parents and also to help pay for her schooling.

She will use this loan to better stock her store.  She will buy basic staple items and school supplies.  She’s been in the communal bank for 3 years and likes it because she’s been able to stay in business and continue with her studies thanks to the loans.  Her goal is to continue moving forward with her business and to get her bachelor’s degree.

loans.use: to buy basic staple items and school supplies.

loans.name: Ayda Celeste

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Camino Al Progreso se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar vive la señora Aida, tiene 55 años de edad, está casada pero no ha podido tener hijos. Su esposo es taxista. Está en el Banco Comunal desde el inicio y le gusta porque con los créditos se ha podido financiar sus trabajos.

Ella además de atender su hogar y a su esposo también se dedica a la elaboración de productos y manualidades hechos en fomix con varios motivos y formas, hace mucho tiempo la gente le hacen pedidos de sus trabajos más que todo para fiestas infantiles,  a ella le encanta lo que hace ya que con sus obras hace muy feliz a muchos niños, La mayoría de sus obras las hace bajo pedidos con días de anticipación para no quedar mal con sus clientes. Trabaja todos los días por horas y cuando tiene muchos trabajos casi todo el dia, lleva 10 años dedicada a esta labor que le ha traído muchos beneficios económicos y espirituales.

Este crédito es para comprar más materiales para elaborar sus trabajos como fomix, pinturas, pegamentos, entre otras cosas que utiliza.
 
Su sueño es tener buena salud ella y su esposo.
texts.en:
The “Camino Al Progreso” (Road to Progress) communal bank meets every two weeks in Montecristi Canton that’s known for its pre-colonial culture and for its crafts that are renowned both nationally and internationally; it’s where the famous straw hats come from.

Aida, 55, lives here.  She’s married but has been unable to have children.  Her husband is a taxi driver.  She’s been in the communal bank since its beginning and likes it because she’s been able to finance her work with the loans.

In addition to taking care of her home and husband, she also makes crafts out of foamy in various shapes and motifs.  People have asked her for items for children’s parties for a long time now and she loves what she does because she makes many children happy with the items she makes.  Most of the things she makes are done to order days in advance in order not to disappoint her customers.  She works every day for hours and when she has lots of work almost the entire day.  She’s been in this line of work for ten years and it’s brought her many economic and spiritual benefits.

This loan is to buy more materials she needs to make her works like foamy, paint and glue, among other things she uses.  Her dream is for her and her husband to be in good health.

loans.use: to buy foamy, glue, paint and other supplies.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James, age 26, lives in the city of Mombasa. He is single and lives in a rental house. James opened an internet cafe one year ago in order to take advantage of the vicinity where he lives since there is cyber internet there. His services increase on weekends, with more people coming in to browse. 

James is a young entrepreneur who is always exploring new business opportunities. He’s currently applying for a Kiva loan, his first financing from Yehu, because he wants to buy one more computer (desktop). This will provide him with the opportunity to generate more income by satisfying his customers. In this way, he can plan for his future growth.

loans.use: to buy one more computer.

loans.name: Twiteriteka Group

texts.fr:
Josélyne  fait partie du groupe  Twiteriteka et habite à Gitega. Elle a  29 ans et est marié à Janvier, un commerçant. Ensemble ils ont 4 enfants, âgés de  1 à 8 ans dont 2 étudient.

Elle fait le commerce de boutique (savon, riz, haricot, sucre, ..)  depuis  5 ans. 

Elle est à son neuvième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit Kiva qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et   acheter une grande quantité d’articles de sa boutique (savon, riz, haricot, sucre,..)à revendre, pour gagner plus.
texts.en:
Josélyne is a member of the Twiteriteka group and lives in Gitega. She is 29 years old and married to Janvier, a shopkeeper. Together they have 4 children, ages 1 to 8, two of whom are enrolled in school. Josélyne has operated a shop (soap, rice, beans, sugar, etc.) for the last 5 years. This is her ninth loan with Turame.

With the Kiva loan that she will receive, Josélyne will increase her business capital and will purchase a large quantity of items for her shop (soap, rice, beans, sugar, etc.) in order to resell them, so that she can earn more income.

loans.use: to increase her business capital and to purchase a large quantity of items for her shop (soap, rice, beans, sugar, etc.) in order to earn more income

loans.name: Mahmadrasul

texts.ru:
Махмадрасул родился 1980 году в городе Вахдат. Он живет с женой. У него один ребенок. Махмадрасул имеет среднее образование. 
На протяжении трех лет Махмадрасул работает таксистом. Он в основном развозит пассажиров по городу Вахдат. Махмадрасул просит кредит для капитального ремонта своего автомобиля.
texts.en: Mahmadrasul was born in 1980 in the town of Vahdat. He lives with his wife. He has one child. Mahmadrasul has received secondary education. For the last three years, he has been working as  a taxi driver. He mainly transports passengers around the town of Vahdat. Mahmadrasul is requesting a loan for major repairs on his car.

loans.use: for major repairs on his car.

loans.name: Zareena

texts.en:
Zareena  is a married woman. She has been successfully doing a business of cloth trading for the last 3 years. Her collection is very famous in her town. She offers variety of fabrics in different colors to her customers.  She makes enough to lead a decent life.

Zareena is a loving mother of four daughters. She is in charge of providing her family with a good food, health and education. She has step-by-step improved her business by taking loans from the Kashf Foundation. Now she has requested for a loan of Rs 10000 to buy more stock of fabrics in different colors. She hopes to have more profit and hence better support her family.

loans.use: buy fabrics to resell

loans.name: Primitiva

texts.es:
Primitiva tiene 24 años, tiene una pequeña hija de 4 años a quien le dedica toda su atención. Juntas viven en su cada propia, la cual está hecha a base de madera, sus padres se la dieron como herencia.
Ella se dedica a la venta de comestibles (arroz, azúcar, cereales, gaseosa, galletas, verduras, conservas, etc.) en la tienda que acondicionó en su casa hace 2 años. Lo que más es que puede estar permanentemente al cuidado de su hija y atendiendo a sus clientes al mismo tiempo. Sin embargo, los problemas son cuando se queda sin productos, una a dos veces al mes. Por ello ahora acude a MFP para conseguir el capital con el cual abastecer su tienda.

Este es su primer crédito con MFP y se siente comprometida a ser puntual en sus cuotas de pago, para que de esa manera pueda acceder a otro préstamo más adelante. Asimismo, agradece a su banco comunal por brindarle su apoyo para que trabaje junto a ellos. 
Con los 1,000 nuevos soles de este préstamo comprará más comestibles para incrementar el stock de su tienda.
texts.en:
Primitiva is 24 years old and has a young four-year-old daughter to whom she devotes all her attention. They live together in the home she owns, which is made out of wood and was inherited from her parents.

She works selling groceries (rice, sugar, grains, sodas, cookies, vegetables, canned goods, etc.) at a store she set up in her home two years ago. What she likes the most about it is that it allows her to constantly care for her daughter and serve her customers at the same time. However, the problem is when she runs out of products once or twice a month. That is why she has come to MFP, in order to obtain the capital she needs to stock her store.

This is her first loan with MFP and she is committed to paying her installments on time so that she may access another loan in the future. She would also like to thank her communal bank for the support they have provided for her to work with them.

She will use the 1,000 nuevos soles from this loan to purchase more groceries to increase stock in her store.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to stock her store.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maritza tiene 28 años, su pareja es Richard, de 30 años, tienen una hija de 5 años. Juntos viven en la casa que compraron hace 2 años.
Hace un año empezó a vender gaseosas y refrescos desde su casa, por el momento cuenta con una refrigeradora en la que guarda sus bebidas y las mantiene heladas, ya que el clima de esta zona es muy caluroso. Este negocio lo considera rentable, ya que siempre cuenta con un ingreso económico; sin embargo, la dificultad es que tiene que esperar hasta las cosechas que realiza su esposo para tener el dinero para abastecerse. Por ello recurre ahora a MFP, para que pueda continuar con su trabajo y pueda ahorrar para abrir una tienda.

Este es su primer crédito y se siente tranquila al saber que contará con este apoyo financiero. Asimismo, agradece a su banco comunal por ser personas solidarias que aceptaron su participación.
Con estos 1,500 nuevos soles comprará paquetes de gaseosas variadas y frutas para elaborar sus refrescos.
texts.en:
Maritza is 28-years-old; her spouse is Richard, 30.  They have a five-year-old daughter.  They all live together in a house they bought two years ago.

She started selling soft-drinks and beverages at home a year ago.  At the moment, she has a refrigerator where she stores and keeps her beverages cold because the climate in this zone is very hot.  She considers the business to be profitable because it always produces income.  However, the difficulty she has is that she has to wait until her husband brings in the harvest to have money available to stock up which is why she now calls on MFP in order to stay in business and be able to save up more to open a store.

This is her first loan and she has peace of mind knowing that she will have this financial support.  In addition, she thanks her communal bank for being supportive people who accepted her participation in it. She will use the 1500 new soles to buy assorted packages of soft-drinks and fruit to make the beverages.

loans.use: to buy fruit and assorted packages of soft-drinks.

loans.name: Rosa Ivania

texts.es:
Doña Rosa, vende cosméticos, perfumes, joyas, con muchos años vendiendo, siendo de ayuda a su familia con los gastos, aun tiene a su hijo estudiando la secundaria, ya que el otro es casado, su esposo es conductor y siempre se han apoyado para estar en mejores condiciones. Para ella ha sido un reto en su vida al tener su propio negocio y que ahora con las ganancias y los financiamientos ha logrado comenzar con un pequeño cyber con dos computadoras el cual ubico en su porche, siendo un comienzo que espera sea positivo.
Con este nuevo préstamo comprara: ropa, cosméticos y prendas de plata para seguir ofreciendo a su clientela una variedad de productos, así mismo informa a su clientela de su nuevo servicio. Que espera crecer para comprar más equipo y tener un negocio solido.
texts.en:
Rosa sells cosmetics, perfume and jewelry.  She’s been selling for many years and helps her family with expenses.  She still has a daughter attending secondary school; her son is married.  Her husband is a driver and they have always helped each other to be in better condition.  For her, it’s always been a challenge in her life to have a business of her own and now with profits and loans she’s succeeded in starting a small Internet access service with two computers installed in her front entryway; it’s a beginning she hopes will be positive.

She will use this new loan to buy clothes, cosmetics and pieces of silver jewelry to continue offering a wide variety of products to her customers while at the same time informing them about the new service that she hopes will grow in order to buy more equipment and to have a solid business.

loans.use: to buy clothes, cosmetics and silver jewelry.

loans.name: Nikoloz

texts.en:
Nikoloz is 33 years old. He lives in the Tskaltubo District in West Georgia, with his mother Keto. Keto is a pensioner and gets a monthly pension. Nikoloz is running a small scale agricultural business for the family. In particular, he grows nuts and 100 vine-trees on a family-owned plot of land. Nikoloz sells the harvested products on the local market. Nikoloz requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for his business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected every time because of his low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

The total average monthly income of the family is 250 Laris, including Keto’s pension. It is hardly enough for food for the family. According to Credo estimations, the family belongs to the vulnerable poor category. 

Nikoloz is a musician by profession. He requested a loan from Credo for purchasing a musical instrument, in particular an electric piano. His loan request was approved within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages the provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to the country rural poor who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. 
 After purchasing the instrument, Nikoloz will get a steady job in a local restaurant, and at the same time he will be able to provide services to the local population for private personal and corporate parties. The new business initiative will increase the monthly income of the family by 200 - 300 laris, which will mean more than 100% increase. Nikoloz and his mother will be able to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a musical instrument for business purposes.

loans.name: Cesaria

texts.en: Cesaria of Bien Unido has had a farming business since 1998. She is married with two grown children. At the age of 69, she is still a hardworking woman, and she realized that she needs to work harder because she does not want to rely on her children. She is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer, pesticides, and seedlings, and to pay for labor. Her income will go to her savings for future needs, especially those related to staying healthy and helping her children if the need arise.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, pesticides, and seedlings, and to pay for labor

loans.name: Brith

texts.es:
Brith tiene 26 años, es soltera y tiene una hija de 8 años. Juntas viven en la casa que sus padres le dieron por herencia.
Hace un año comenzó a vender productos para los agricultores. Ya se tiene ganada una buena cantidad de clientes, pero en ocasiones sus ganancias todavía no le alcanzan para abastecer su negocio cuando se le acaban los productos. Por lo general, los que  mayormente compran son sus vecinos agricultores. Su local está abierto desde las 7:00 de la mañana hasta las 6:00 de la tarde. Sus planes a futuro son de ampliar su tienda con el propósito de mejorar sus ingresos como también de captar mayor clientela.

Este es su primer crédito con MFP, por lo que se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual y oportuna; además asegura sentirse cómoda con su banco comunal, ya que todos se solidarizan entre sí.
Con estos 1,000 nuevos soles se abastecerá de sacos de abono que requiere en su negocio.
texts.en:
Brith, 26, is single and has an 8-year-old daughter.  They live together in a house her parents passed down to her.  She started selling farm supplies a year ago.  She has a good number of customers already but on occasion her profits are insufficient to restock her business when she runs out of products.  In general, her neighbors who are farmers are her main customers.  Her store is open from 7am until 6pm.  Her future plan is to expand the store in order to earn higher income and win over a larger number of customers.

This is her first MFP loan and she commits to make her installment payments punctually and as required.  She states that she feels comfortable in her communal bank because everyone is mutually supportive.  She will use the 1000 new soles to stock up on sacks of manure she needs for her business.

loans.use: to buy sacks of manure.

loans.name: Claudia

texts.en: Claudia lives in Talibon, Bohol, Philippines. She has been in the farming business for more than ten years now. She grows rice in the family's field. Claudia works hard in supporting her husband on their farm. As of this time, she needs additional capital for her farming business. She is requesting a loan worth 8,000 PHP to buy fertilizers and fuel for the equipment used on the farm. Claudia believes that this loan would help them improve their business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and fuel for the equipment used on the farm

loans.name: Kunduz

texts.ru: Кундузу 48 лет. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 5 детей. Ее муж работает трактористом и получает маленькую зарплату, которая не хватает для содержания семьи. Кундуз готовит и продает национальные блюда. Раньше она работала как наемный работник в поле. Она сильно уставало. Ее жизнь прошла очень трудной.  Когда повзрослели дочери, она решила заниматься данным бизнесом для улучшения  условия жизни. Кундуз является владельцем бизнеса и ей помогает дочка. В этом году ее дочь собирается  замуж, а у Кундуза не достаточны деньги для проведения свадьбы. Ее дочь очень любит своего жениха и надеется, что вы поможете ей стать счастливой. Кундуз запрашивает кредит на сумму 3000 сомони для проведения свадьбы дочери. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Kunduz is 48 years old. She is married and had 5 children in her care. Her husband works as a tractor driver and receives a small salary that is not enough to support the family. Kunduz cooks and sells ethnic dishes. Previously, she worked as a hired field hand. She was overtired and had a hard life. When her daughters grew up, she decided to go into her current business for the improvement of her living conditions. Kunduz is the owner of the business and her daughter helps her. This year, her daughter is preparing to get married but Kunduz does not have enough money for the wedding arrangements. Her daughter really loves her fiancé and hopes that you will help her become happy. Kunduz is requesting a loan in the amount of 3000 somoni for her daughter's wedding arrangements. She awaits your generosity.

loans.use: To buy all the necessary things for her daughter’s marriage

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Felisa Magaly

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Camino Al Progreso se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar vive la señora Felisa, tiene 33 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cuatro  hijos de 16, 14, 11 y 9 años de edad, los dos mayores  estudian en colegio y los menores en escuela. Su esposo es albañil.

Ella es una ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos se dedica a la venta de ropa por catalogo, productos de Avon (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas) y tarjetas telefónicas. Trabaja los fines de semana ya que en estos das es cuando más vende, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada domingo. Sus productos los recibe en su casa. Lleva más de diez años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien.
	
Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos, ropa y tarjetas telefónicas.  Lleva casi tres años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan.
 
Su sueño es que sus hijos terminen sus estudios.
texts.en:
The communal bank Camino al Progreso meets every two weeks in the canton of Montecristi, which is known for its rich pre-colonial culture and its nationally and internationally renowned craftmanship. It is home to the famous Panama hats.

This is where Felisa lives. She is 33 years old, married, and has four children from this relationship who are sixteen, fourteen, eleven, and nine years old. The two oldest are in high school and the two youngest are in elementary school. Her husband is a construction worker.

She is a homemaker who, in order to have her own resources, also sells clothing by catalogue, Avon products (beauty supplies, cosmetics, perfumes, and women's accessories), and telephone cards. She works on weekends because those are the days when she makes the most sales. She delivers her products on credit and collects payments on Sundays. She receives the products at home. She has been in this business for over ten years and it is going very well.
	
This loan is for the purchase of perfumes, creams, cosmetics, clothing, and telephone cards. She has been with the communal bank for almost three years and enjoys it because of the help they provide. 
 
Her dream is for her children to finish school.

loans.use: to purchase perfumes, creams, cosmetics, clothing, and telephone cards.

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en: Hawa, 43, is the mother of four children and resides with her husband in Congo Town. Her children are between the ages of 12 and 25. Three of them are in college, and one is still in high school. For the past ten years, she has been selling palm oil, cooking oil, rice, sardines, meat, pepper, and other items in the market. One challenge she faces is the rainy season, when sales are low. She likes doing this business because she can contribute to the expenses in the home with the profit she generates from the business. She also buys goods to improve the business. She is requesting a loan to purchase more cooking oil, rice, sardines, and meat to increase her sales. Her plan for the future is to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more cooking oil, rice, sardines, and meat to increase her sales.

loans.name: Munhjargal

texts.en: Munhjargal is 33 years old and lives with her husband and children in an apartment in Hovd, Mongolia. Her husband, whose name is Tulga, is 34 years old and works for a customs company as a driver. Her older children go to the secondary school and her younger children go to kindergarten. Before Munhjargal was unemployed and stayed at home, but recently she started her own retail clothing business; however, she lacks working capital. Therefore, she is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to purchase inventory for her clothing business. She expects this business will be a major improvement on her family's living situation. She is a diligent woman with a good attitude.

loans.use: to purchase inventory for her clothing business.

loans.name: Ahmadjon

texts.ru: Ахмадчон из Таджикистана, которому 43 лет, женат и на воспитании имеет 3 детей. Более 4 лет он занимается выращиванием сельхоз культуры, как картофель, пшеницу, морковь и т.п. Полученный доход он продает на рынке. Так как у него высококачественный урожай, так и его товары имеют большой спрос. Его жена, брат и дети помогают ему в ведении бизнеса. С целью обеспечения семьи со всеми необходимыми средствами он хочет развевать свой бизнес, а для этого он должен получить больше урожая. Он запрашивает кредит на сумму 3000  сомони, чтобы купить минеральные удобрения и семена. Доход, который он будет получать от бизнеса, будет использовать для образования своих детей и улучшения условия жизни. Он нуждается и ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Ahmadjon is from Tajikistan. He is 43 years old, married, and is raising 3 children. 

For over 4 years, Ahmadjon has been raising crops, including wheat, potatoes, carrots, and so on. He sells his harvest at the market. Because his produce is of very high quality, there is great demand for it. His wife, children and brother help him in his business. 

Ahmadjon wants to provide his family with all the necessities of life. In order to reach this goal, he wants to develop his business by increasing the output of his farm.  

Ahmadjon is seeking a loan of 3000 Tajikistan Somoni to purchase seeds and mineral fertilizer. He will use the increased income resulting from his business expansion to pay for his children's education and to raise the family's standard of living. He is very grateful for your support.

loans.use: To buy seeds and mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Mariana Monserrate

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Camino Al Progreso se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar vive la señora Mariana, tiene 52 años de edad está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos, dos mayores de edad y la menor de 16 años que  estudia en colegio, dos de sus hijos aun viven en su casa. El marido es maestro albañil.
 
Ella tiene un pequeño restaurante en su casa, allí trabaja todos los días, en las mañanas prepara el delicioso ceviche de pinchaguas y de pescado picudo que son el deleite de sus clientes que dia a dia llegan hasta su local, ella también lleva a entregar sus deliciosos platos a ciertos lugares que le compran,  también vende aguas,  gaseosas y otras bebidas. Lleva más de 10 años con su negocio y cada día tiene más clientes.

Este crédito lo va utilizar en comprar pescado y otros víveres para la preparación de los ceviches. Está en el Banco Comunal cinco ciclos y  le gusta por la unión del grupo y porque la han recibido muy bien en el mismo.

Sus metas son seguir adelante y que su hija sea una profesional.
texts.en:
The communal bank Camino al Progreso meets every two weeks in the canton of Montecristi, which is known for its rich pre-colonial culture and its nationally and internationally renowned craftmanship. It is home to the famous Panama hats.

This is where Mariana lives. She is 52 years old, married, and has three children from this relationship. Two of them are adults and the youngest, who is sixteen, is in high school. Two of her children live at home. Her husband is a master builder.
 
She has a small restaurant at home where she works every day. In the mornings she prepares delicious ceviches with alewife and marlin, which are her  customers' delight. They come to her location every day, and she also delivers her delicious dishes to certain places that buy from her. She also sells juice drinks, sodas, and other beverages. She has been in business for over ten years and has more customers every day.

She will use this loan to purchase fish and other ingredients to prepare the ceviches. She has been with the communal bank for five cycles and enjoys it because it is a close group of people who have received her very well.

Her goals are to keep moving forward and for her daughter to become a professional.

loans.use: to purchase fish and other ingredients.

loans.name: Nozigul

texts.ru:
Нозигул - жительница Гиссарского района города Душанбе. Ей 21 год. Разведена, имеет одного ребенка. Нозигул получила среднее образование. 
Нозигул занимается торговлей вот уже 5 лет. Она в основном занимается продажей детских игрушек. Нозигул намеревается расширить свой бизнес и с этой целью просит кредит для покупки мягких игрушек и больших машин.
texts.en:
Nozigul lives in the Gissar region of the city of Dushanbe. She is 21 years old, divorced, and has a child. Nozigul has secondary education. 

For the past 5 years, Nozigul has worked in retail, selling mainly children's toys. She would like to expand her business, and to this end is requesting a loan to purchase plush toys and large toy cars.

loans.use: to buy plush toys and large cars for her toy shop

loans.name: Jose Remberto

texts.es: EL SEÑOR JOSÉ VIVE EN LA COMUNIDAD DE TIN TIN DE LA PROVINCIA DE MIZQUE DEL DEPARTAMENTO DE COCHABAMBA, TIENE TRES HIJOS DEPENDIENTES, JOSE SE DEDICA A TRABAJAR EN LA AGRICULTURA, Y EN TIEMPOS LIBRES A LA CERRAJERIA, EN LA ANTERIOR COSECHA TUVO PROBLEMAS CLIMATICOS DE SEQUIA Y HELADAS, POR EFECTO, LAS AGUAS DE RIEGO BAJARON DE CAUDAL AFECTANDO AL RENDIMIENTO DE LA PRODUCCION DE SUS CULTIVOS, ESTE DESASTRE HIZO FRACASAR EN SUS INGRESOS ECONOMICOS A LA FAMILIA, QUE SE MANTENIAN CON LA PRODUCCION AGRICOLA, CADA AÑO PRODUCEN PRINCIPALMENTE, MANÍ, FREJOL, PAPA,  EN SU PEQUEÑA PARCELA. JOSÉ ES UNA PERSONA MUY QUERIDA Y RESPETADA EN EL LUGAR DONDE VIVE POR LO DEDICADO AL TRABAJO AGRICOLA Y SERVICIOS DE CERRAJERIA QUE OFRECE, CON EL CUAL SACA ADELANTE A SU FAMILIA A SI MISMO COMPLETA SUS NECESIDADES TRABAJANDO DE JORNALERO EN LA AGRICULTURA, PARA GANAR ALGUNOS PESOS, ASI MANTENER Y COSTEAR LOS GASTOS DE ESTUDIO DE SUS HIJOS, EL ESTA SOLICITANDO EL CREDITO PARA COMPRAR SEMILLAS, ABONO QUIMICO, ABONO ORGANICO Y AGROQUIMICOS DE ESTA MANERA MEJORARAR LA PRODUCCION Y CALIDAD DE VIDA; TRABAJAN EN LAS PEQUEÑAS PARCELAS QUE TIENEN CON TODA SU FAMILIA. TAMBIEN TIENE LA CLARA IDEA DE QUE CON ESTE CREDITO MEJORARA LAS CONDICIONES, SOLVENCIA ECONOMICA Y QUE EN LAS PROXIMAS OPORTUNIDADES REALIZARA INVERSIONES CON CREDITOS MAYORES QUE LE PERMITIRAN EMPRENDER NEGOCIOS CON UTILIDADES DE MAYOR VALOR ECONOMICO.
texts.en:
José lives in the community of TinTin in Mique Province, Cochabamba Department.  He has three dependent children.  José works in agriculture and in his free time as a locksmith.  He had weather-related problems, draught and frost, during his previous growing cycle; water levels for irrigation dropped and crop production did too.  This disaster led to his family’s economic collapse because they supported themselves through agricultural production growing mostly peanuts, beans and potatoes each year on their small parcel.

José is a very well-liked and respected person where he lives because of his dedication to agricultural work and for the locksmith services he provides with which he moves his family forward; he also makes up for economic shortfalls working as a day laborer in agriculture to earn a few pesos and be able to support his children and pay for their schooling.

He’s asking for the loan to buy seeds, chemical fertilizer, organic fertilizer and other agricultural chemicals to improve production and his quality of life.  He works small parcels of land that are owned by his entire family.  

He strongly believes that he will improve his condition and his economic solvency with this loan and that in future opportunities he will invest larger loans that will make it possible for him to start businesses that are more profitable and have higher economic value.

loans.use: to buy chemical fertilizer, organic fertilizer and other chemical farm supplies.

loans.name: Robiya

texts.ru: Робие 21 лет, замужем, но не имеет детей. Она очень трудолюбивый человек и имеет более чем 4 лет опыта в бизнесе. Она занимается куплей продажей продукты питания в продовольственном магазине. В последнее время у нее мало клиентов, так как конкуренция большая, и она не может придерживать своих клиентов, которые делают покупки в новых супермаркетов. Робия должена срочно расширить свой ассортимент для того, чтобы вернуть своих клиентов. Она запрашивает кредит на сумму 10000 сомони для того, чтобы купить хлеб, масло, колбасные изделия, консервы, напитки и молочные продукты. Она надеется на вас и на вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Robiya is 21 years old, married but has no children. She is a very hard-working person and has more than 4 years of experience in business.

Robiya buys food products and sells them in a grocery store. Lately business has dropped off due to stiff competition from new supermarkets where many of her customers have begun to shop. In order to win back her clientele, Robiya needs to quickly expand the range of goods that she can offer in her store. 

Robiya is seeking a loan in the amount of 10000 Tajikistan Somoni to purchase bread, butter, various types of sausages, canned goods, beverages and dairy products. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: To buy food items to develop her business

loans.name: Gregorio

texts.es:
Gregorio tiene 29 años de edad, es un hombre muy trabajador y entusiasta, sobre todo porque tiene muchas ganas de salir adelante, su vivienda se ubica en la ciudad de Pisco, ciudad que se caracteriza por tener un clima cálido y acogedor, asimismo se desarrolla la pesca y la agricultura y también el turismo ya que podemos encontrar lugares turísticos como “las Islas Ballestas y el Candelabro de Paracas. El estudio hasta el quinto grado de secundaria pero le hubiera gustado mucho ser Ingeniero agrónomo.

Con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación Gregorio trabaja en su parcela de cultivo como agricultor, el trabaja alrededor 10 horas al día ya que siempre revisa su el cultivo tiene alguna plaga o si está bien regado; él cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy responsable y sobre todo porque le gusta lo que hace.

Gregorio está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar fertilizantes, abono, y productos para combatir las plagas, así de esta manera el podrá tener un cultivo en buen estado y podrá tener una buena cosecha, lo que le permitirá mejorar sus ingresos y seguir luchando para hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Tener su propio terreno de cultivo y tener un negocio de ganadería”.
texts.en:
Gregorio, 29, is a very hardworking, enthusiastic man because he has a strong drive to get ahead.  His house is located in the city of Pisco, a city noted for its hot, welcoming climate.  Fishing, agriculture and tourism are also prevalent here.  Tourist attractions like the Ballestas Islands and the Paracas Candelabrum are found here.  He studied up to fifth grade in secondary school but would have like to have studied to become an agronomist.

Gregorio works his parcel of land with much effort and dedication.  He works about 10 hours daily and is always inspecting his crop to see that there are no infestations and that it’s well watered.  He believes that he does well in business because he’s very responsible and because he loves what he does.

Gregorio is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the help they’ve given him he will be able to buy fertilizer, manure and products to fight infestations in order to have crops that are in good condition that will lead to a good harvest which will make it possible for him to improve his income and continue striving toward making his greatest dream a reality: to own his own farmland and to have a cattle-raising business

loans.use: to buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Julia Natali

texts.es:
Julia tiene 21 años de edad, es una joven muy optimista y sobre todo con un espíritu muy alegre, vive en la ciudad de Chincha, ciudad que se caracteriza por tener un clima cálido, playas hermosas, así como también s conocida por la amabilidad y carisma de sus pobladores y también por la preparación de sus platillos típicos que son muy deliciosos. Julia actualmente estudia la carrera de Derecho, la cual puede solventar con mucho esfuerzo con el fruto de su trabajo en la municipalidad de su ciudad, ella labora alrededor de 9 horas al día, ya que por las noches va a su centro de estudios; ella cree que le va bien en su trabajo porque es muy responsable y sobre todo porque tiene muchas ganas de salir adelante.

Julia está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá realizar la compra de sus libros, separatas, folletos, entre otros materiales necesarios para sus estudios, de esta manera ella podrá seguir adelante para poder ser una gran ´profesional y hacer realidad sus mas grane sueño:” Ser el orgullo de su familia”.
texts.en:
Julia, 21, is a very optimistic young woman with a very cheerful spirit.  She lives in the city of Chincha, a city noted for its hot climate, its beautiful beaches and also for the kindness and warm-heartedness of its residents; it’s also noted for the tasty way traditional food is prepared there.

Julia is currently studying law; she’s able to pay for her schooling with much effort as a result of working for city government.  She works about 9 hours daily because she attends school at night.  She believes that she does well at work because she’s very responsible and above all because she has a strong drive to get ahead.

Julia’s very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the help they’ve given her she will be able to buy her textbooks, offprints and pamphlets, among other supplies needed for her courses.  In this way she will be able to continue forward and become a great professional and make her greatest dream a reality: to be the pride of her family.

loans.use: to buy books, pamphlets, offprints, etc.

loans.name: Abdukodir

texts.ru: Абдукодиру 43 лет, женат и на воспитании имеет 3 детей. Климат его местожительство весьма благополучный для выращивания сельхоз культур, а также для скотоводства. Более 20  лет он занимается скотоводством.  У него большой огород, где выращивает сено для скота. Он продает скот, за которым он присматривался в течение нескольких месяцев. На рынке у него много клиентов. Абдукодир имеет дополнительный доход от продажи сухофруктов. Абдукодир хочет развивать свой бизнес, но не имеет достаточных средств для этого. Он запрашивает кредит на сумму 7000 сомони для покупки скота, чтобы развевать бизнес. С полученного  дохода он собирается обеспечить своих детей хорошим образованием и современными технологиями. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Abdukodir is 43 years old, married, and raising 3 children. The climate around his home is quite favourable to farming and breeding livestock. Abdukodir has been raising cattle for over 20 years. He has a large parcel of land where he grows grass for his animals. Abdukodir sells his cattle after raising it for several months, and has many customers at the market. He also makes additional income from selling dried fruits.

Abdukodir would like to develop his business but does not have sufficient funds for doing so. He is requesting a loan of 7000 somoni to purchase cattle and expand his business. He plans to use his profits to provide his children with good education and modern technology. Abdukodir is counting on your kindness.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Zamira

texts.ru: Замире 25 лет. Она замужем, но не имеет  детей. Ее муж получает маленькую зарплату. Это зарплата не хватает для обеспечения семьи со всеми необходимыми средствами. Замира решила помочь мужу для благо получения семьи. С такой целью она обучилась в курсе «Добейся успеха» организованный Ассоциация Деловых Женщин и получила сертификат. Теперь она вполне может организовать свой бизнес и стать успешной в этой сфере. Она хочет организовать бизнес с шитьем национальной женской одеждой, так как имеет опыт в этом виде бизнеса. От полученного дохода она планирует усовершенствовать условия жизни. Она запрашивает кредит на сумму 600 долларов США для покупки швейной машинки, чтобы организовать новый бизнес. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Zamira is 25 years old. She is married but has no children. Zamira's husband earns a small salary, which is insufficient to provide the family with all necessities of life. Zamira has decided to help her husband for the benefit of the family. To this end, she took the course "Succeed" offered by the Association of Businesswomen and received her graduation certificate. Now she is quite capable of starting her own business and becoming successful. Zamira would like to focus her business on sewing traditional women's clothing, as she has experience in this area. She plans to use her profits to improve her quality of life.

Zamira is requesting a loan of US$600 to purchase a sewing machine and launch her business. She is counting on your kindness.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine for her new business

loans.name: Javier Jesus

texts.es:
Javier es un hombre de 21 años, es soltero, vive con su madre y hermanos en la ciudad de Chincha, a pesar de ser joven él es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; lamentablemente por la necesidad de trabajar para ayudar a su madre y solventar sus gastos no pudo estudiar la carrera de Administración de Empresas que tanto deseaba, pero sueña poder hacerlo algún día, en sus ratos libres le gusta jugar futbol con sus amigos y hermanos, y en algunas de estas ocasiones comen una riquísima Carapulcra con Sopa Seca.
Con mucho empeño y entusiasmo, Javier trabaja como Agente de Seguridad en una empresa de su ciudad, todas los días desde tempranas horas inicia su labor, el puede trabajar un aproximado de 12 horas diarias y cree que le va bien por su buen desempeño y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Javier se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de materiales de construcción, tales como: cemento, fierros, ladrillos, entre otros; de esta manera Javier contará con los materiales necesarios para poder dar inicio a la construcción de su vivienda, ya que actualmente  el y su familia viven en un modulo de madera, así el espera poder brindar mayor seguridad y bienestar para su familia, por ello el seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para que junto a ellos puedan salir adelante.
texts.en:
Javier, 21, is single living with his mother and siblings in the city of Chincha.  Despite his young age, he’s a kind, hardworking and enthusiastic person who very much wants to get ahead.  Unfortunately, because he needed to start working to help his mother cover expenses, he was unable to study business administration like he so wanted to but dreams with being able to do so someday.  In his free time he likes to play soccer with his friends and brothers and on some of these occasions they enjoy eating a delicious “Carapulcra con Sopa Seca.”

Javier works as a security guard with much dedication and enthusiasm in a firm in his city.  He starts work every day very early and can work approximately 12 hours per day.  He believes he does well because of the good way he works and because of the kind way he treats others.

Javier is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the help they’ve given him he will be able to buy building materials and supplies like cement, rebar and bricks, among other.  In this way, Javier will have the necessary supplies to start building his house since he and his family currently live in a wooden modular unit and he hopes thus to provide more security and wellbeing for his family.  He will continue working and striving for this so that they can move forward together.

loans.use: to buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en: Elvira is 42 years old and has had a fishing business for 20 years now. She is from the community of Bien Unido, Bohol. She would like to improve her family's source of livelihood. She is asking for a loan to purchase fishing nets and pay for boat repair.  Her income will be used for her five children ranging in age from 1-23 years old. In the future, Elvira hopes to expand her business to make it more sustainable.

loans.use: to purchase fishing nets and pay for boat repair

loans.name: Zoe

texts.en:
Zoe, 45 years old,  is a widow  with two children aged 15 and 28. One of them  has completed  high school and is independent; the other child lives with her at Congo Town and stopped her education in the seventh grade. 

Zoe would like to give the best of education to her child, but lacks financial support. She has been involved in selling charcoal for the past eight years. She learned to sell from her mother, and she likes her business because she makes a profit. With the profit she attends to the needs of her child and improves her business. She is requesting this loan to purchase bags of charcoal to expand her business.  Her future plan is to educate her child.

loans.use: to purchase bags of charcoal to expand her business.

loans.name: Bernadeth

texts.en:
Bernadeth is a 41-year-old married woman and a mother of four children. They live in Bohol, Philippines. She has been running a sari-sari or convenience store for ten years now. This is the source of her daily income.

However, Bernadeth lacks funds for the expansion of her business. She is asking for a loan worth 3000 PHP to buy more items to sell such as canned goods, snack foods, washing products and other household products.

In the future, Bernadeth wants to make her business a success. More importantly, she wants to support the schooling of her children until they finish a degree and become successful professionals.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell such as canned goods, snack foods, washing products and other household products

loans.name: Edgardo

texts.en:
Edgardo is a 36-year-old married man with four children between the ages of 1 to 12. Edgardo has been in the business of fishing for 10 years now. His income is not stable due to weather and availability of his fishing needs. 

Edgardo works hard to support his family. He has requested a loan to purchase a fishing net and repair the old ones. He hopes for his business to grow and for his children to finish college and become successful someday.

loans.use: to purchase a fishing net and repair the old nets

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth hails from the town of San Miguel, Boho. She is 42 years old. Elizabeth is married and has five children. Her eldest child is 22 years old and the youngest is aged 9. To make a living, Elizabeth grows rice in her farm and also runs a general store locally known as "sari-sari store". 

Elizabeth joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 12,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizer, pesticides, quality seedlings and pay for labor. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, pesticides, quality seedlings and pay for labor

loans.name: Rogelio

texts.es: EL SEÑOR ROGELIO,  TIENE 44  AÑOS DE EDAD, VIVEN EN LA COMUNIDAD DE TAKO TAKO ALTO DE LA  PROVINCIA  MIZQUE DEL DEPARTAMENTO DE COCHABAMBA,   TIENE CINCO  HIJOS DEPENDIENTES, SU ESPOSA ES LA SEÑORA ROGELIA CON EDAD DE 40 AÑOS QUIEN COLABORA EN LA PRODUCCIÓN AGRÍCOLA LIDERANDO EL MANEJO DE LA FAMILIA. POR LAS HELADAS EN LA ZONA, DON ROGELIO A PERDIDO EL 50% DE SU PRODUCCIÓN DE TOMATE Y PAPA EL CUAL A OCASIONANDO UNA DISMINUCIÓN DE INGRESOS ECONÓMICOS POR VENTA DE ESTOS PRODUCTOS, POR ESTOS MOTIVOS MENCIONADOS LA ESTABILIDAD ECONÓMICA HA SUFRIDO UN DESEQUILIBRIO AFECTANDO DIRECTAMENTE EN LA ADQUISICIÓN DE LOS MATERIALES E INSUMOS REQUERIDOS PARA LA PRODUCCIÓN COMO EN LA CANASTA FAMILIAR PARA LA ALIMENTACIÓN DE LA FAMILIA. PARA ENMENDAR LO MENCIONADO ANTERIORMENTE HA RECURRIDO AL CRÉDITO CON EL OBJETIVO DE MEJORAR LA CALIDAD DE VIDA DE LA FAMILIA Y RETOMAR EL CAMINO DE LA PROSPERIDAD.
texts.en:
Rogelio is 44 years old and lives in the community of Tako Tako Alto, Mizque Province, in Cochabamba Department. He has 5 dependent children. Rogelio is married to Rogelia, who is 40 years old, and they collaborate in agricultural production and managing the family.

Due to freezes in the zone, Rogelio has lost 50 % of his tomato and potato crop, resulting in a diminution of his expected economic income from selling these products. For this reason, their economic stability has suffered a disequilibrium, directly affecting his ability to purchase supplies and inputs needed for production, as well as in the family food basket required to feed his family.

To correct the above mentioned problems, he is seeking a loan with the object of improving his family's quality of life and retaking the road to prosperity.

loans.use: buy agricultural inputs required by the loss of half his crop to frost.

loans.name: Keren Noelia

texts.es:
Keren es una mujer de 18 años, es soltera, vive con sus padres y hermanos en la ciudad de Chiclayo, a  pesar de ser tan joven ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; lamentablemente por la necesidad de trabajar para solventar sus gastos y apoyar a sus padres, no ha podido estudiar la carrera de Derecho que tanto desea, pero sueña con poder hacerlo algún día, en sus ratos libres le gusta preparar dulces y postres y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Cabrito a la Norteña para compartir con su familia. 
 Con mucho empeño y entusiasmo, día a día Keren trabaja como vendedora en una tienda comercial de abarrotes de su ciudad, adicionalmente ella prepara deliciosos postres para su venda y también vende productos cosméticos, ella puede trabajar un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su dedicación y el trato amble que brinda a sus clientes.
Keren se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de una vitrina y mercadería, tales como cosméticos y perfumes; de esta manera Keren tendrá su pequeño negocio mejor abastecido y acondicionado para poder ofrecer sus productos, así ella espera incrementar sus vetas e ingresos económicos, los cuales le servirán de mucho para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda ampliar su negocio y junto a su familia pueda salir adelante.
texts.en:
Karen, 18, is single living with her parents and siblings in the city of Chiclayo.  Despite her young age, she’s a kind, hardworking, enthusiastic person who very much wants to improve.  Because she needed to go to work to help cover her expenses and to help her parents, she’s been unable to study law like she so wants to but dreams with being able to do so someday.  In her free time she likes to make sweets and desserts and sometimes cooks a delicious “Cabrito a la Norteña” [northern style goat] to share with her family.

Karen goes to work as a salesperson in a grocery store in her city every day with dedication and enthusiasm.  She also prepares delicious desserts to sell and also sell cosmetics.  She can work approximately 10 hours daily and thinks she does well because of her dedication and the kind way she treats customers.

Karen is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the help they’ve given her she will be able to buy a display case and merchandise like cosmetics and perfumes.  In this way Karen will have her little business better stocked and set up to display her products so that she can increase sales and income that will be very useful for her so that in the not too distant future she can expand the business and get ahead together with her family.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics and a display case.

loans.name: Conchita

texts.en:
Conchita is a 32-year-old married woman and a mother of an eight-year-old son. She and her family live in Bohol, Philippines. Conchita has been in a food vending business for more than four years now and her husband runs a tricycle transport business.

Right now, Conchita is in need  of additional funds for her business.  She is requesting a loan worth 6000 PHP to buy spare parts and fuel and repair the tricycle and to buy ingredients for the food vending business.

In the future, Conchita wants to make great improvements in their businesses so that they will become sustainable and progressive.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and fuel and repair the tricycle and to buy ingredients for the food vending business.

loans.name: Ginalyn

texts.en: Ginalyn is 30 years old and married with three children aged 7, 3 and 5 months old. Ginalyn's husband is a fisherman. She and her husband work together to support their family. She sells her husband's catch at their local market and in the neighborhood of Bien Unido. She also buy crabs from other fishermen and resells them. She works hard to help provide for their needs, specially the needs of her children. She is asking for a loan to buy lead weights, floaters, fishing nets and fish hooks.  Ginalyn hopes for her family to have a comfortable life by improving and expanding their business.

loans.use: to buy lead weights, floaters, fishing nets and fish hooks

loans.name: Roxana

texts.es: La cliente, Roxana, es una señora de 22 años de edad, no tiene hijos dependientes y es soltera, la cliente se dedica a la producción de la leche cruda, en donde actualmente tiene 5 cabezas de ganado lechero en producción y 3 cabezas de ganado preñadas y la leche que produce entrega a las personas del lugar por donde ella vive, actualmente la cliente vive por la zona sur de la ciudad de Cochabamba, aproximadamente a 10 km de la ciudad de Cochabamba, la casa donde vive la cliente no es propia, es de su familia, la cliente vive con sus padres, el destino del nuevo crédito de la institución es para la compra de alimento balanceado para ganado lechero, para aumentar sus ingresos  por la venta de la leche, y de alguna u otra manera podrá satisfacer sus necesidades que tiene en su domicilio, es por lo cual reflejamos esta pequeña historia de la cliente, para el conocimiento de todos ustedes.
texts.en: The borrower, Roxana, is a 22 year old young woman. She does not have any children and is single. She makes a living producing raw milk. She currently has 5 milk producing cows and 3 cows that are pregnant. The milk that is produced by her cows she delivers to people who live nearby. She currently lives south of the city of Cochabamba, approximately 10 km outside the city. The house where she lives is not her own, but is owned by her family. She lives with her parents. The purpose of the new loan she has requested is to buy feed for the dairy cattle, to increase her income from milk sales and one way or another she will be able to satisfy the needs of her household. We present this short story of the borrower, for the knowledge of all of you.

loans.use: to buy feed for cows.

loans.name: Ines

texts.en: Ines is 41 years old and comes from Bien Unido, Bohol. She is married with three children. Her eldest is 21 and the youngest is 17. Her husband work as a fisherman and Ines assists him by making dried fish when there is an abundance in his catch. She will then sell it to her neighborhood. She needs an additional amount of capital for her business so she can buy new fishing net and nylon to use to repair the old nets. She joined CEVI to gain access to its financial services. Ines is hopeful that this loan will help her achieve her dream to sustain and grow her business, providing the basic needs of her children.

loans.use: to buy fishing net and nylon

loans.name: Simon

texts.en: Simon is 52 years old, married with seven children, living in Masindi, Uganda. Four years  ago he decided to start up a retail shop after realizing that farming alone could not allow him to meet their day-to-day expenses since farming is seasonal. Like all retail shop owners, he is faced with challenges of price fluctuation and inflation. His dreams are educating his children and owning a wholesale shop so as to minimize the transport costs from the city. Simon intends to use the loan to buy general merchandise such as cooking oil and soap to sell.

loans.use: to buy general merchandise such as cooking oil and soap to sell.

loans.name: Yasmeen

texts.en:
Ms. Yasmeen is 40-year-old married woman. She has been providing catering services for 20 years. She enjoys making food. She is famous in her town for proving these facilities. She is earning enough to lead a decent life. Her husband is employed as a sales person in a small garment shop with a low income to support to his family.

Yasmeen is a responsible mother of six children; only two of them are school-going. She needs to earn more to cover the cost of the other children’s education.  She requested a loan of Rs. 25,000 to buy stock of rice, oil and salt  from the market at lower rates. In this way she would be able to increase her sales. She wishes to utilize her earned profit on her children’s education and well-being.

loans.use: To buy a stock of rice, oil and salt from the market at lower rates.

loans.name: Jinky

texts.en:
Jinky is a 41-year-old married woman from Bien Unido, Bohol. She is in the business of selling dry goods for an income. She accepts orders from her customers and then buys items in bulk from her suppliers in other provinces.   She sell items like buckets, water dippers, basins, pails, undergarments, laundry baskets and shirts. She works works hard to help improve her family's standard of living. 

Jinky's loan will be used to buy items like pails, basins, water dippers and clothes. Her income will provide her family's daily consumption. In the future, she plans to increase the variety of her merchandise for a better profit.

loans.use: to buy items like pails, basins, water dippers and clothes

loans.name: Violet

texts.en:
Violet used the previous loan to buy onions to sell. She is a 36-year-old married woman with five children living in Kamwenge, Uganda. She has a grocery where she has worked for over eight years. She started with capital worth 200,000 shillings and now the business is worth 1,000,000 shillings. Her challenge is price fluctuation and inflation. 

Violet's dream is educating her children and expanding her business into new markets. She says that with the profits she was able to pay school fees for her children and re-invest in the business.She is requesting for another loan to buy onions and tomatoes to sell.

loans.use: to buy onions and tomatoes for resale.

loans.name: Bintumwa Group

texts.fr:
Anatole fait partie du groupe Bintumwa et  habite à Gitega. Il a 32 ans et est marié à Concilie, commerçante de farine. Ensemble ils ont  4 enfants, âgés de  1 à 8 ans, dont  1 étudie.

Il fait le commerce de  la bière depuis  5ans. 

Il est à son onzième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il va  augmenter son capital et acheter beaucoup de caisses de bière  à revendre pour  gagner plus. 

Le gain de son commerce lui a permis d’acheter un terrain pour cultiver.
texts.en:
Anatole is a member of the Bintumwa group and lives in Gitega. He is 32 years old and married to Concilie, a flour shopkeeper. Together they have 4 children, from ages 1 to 8, one of whom attends school.

Anatole has been in the beer business for 5 years. This is his eleventh loan with Turame. With the Kiva loan that he obtains, he will increase his business capital and buy several cases of beer to resell in order to increase his income. The profit from Anatole's business has allowed him to purchase land to cultivate.

loans.use: to increase his business capital and to purchase several cases of beer to resell in order to increase his income

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is a 27-year-old resident of Bohol, Philippines. She has two young children. She is in the food vending business, selling snack foods to the people in their place. Her husband is a fisherman.

She is in need of additional capital for their businesses. She is asking for a loan worth 5000 PHP to buy  new fishing nets for fishing and ingredients for food vending.

In the future, Gemma wants to see her business become sustainable and progressive.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets for fishing and ingredients for food vending

loans.name: Natela

texts.en:
Natela is 45 years old. She lives in a small village of Kakheti Region with her husband Mamuka and two adult sons (22 and 20 years old). Mamuka and his sons are busy with a family-owned small vineyard. They sell harvested grapes locally. Natela works as a saleslady in a local store. Natela requested loans from local financial institutions several times for agricultural business start-up, but without any success. Her loan request was rejected all the time, because of low income and family’s poor living conditions. 

The average monthly income of the family is 200 Laris. It is hardly enough for food for a four-member family. According to Credo estimations the family belongs to the subsistence poor category.

Natela requested a loan from Credo to re-start a livestock farming venture, which was stopped three years ago because lack of turnover funds. Her loan request was approved in the framework of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to country rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. 

With the received credit Natela will purchase calves. She will raise them and sell them after several months. Grown calves will be sold with a price mark-up, bringing additional income to the family. For the next cycle, Natela will purchase more calves. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva Start-up loan will significantly increase the income of the family. Their income will double and the family members will be able to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase calves

loans.name: Mama

texts.fr: Mama est un homme de 31 commerçant, il a ouvert une petite boutique dans laquelle il vend des téléphones et accessoires depuis 3 ans. son activité fonctionne grâce à son bon emplacement et son expérience dans ce domaine qui lui ont permis d'agrandir sa clientèle au fil du temps. Il sollicite ce crédit pour augmenter son stock de marchandises celà lui permettra d'éviter la rupture de stock à laquelle il est souvent confronté pour cause la petitesse de son capital qui l'oblige à faire écouler une bonne partie de son stock pour pouvoir s'approvisionner à nouveau. Ceci augmenter ses ventes et donc ses bénéfices. Il réinvestira une partie de ces bénéfices dans son activité pour l'agrandir et  le reste lui permettra de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mama is a 31-year-old man. For the last 3 years, he has run a small shop where he sells cellular telephones. His business is successful thanks to its location and Mama's experience in this area of business, which have both allowed him to increase his customer base as time goes on.

Mama is requesting a loan to increase his stock of merchandise. This will allow him to avoid running completely out of stock - something he is often faced with due to his lack of capital which forces him to run through a substantial amount of his stock to have enough to be able to re-stock again. This will increase his sales and therefore his profits. Mama will reinvest a part of these profits into his business in order to expand it, and the rest will allow him to provide for the basic needs of his family.

loans.use: to increase his stock of cell phones and accessories

loans.name: Ana Yeny

texts.es:
Ana tiene 33 años de edad, es casada, tiene cuatro hijos, de los cuales solo uno vive con ella. Ella cuenta con tres años de experiencia en la venta de tortillas y comida. Antes vendía antojitos típicos como: tamales, nuegados, empanadas, enchiladas, etc. De forma ambulante. Posteriormente, se dedicaba a ayudarles a sus cuñadas a la venta de tortillas y comida, siendo así que aprendió esa actividad.

Los productos para la elaboración de las tortillas y la comida, las adquiere en la misma ciudad en donde posee su puesto de venta.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar dos sacos de maíz que cuestan $38.00 cada uno, una arroba de fríjol que cuesta $16.00, un galón de aceite, azúcar, café, sal y cancelara una deuda que posee con otra institución. De esta manera, Ana dispondrá de suficiente materia prima para elaborar las deliciosas tortillas y la comida satisfaciendo a sus clientes y al mismo tiempo podrá cancelar el crédito, pues la tasa de interés es bastante alta. 

Su aspiración es construir su casa y comprar equipo de trabajo, como una refrigeradora, entre otros artículos que le servirán para su negocio.
texts.en:
Ana is 33 years old, married and has 4 children, of which only one lives with her. She has three years of experience selling tortillas and other food. Before that she used to sell typical snacks like tamales, nuegados, empanadas, enchiladas, etc by traveling in her community. Before that she helped her sisters-in-law selling tortillas and other food, which is how she learned this skill.

She buys the products to make the tortillas and other food in the same city where she has her stall. The loan that she is requesting from Fundacion Campo is two buy two sacks of corn that cost $38.00 each, a bag of beans that costs $16.00, a gallon of oil, sugar coffee and salt, and to pay back a debt she has with another institution. In this way, Ana will have enough raw materials to make delicious tortillas and other food that satisfies her clients. At the same time, she will also be able to pay back her loan because the interest rate is pretty high. 

Her dream is to build a house and buy work equipment including a refrigerator and other materials that would help her in her business.

loans.use: to buy two sacks of corn that cost $38.00 each, a sack of beans that costs $16.00, a gallon of oil, sugar, coffee, salt and to pay back debt that she has with another institution.

loans.name: Muzafaru

texts.en: Muzafaru is 25 years old with a child living in Masindi, Uganda. For five years, he has been in the motorcycle transport business. Finding customers and theft hinders his business. He now wants to diversify his business into entertainment. Building a permanent home and buying land to grow crops are his main dreams. Muzafaru intends to use the loan to buy speakers for his music system.

loans.use: to buy speakers for his music system.

loans.name: Edward

texts.en: Edward is a 23-year-old married man with two children living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He has a personal goal of educating his children up to the University level. When he got married, Edward decided to trade in produce to supplement his farming activities. His main hardship is price fluctuation and inflation while his vision is to add value to his business by buying milling machines to process food. Edward needs a loan to help him buy beans to sell.

loans.use: to buy beans to sell.

loans.name: Tamaz

texts.en:
Tamaz is 44 years old. He lives in the Akhmeta District with wife Mariam and three children (12, 10 and 7 years old). All three children go to school. Tamaz requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for his agricultural business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected all the time because of his low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

The only source of the income for the family is small-scale agricultural activities. They grow fruits and vegetables on a family-owned plot of the land and sell them at the local market. According to Credo estimations, the family belongs to the subsistence poor category.

Tamaz requested a loan from Credo to re-start livestock farming, which was stopped two years ago, because of the family’s financial problems. His loan request was approved in the frame of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provisions of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to country rural poor who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. With the loan, Tamaz will purchase calves. He will raise them and sell them after several months. The mature calves will be sold for a good price, bringing additional income to the family. With his next loan, Tamaz will purchase more calves. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva Start-up loan, will significantly increase the income of the family. Their income will double and the family members will be able to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase calves

loans.name: Leonardo

texts.en: Leonardo is from the town of San Miguel, Bohol. He is 57 years old. He grows rice on his farm and also operates a Sari-sari store. Leonardo has 10 children ages 18-30. He is asking for a loan so he can further finance the needs of his businesses. He will use the loan to buy fertilizer, pesticides and store merchandise like seasoning, toiletries and canned goods. Leonardo works hard to sustain his family. He hopes to farm on a bigger piece of land in the future.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides as well as store merchandise like seasonings, toiletries and canned goods.

loans.name: Cecarcon Group

texts.es:
Este Banco Comunal se llama “Cecarcon” está conformado por 19 emprendedores quienes se dedican a diferentes rubros, entre los cuales se encuentran; venta de sopaipillas, venta de útiles escolares, costuras, taller de mueblería, venta de empanadas, servicios entre otros. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la ciudad de Concepción.
Karina integrante del grupo del Banco Comunal, quien en la foto se encuentra sentada en primera fila ocupando el segundo lugar de derecha a izquierda, usa lentes, viste una polera blanca y encima lleva puesto una chaqueta de color negro y un pantalón del mismo color, su cabello es de color castaño oscuro y lo usa suelto.
Ella se dedica al rubro de venta de bazar ambulante, desde hace 2 meses. Comenta que trabaja de lunes a domingo y a veces los domingos, su horario lo distribuye de acuerdo a su disponibilidad.
La mercadería que va necesitando la compra en distribuidoras y bodegas donde se especializan en vender al por mayor y menor articulos y ropa para su bazar a bajo costo, por lo tanto conveniente económicamente.
Con el crédito comprará maquillaje, ropa en general, articulos para el cabello (pinches, cintillo, coles).
Una de las metas de Karina es instalar su bazar en su casa, para atender con más comodidad, ofrecer su mercadería de forma tranquila y la vez estar más cerca de sus hijos.
Karina vive junto a su esposo quien la apoya y ayuda en su negocio, y tres hijos de 10, 8 y 6 años de edad quienes se encuentran estudiando. Sus sueños a nivel personal es ser independiente en su negocio e instalarlo en su casa para generar mayores ingresos, ya que tiene la necesidad de contar con mas recursos en el hogar, por que los hijos van creciendo y al mismo tiempo crece la necesidad de darles un buen pasar.
Ella está muy agradecida y contenta de la oportunidad brindada por Fondo Esperanza, ya que le abrió una puerta laboral y le permitirá invertir en su negocio. Comenta que las capacitaciones han sido fundamentales para su negocio y también para su desarrollo personal, ya que ha aprendido a organizar y distribuir de mejor manera sus ingresos e inversiones.
Concepción, está asentada en la desembocadura del río Biobío, uno de los más grandes del país, al sur de Chile, en la región del Bíobío. Ha tenido una importante función en nuestra historia, siendo sede de importantes batallas y asentamiento relevante, especialmente durante la Guerra de Arauco, por estar en la frontera con territorio mapuche. Actualmente la ciudad posee un importante desarrollo económico y demográfico, llegando a ser considerada como uno de los núcleos urbanos, demográfico, administrativo, financiero y comercial más relevantes de Chile, después de Santiago y Valparaíso.
texts.en:
This Communal Bank is called Cecaron and is made up of 19 entrepreneurs who are dedicated to different trades, among which are: the sale of fried pastries, sale of school supplies, seamstress work, furniture shop, sale of empanadas, services and others. All of them belong to the city of Concepción.

Karina is the member of this communal bank who is found seated in the first row, second from the right in the photo, wearing glasses, a white polo shirt and a black sweater over it, and black pants. Her hair is dark chestnut and is worn loose. 

She makes a living selling various good by traveling around her area and has done this for two months. She says that she works from Monday to Sunday and at times on Sundays her schedule has to be made based on her actual availability.

The merchandise that she needs for her sales is purchased at distributors and in storerooms where they specialize in wholesale and retail for accessories and clothing. She is able to buy at low cost, being economically convenient for her. With the credit she will buy make up, clothing and hair accessories (clips, hairbands and ponytail holders).

One of Karina's goals is installing her sales at her house in order to attend to it with more ease, offer her merchandise in a tranquil setting and at the same time be closer to her children.
