Karina lives with her husband who supports and helps her in her busines, and her three children of 10, 8 and 6 years of age. Her children are all in school. Her personal dream is to be independent in her business and to install it in her house to generate greater earnings. She already is in need of more economic resources for the home because her children are growing and at the same time the need grows to give them good chances. 

She is very thankful and happy with the opportunity brought by Fondo Esperanza because it has opened for her a door to work and allows her to invest in her business. She says that the trainings have been fundamental for her business and also for her personal development. She has learned to organize and distribute her earnings and investments in a better way.

Concepcion is located at the river mouth of the Biobio River, one of the country's largest, at the south of Chile in the Biobio region. It has had an important role in Chile's history, being the home of important battles and an important settlement, especially during the Arauco War, as it is located on the border with Mapuche territory. The city currently has importantant economic and demographic development, becoming one of the most important urban areas in terms of demographics, administration, finances and trade for Chile after Santiago and Valparaíso.

loans.use: to buy make up, clothing, hair accessories (clips, hairbands and ponytail holders).

loans.name: Judith

texts.en: Judith is 23 years old and from San Miguel, Bohol. She is single but she is open to business ideas. Just five months ago, she started selling products from the Avon company. She is asking for a loan to buy cologne, body talc, perfume, and lotion accessories. She also wants to renew her passport and buy house materials. The income that she will generate will be for her family's needs like the electric bill.

loans.use: to buy cologne, body talc, perfume, lotion, accessories, and renew her passport and purchase house materials.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy  washing and bathing soaps to sell.

loans.name: Carlos Humberto

texts.es:
El joven Carlos de 25 años de edad es soltero  vive con su padre y se dedican desde hace 2 años al negocio de venta de ropa nueva. Ubicada en la comunidad de San Lorenzo al sur de Honduras, su venta es de manera ambulante en los barrios y colonias de San Lorenzo.
Carlos Esta solicitando 5,000.00 para compra de ropa interior, camisas, camisetas y calzonetas ya que se aproxima la feria del lugar y tiene varios pedidos de sus clientes. Con el apoyo de este préstamo seguirá trabajando y mejorando su negocio y su calidad de vida ya que necesita este préstamo para surtir un poco mas de mercadería.
Carlos su sueño es seguir trabajando y mejorando su negocio y construir su propia casa.
San Lorenzo, Honduras - Julio del 2012.
texts.en:
Carlos is 25 years old and single.  He lives with his father, and they have had a business of selling new clothes for two years.  It is located in the San Lorenzo community in the southern part of Honduras.

He makes his sales in an itinerant manner in the neighborhoods and settlements in San Lorenzo.

Carlos is requesting 5,000 lempiras to buy underwear, shirts, t-shirts, and swimsuits.  The area’s fair is coming, and he has various orders from his customers.  With the support of this loan he will continue working and improving his business and his quality of life.  He needs this loan to stock a little more merchandise.

Carlos’ dream is to continue working and improving his business.  He also dreams of building his own house.

San Lorenzo, Honduras – July, 2012.

loans.use: to buy underwear, t-shirts, shirts, and swimsuits for his business.

loans.name: José Elías

texts.es:
El señor José tiene 44 años de edad, es comerciante de ganado; también se dedica a la agricultura  siembra de granos básicos como maíz. A  su vez es ganadero actualmente cuenta con 3 semovientes de crianza  (vacas) esta actividad la realiza desde hace mas de 20 años. Cuenta que su familia se dedicaba ha esta actividad productiva. El cliente manifestó que esta actividad es patrimonio familiar.

El ganado lo compra en los tiangues aledaños a la zona que se encuentran en la ciudad, ha una distancia del Cantón a la ciudad de 4 kilómetros, cuando se compran en este tiangue los semovientes son trasladados por José en camión.

El préstamo será invertido en la comprar tres vacas para la crianza y cinco quintales de concentrado para el ganado. Al comprar tres vacas para la crianza y posterior comercialización podrá incrementar las ventas mensuales que realiza y tendrá más efectivo para poder comprar y vender.

Tendrá mas ganancias con relación a las que tiene actualmente y los niveles de utilidad incrementaran 
  
El señor José desea construir o mejorar la vivienda en donde reside, ya que donde él vive es de adobe y repellada;  pero con la lluvia este repello se esta deteriorando;  por esta razón quiere construirla de ladrillo.
texts.en:
Sr. José is 44 years old. He is a cattle merchant as well as a farmer, who cultivates basic grains such as maize. Currently he is raising three cows and has had this business for more than 20 years. His family is also involved in this activity, which is a family business.

He buys cattle in market areas surrounding the city and there is a distance of 4 kilometers from his canton to the city. Therefore when he buys livestock in these markets he transports them in his truck.

José will invest the loan in the purchase of three cows to raise along with five 100-lb bags of feed for his cattle. Upon buying three cows to raise and later market, he will be able to increase his monthly sales and will have more cash for buying and selling. He will have more income relative to what he has now and his profit margin will increase.

He wants to build or improve his house because his current residence is made of adobe and plaster, however with the rain the plaster is deteriorating; therefore he wants to rebuild with bricks.

.

loans.use: to purchase three cows to raise and five 100-lb bags of feed for his cattle.

loans.name: Bonanza Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “BONANZA” iniciará el ciclo primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Villa Exaltación, está compuesta por nueve integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Sandra es la Secretaria. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: chiflera, costura y venta de ropa, costura de chamarras, comerciante y venta de blusas, cosmetología, artesanía en tejido en lana a mano y a máquina, almacén de licores, comerciante de pantalones.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Sandra es una integrante, ella indica que hace un año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una amiga que es socias de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tiende licores, ella nos cuenta que hace varios años trabajo en una tienda de licores desde ahí trabaja en ese rubro, posteriormente decidió abrir su propia tienda y ser independiente. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de licores) que comprará de las empresas distribuidoras y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella es casada y tiene un hijo.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la institución porque confían en la palabra de una mujer.

En la fotografía no se encuentra la señora Maria Elene ya que se encontraba en consulta médica
texts.en:
The A.C. “Bonanza” group is made up of nine members and started its first cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Villa Exaltación chapter.  It is run by a board of directors and Sandra is the secretary.  There are various businesses that the members have such as:natural healing, sewing and clothing sales, making jackets, sales of blouses, cosmetology, hand and machine knitted typical items of wool, a liquor store, and pants sales.

The loan that the they will take out will be for their small businesses where Sandra is a member.  She tells us that it was a year ago when a friend who is a member invited her to join.  Currently she has a liquor store.  She says that some years ago she worked in a liquor store and since then has continued in this area.  Later she decided to open her own store and to be independent.

She will use the loan to increase her capital (purchasing liquors) and will buy from one of distributors and then sell it in her store.  This type of work allows her to generate income to support her family as much as possible.  She is married and has a son.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer she tells us that she likes the institution because they believe in women.

Maria Elena is not found in the photograph because she had a doctor’s appointment.

loans.use: to buy liquor for her store

loans.name: René Antonio

texts.es:
Don René  tiene 63 años de edad, tiene cinco hijos. Es una persona trabajadora que se dedica a la agricultura desde hace 30 años. Fueron sus padres quienes le enseñaron, también le ayudo mucho que desde pequeño vivió en una hacienda. Comenzó a realizar trabajos de ordeño de vacas y agrícolas. Toda su vida a trabajo en el campo y con ganado; de esa forma ha logrado obtener lo que actualmente posee. 

Los productos que necesita los compra en un municipio, para llegar a ese lugar camina a pie unos dos kilómetros, luego aborda un vehiculo que lo conduce al punto de autobuses que recorre durante cuarenta y cinco minutos para llegar a su destino.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar cuatro sacos de semilla, tres sacos de fertilizantes para cultivar maíz; un quintal de un abono especial para su cultivo de papaya. Con la inversión ahorrara ya que dispondrá de maíz que esta comprando actualmente. Él desea cultivar 7,000 metros cuadrados más de papaya, pues tiene un pozo y eso le facilita sus cultivos y así contar con mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
René is 63 years old, he has five children and he is an hard-working man who has been a farmer for 30 years. He has learned the job from his parents, and the fact that he has lived in a farm since he was young has also been of help. He has worked in the country and with cattle all his life, staring by milking cows and doing some farm work; through this mean he has succeeded in earning everything eh now possesses.

He buys the products he needs in a municipality, reaching it on foot and walking for a few kilometers; he then gets on a vehicle that brings him to a bus station where he gets on a bus that takes him to his destination in forty-five minutes.

The loan he is requesting to Fundación Campo will be used to buy four sacks of seeds, three sacks of fertilizers for his corn crops and one quintal (1 quintal = 46 kg) of special manure for his papaya crops. Thanks to the purchase of corn her will make with this loan he will succeed in saving some money, and he wants to plant papaya on a surface of 7,000 square meters, as he owns a well that will make it easier to work on his crops. Through these means he will succeed in gaining a better income to provide for his family.

loans.use: To buy four sacks of seeds, three sacks of fertilizers and one quintal of special manure.

loans.name: Godfrey

texts.en:
Godfrey is a 49-year-old married with seven children living in Masindi, Uganda. Good hotel facilities in his town are a major challenge, so Godfrey felt that if he ventured into the business he would reap a lot of profits to help him support his big family.

He has been in the business for three years and it’s very lucrative, despite challenges in the high cost of utilities such as water and electricity. Godfrey intends to use the loan to buy a water tank for his hotel.

loans.use: to buy a water tank for his hotel.

loans.name: Juan Alejandro

texts.es:
El señor Juan Alejandro es casado, tiene 32 años de edad, curso el primer año de educación primaria, tiene 3 hijos los cuales están estudiando, se dedica ala tejeduría, iniciando su negocio como trabajador y hasta el momento lleva 11 años de experiencia, recibe el apoyo de su esposa quien se dedica al tricotado de hilos.

Solicita un préstamo para utilizarlo para capital en la compra de hilos ya que es un insumo principal en la realización de su trabajo, espera en el futuro tener un capital amplio.
texts.en:
Sr. Juan Alejandro is married, 33 years old and finished the first year of primary school. He has three children, all of whom are in school. He is a weaver and started his business as a worker and has had 11 years of experience so far. He has the support of his wife, who dedicates herself to knitting yarn.

He is requesting a loan to use as capital in the purchase of thread, because it is the main material used in his work. He hopes to have ample capital in the future.

loans.use: to buy thread for weaving.

loans.name: Dúo Esperanza De Vida Group

texts.es:
Dúo Esperanza de Vida.
Este Dúo está integrado por Edgar él se dedica a la agricultura desde ya hace años, (Rábano ejote, tomate etc. ) desde muy pequeño le enseñaron a cultivar es por eso que no le ha costado mucho en la siembra, últimamente le ha sido difícil ya que el cambio climático afecto su siembra y tubo que regarlo ya que varios días no llovió y tubo que regar su siembra y eso le ha salido muy caro, está solicitando este crédito para la compra de semillas y abono para su siembra y también para pagar servicios de riego. Espera que Kiva le pueda ayudar con el crédito solicitado.
texts.en:
Edgar is a member of the communal bank Dúo Esperanza de Vida.  He has worked as a farmer for years, growing radishes, green beans, tomatoes and other crops.  He learned to grow these crops when he was a young child, so he has a great deal of facility in this area.  Lately it has been difficult since climate change has affected his crops, and he has had to water them since at times it does not rain for days.  This has been very costly for him. 

He is seeking this loan in order to buy seeds and fertilizer for the planting season and also to pay for watering services.  He hopes that Kiva will be able to help him to obtain the funds he is seeking.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer for the planting season and also to pay for watering services.

loans.name: Valle Del Sol Group

texts.es:
Este Banco Comunal se llama “Valle del Sol” está conformado por 18 emprendedores quienes se dedican a diferentes rubros, entre los cuales se encuentran; venta de ropa, manualidades, marroquinería, confección, tejidos, servicios entre otros. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la ciudad de Concepción.
Rosa integrante del grupo del Banco Comunal, quien en la foto se encuentra de pie hacia el fono delante de los globos ocupando el cuarto lugar de izquierda a derecha, viste de color negro su cabello es de color oscuro, largo y lo usa suelto.
Ella se dedica al rubro  de bazar paquetería donde vende lanas, cierres, telas, desde hace 4 meses. Comenta que trabaja en su casa de lunes a sábado de 10ºº hasta las 20ºº horas, su madre también trabaja con ella.
La mercadería e insumos que va necesitando los compra en textiles de lana, paqueterías, locales donde encuentra encajes (tejido ornamental y transparente que se hace a mano y se adorna con bordados).
Con el crédito comprará telas, blondas y lanas.
Una de las metas de Rosa es ampliar su local con más variedad de lanas y realizar más estampados y que sus maquinas de estampado y bordado tengan un buen espacio, para generar mayores ingresos.
Rosa vive junto a su esposo y dos hijos de 15 y 2 años de edad. Sus sueños a nivel laboral y familiar son tener un taller grande para su madre, y vender lanas de todas las marcas y colores.
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida de la oportunidad brindada por Fondo Esperanza, ya que el crédito le permitirá invertir en su negocio. Ademas se siente cómoda con el grupo del Banco Comunal del cual forma parte, lo cual la motiva a seguir participando en la institución. Comenta además que las capacitaciones impartidas en las reuniones le han servido para invertir mejor en su negocio.
Concepción, está asentada en la desembocadura del río Biobío, uno de los más grandes del país, al sur de Chile, en la región del Bíobío. Ha tenido una importante función en nuestra historia, siendo sede de importantes batallas y asentamiento relevante, especialmente durante la Guerra de Arauco, por estar en la frontera con territorio mapuche. Actualmente la ciudad posee un importante desarrollo económico y demográfico, llegando a ser considerada como uno de los núcleos urbanos, demográfico, administrativo, financiero y comercial más relevantes de Chile, después de Santiago y Valparaíso.
texts.en:
This communal bank, Valle del Sol, is made up of 18 entrepreneurs who work in various areas, including clothing sales, handicrafts, leather goods, tailoring, textiles, and services, among others.  All of them are from the city of Concepción.

Rosa is a member of the communal bank group.  In the photo she's standing in the back in front of the balloons, in the fourth place from the left.  She's wearing black and has long, dark hair that she wears loose.

She has worked for four months in the area of gifts, selling wool, clasps, and fabric.  She says she works in her home Monday through Saturday from 10 a.m. until 8 p.m.  Her mother also works with her.  She buys the merchandise and supplies she needs in wool fabrics in gift shops, places where she finds lace (an ornamental and transparent fabric that is handmade and decorated with embroidery).

With the loan she will buy fabric, lace, and wool.

One of Rosa's goals is to expand her place with a greater variety of wool, to do more embossing, and for her embossing and embroidery machines to have a lot of space, so she can generate more income.

Rosa lives with her husband and two children, 15 and 2.  Her dreams for her job and her family are to have a big workshop for her mother and to sell all brands and colors of wool.

She's very happy about and grateful for the opportunity offered by Fondo Esperanza, because the loan will allow her to invest in her business.  In addition, she's comfortable with her communal bank group, which motivates her to continue contributing to the institution.  She also comments that the trainings given in the meetings have helped her invest better in her business.

Concepción is located at the mouth of the Biobío River, one of the largest rivers in the country, in the south of Chile in the Biobío region. It has had an important role in our history, being the site of important battles and a notable settlement, especially during the Arauco War, because it's on the border of Mapuche territory. Currently the city has important economic and demographic development and is coming to be considered one of the most notable urban, demographic, administrative, financial, and commercial centers of Chile, after Santiago and Valparaíso.

loans.use: to buy fabric, lace, and wool

loans.name: Shahzadi

texts.en:
Shahzadi, a 48-year-old married woman, has been making shoes for the last 10 years, a business she started to help support her family, which consists of six children. With the support of the Kashf Foundation, she initiated and has gradually improved her enterprise.

Shahzadi needs to earn more profits to improve her family's standard of living and so is requesting a loan of Rs. 20,000 to buy raw materials such as leather and plastic to meet increasing customer demand. She wishes to apply her earned profits to her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy raw materials such as leather and plastic.

loans.name: Cornelio

texts.en:
Cornelio is 49 years old and from Bien Unido, Bohol. Cornelio is married with four children ages 15, 18, 23 and 26.  He relies on fishing to meet his family's needs. He is asking for a loan to buy a fishing net and rice for his family's consumption. Cornelio is optimistic in his livelihood. With perseverance and determination, he knows that he will be successful. He works hard for his children's future, supporting their education. 

In the future, he hopes to run a sustainable business and to have other business options.

loans.use: to buy a fishing net and rice for his family.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a moto-taxi.

loans.name: Lilivit

texts.en:
Lilivit is a 47-year-old married woman and mother of nine young children. She lives in Bohol, Philippines where she has operated a hog-raising business for more than five years. 
Lilivit works hard to support her husband in meeting the needs of the family. She is in need of additional capital for her hog-raising business. Lilivit is asking for a loan of 3000 PHP to buy feed for the hogs.
In the future, Lilivit wants to expand her business in order to generate more income.

loans.use: to buy feed for her hogs.

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en: Jackson used a previous loan to buy sugar and cooking oil to sell. He is a 27-year old married man with one child living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He has a retail shop which he started seven years ago. He started with capital worth 600,000 shillings and now it's worth two million. His main hardship is inadequate capital to purchase stock. His dream is educating his child and buying land to grow crops. Jackson needs this loan to buy sugar and cooking oil to sell.

loans.use: to buy sugar and cooking oil to sell.

loans.name: Ma. Amelyn

texts.en:
Ma.Amelyn, a merchant who runs a sari-sari or convenience store in Bohol, Philippines, has been in business for several years now. She needs additional capital for the store, and so is requesting a loan worth PHP 8000 to buy more stocks to sell such as noodles, canned goods, etc. She believes that this loan could be a great help in improving her enterprise.

In the future, Ma.Amelyn wants to reinvest profits in the store because it is profitable.

loans.use: to buy more stocks to sell in her store such as noodles, canned goods, etc.

loans.name: Duo Consuelo De Dios Group

texts.es: Dúo Consuelo de Dios. En este dúo se integra doña Aura Marina, ella es originaria de San Juan Comalapa, ella tiene 3 hijos y solo uno de ellos está estudiando ya que es viuda y con sus esfuerzos solo puede darle estudio a uno, pero no se da por vencida ya que no pierde la esperanza de mandar a sus otros hijos a estudiar, ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de güipiles y por esa razón está solicitando este crédito para la compra de materia prima para la elaboración de güipiles, espera que Kiva le pueda ayudar con el crédito solicitado ya que de esta manera ella podrá seguir luchando y cumplir sus sueños.
texts.en:
Aura Marina is a member of the communal bank Dúo Consuelo de Dios.  She is a native of San Juan Comalapa.  She has three children, only one of whom is in school.  This is due to the fact that Aura Marina is a widow and through her efforts she is only able to afford an education for one child.  However, she has not given up and still hopes to be able to send her other children to school.

She makes and sells traditional Guatemalan clothing. She is seeking a loan so she can purchase materials to make her finished products.  She hopes that Kiva can help her obtain these funds so that she will be able to continue fighting and realize her dreams.

loans.use: to buy material to make traditional Guatemalan clothing.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet, a 39-year-old single mother of five living in Masindi Uganda, started selling rice 11 years ago to support her family. Seasonal weather and inadequate capital hinders her business.

Janet intends to use the loan to buy more rice to sell. Her dreams are to educate children, move her business to a more permanent location and begin selling wholesale.

loans.use: to buy rice to sell.

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.fr: Jacqueline est une  femme mariée de 34 ans, mère de 5 enfants dont 3 vont encore à l'école. Elle a un restaurant qu'elle gère depuis 3ans déjà dans un quartier de la capitale. Elle achète le plus souvent les aliments de son restaurant en détail(la viande et le poisson en gros ainsi que le riz, huile...), elle sollicite ce crédit pour augmenter le stock de ces aliments (en gros)ce qui lui permettra non seulement de satisfaire sa clientèle déjà grandissante, mais aussi de réaliser un bénéfice plus élévé qui l'aidera à subvenir à certains besoins quotidiens de sa famille et aussi d'agrandir son restaurant avec le temps.
texts.en:
Jacqueline is a 34-year-old married woman and the mother of five children, three of which still are still in school. She owns a restaurant in one of the capital city’s neighborhoods, and been managing it for three years already. Most often, she purchases food for her restaurant at retail, but gets her meat, fish, rice, and oil wholesale.
She is requesting a loan to increase her stock of these wholesale foods, which will allow her not only to satisfy her already-growing clientele, but also to make a higher profit, which will help her take care of some of her family’s daily needs, and in time to expand her restaurant.

loans.use: to buy wholesale meat, fish, rice, and oil

loans.name: Damali

texts.en:
Damali is a 30-year-old married woman with two children living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. She is a primary teacher and has been in service for two years. She has no other income-generating activity but wants to get a loan and buy land for growing crops. 

She faces a hardship of low salary and wishes to educate her children in good schools. The purpose of the loan is to buy land for building and growing crops for her family.

loans.use: to buy land for growing crops.

loans.name: Stanley

texts.en:
Stanley is a 29-year-old mixed crop farmer. He is married to Ruth, with whom he works on the farm, and they are blessed with one child. He has been in the farming business for the past two years with the monthly income of KES 4,000, which he uses to support his family. 

He is applying for his first loan term with KADET after being introduced by an existing KADET customer. Stanley will use the loan to purchase seedlings and fertilizer for his farm. With the anticipated profit from the business, he will educate his children. 

His dreams are to export his farm produce and improve the family's living standard.

loans.use: to purchase seedlings and fertilizer for his farm.

loans.name: Bernadette

texts.fr: Bernadette est une femme de 36 ans , marièe et mére de 03 enfants dont l'âge varie entre 16 et 12 ans. Elle est commerçante dans un quartier de la capitale depuis un an oû elle tient un bar. son acceil chaleureux, ses bonnes relations entretenuent avec son voisinage lui ont valu en tré peu de temps une tré grande clientéle qu' elle n'arrive plus à fidéliser à cause de la pétitesse de son capita.c' est pour cela qu'elle sollicite donc ce credit pour augmenter son stock ( acheter la biére , le vin). elle espre ainsi pouvoir augmenter sa marge bénéficiaire et ainsi pouvoir agrandir sa structure et réinvestire le reste pour les besoins de sa famille
texts.en:
Bernadette is a 36-year-old woman; she is married and the mother of three children, whose ages vary between 12 and 16 years. She has been running a bar in one of the capital city’s neighborhoods for a year. Her welcoming service and her good relations with her neighbors have very quickly earned her a very large clientele, but she does not manage to retain it because of her small capital.
For this reason, she is requesting a loan to increase her stock through the purchase of beer and wine. She hopes to increase her profit so as to expand her location and to reinvest the rest to meet her family’s needs.

loans.use: to increase her stock by purchasing beer and wine.

loans.name: Abahuje/mgnz Group

texts.fr:
André fait partie du groupe Abahuje/mgnz . Le nom du groupe signifie « unité». Il a 36 ans, il est marie avec 5enfants de 14 ans à 6 ans, dont. Il a 3 personnes dans son charge autre que ses enfants. Son niveau d’éducation est de 6 ans de Primaire.

André est agriculteur de riz. C’est son troisième cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des engrais chimique et payer la main d’œuvre pour son agriculture de riz.

Pour accroitre son agriculture de riz, il planifie de sollicite d’autre crédits. Dans les prochaines années, il voudrait agrandir ces  champs de riz pour satisfaire les marchés. Avec les profits, il prévoit de payer les frais académique de ses enfants et  payer les frais  médicaux pour sa famille.
texts.en:
André belongs to group Abahuje/mgnz. The group’s name means “unity." He is 36 years old, married, and has five children between the ages of six and fourteen. He also supports three other people in addition to his children. He has six years of primary school education.

André farms rice. This is his third loan cycle with ACB. He is going to use his credit to purchase chemical fertilizer and to pay workers to help farm his rice.

To increase his rice farm, he is planning on requesting further loans. In the coming years, he would like to expand these rice fields to meet market demand. With the profit, he is planning on paying for his children’s school expenses and for his family’s medical care.

loans.use: to buy chemical fertilizer and to pay workers for farming his rice.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a 33 year old business man. He is married to Eunice, who is a farmer, and they are blessed with two children. He has been running a retail shop for the past four years, earning a monthly income of KES 20,000, which he uses to support his family. 

Joseph is applying for his first loan with KADET after being introduced to the organization by a staff member. He will use the loan to purchase more sugar, rice and maize meal to sell. He will use the anticipated profit from the business to help educate his children. 

His dreams are to open a supermarket and improve his family’s standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase more sugar, rice and maize meal to sell

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is now 50 years old and still married to Ciriaka. Their two children are also well and still in school.  His farming business has grown and he now earns a monthly income of KES 7,000, which he uses to support his family.

Patrick is applying for his second loan with KADET, after repaying the previous loan successfully. He will use the new loan to buy seedlings and fertilizer for his farm. He will use the anticipated profit from the business to help educate his children. 

His dream is to venture into pig rearing.

loans.use: To buy seedlings and fertilizer for his farm

loans.name: Habiba

texts.en: Habiba is a visionary woman who has been selling sunflower products for several years. She has been going door to door, but she now wants to establish a permanent location for her business, and to expand it to include the sale of fried potatoes. She is therefore requesting a loan so as to construct a stall. Habiba says that the place she wants to set up her stall is strategically located, and she anticipates attracting numerous customers.

loans.use: to construct a permanent stall for her business

loans.name: Good Results Group

texts.en:
William, a 29-year-old married father of three children, has been selling engine oil for 14 years now. He is also a taxi driver. With this loan he wants to buy more stocks of oil to enable him to meet customer demand. He believes the loan will enable him to save more income to support his children in school.

William is member of the group called Good Results Trust Group. Members agree to guarantee each other's loan repayment.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of oil to resell.

loans.name: Kokou

texts.fr: Kokou est un revendeur de charbon de bois et de maïs depuis 2010. Âgé de 53 ans, Il est marié et entretien cette activité localisée dans son domicile. Il sollicite pour la première fois un crédit à WAGES pour acheter des sacs de maïs et de charbon de bois  dans l’optique de devenir grossiste mais aussi d’assurer les études et  l’épanouissement de ses trois enfants dont deux déjà scolarisés.
texts.en:
Kokou has been retailing charcoal and corn since 2010. At 53 years old, he is married, and he conducts his local business from his house.
He is requesting a loan from WAGES for the first time, to purchase bags of corn and charcoal; his objective is to become a wholesaler. He also wants to make sure that his three children, two of whom already go to school, can study and thrive.

loans.use: to buy bags of charcoal and corn.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose used the previous loan to to buy rice, sugar and salt to sell. She is a 55-year-old married woman living in a mud wattled dwelling in Kamwenge, Uganda. She owns a retail shop business that she started 7 years ago. She started with capital worth 800,000 shillings and made profits, from which she has managed to buy a new motorcycle and re-invest in her business. 

In spite of her progress, Rose is faced with a challenge of price fluctuations, inflation and customers not paying on time. Her dream is to educate her children, build a permanent home and to diversify her business to include ready made food. Rose intends to use the loan to buy beans, groundnuts, peas and mushrooms to sell.

loans.use: to buy beans, groundnuts, peas and mushrooms to sell.

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en: Wilson is a 32 year old married man living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. He has two children. Wilson is a driver and has been in service for eleven years. With his salary he has been able to pay school fees for his siblings and start a restaurant to support his family. His major hardships are price fluctuations, customers not paying on time and high fuel costs. Wilson confided in us that he would move away from the transport sector and venture into farming if he had enough capital, given the high risks of accidents on the road. He is requesting for a loan to buy land for farming.

loans.use: to buy land for farming.

loans.name: Thomas

texts.en:
Thomas is a forty five year old hardworking man who has six children. He lives in Kamwenge, Uganda. He has personal goals of educating his children and building a permanent home. He is currently living in a house made out of reeds. 

Thomas operates a retail shop. He started with 500,000 shillings and currently, his business is worth 2,000,000 shillings. His main hardships are price fluctuation and inadequate capital to meet the increasing demands. Thomas would like to diversify into farming by venturing into mechanized agriculture and owning a wholesale shop. He intends to use the loan to  buy soap, sugar and other items to sell.

loans.use: to buy soap, sugar and other items to sell.

loans.name: Didas

texts.en: Didas is a thirty six year old married man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He has three children. Didas has a personal goal of educating his children up to the university level. He has a maize milling business that he has operated for a year now and, with the proceeds, he has been able to pay school fees for his children and set up a business for his wife. His business is challenged by inefficient supply of electricity and lack of skilled labor. However he has a vision of expanding his business to new markets and hiring employees to help him in processing. Didas intends to by maize which he will grind into maize flour to sell.

loans.use: to buy maize to sell.

loans.name: Ambrose

texts.en: Ambrose is a thirty three year old married man with a child living in Kamwenge, Uganda. After realizing the ready market of sorghum, he decided to trade in cereal and has since reaped tangible benefits. He started the business with 1,000,000 shillings and now has 3,500,000 shillings as working capital. His main hardships are price fluctuation and unpredictable seasonal weather. Ambrose has a vision of buying land and growing sorghum on a large scale. He is requesting for a loan to buy sorghum to sell.

loans.use: to buy sorghum to sell.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali, 52 years old married man, he is a father for 8 sons and daughters. He owns a shop that sells cars’ spare parts and cars’ oil. He has applied to this loan to expand his business and add selling more material and stuff that is needed for any car.

loans.use: to sell more goods and spare car parts

loans.name: Abondance 2 Group

texts.en:
Felicite, a 45-year-old single mother of five children ranging in age from 11 to 27 years, also cares for her elderly mother. Felicite, who is representing the Abondance 2 group, owns a small grocery stand that has been in operation for three years. She will use this loan to buy various food products to restock her stand. Her business strategy is to give friendly and helpful customer service, and to offer a wide variety of items in her stand.

Felicite has received one previous loan from HOPE Congo, Kiva’s partner. She has a good repayment record and in the future would like to travel out of Brazzaville to buy clothes to sell in her store.

loans.use: to pay for various food products such as sardines, flour, and milk.

loans.name: Abondance 1 Group

texts.en:
Rodolphe, age 38, is married with two children, ages 2 and 5 years old. He currently sends one child to attend school. 

Rodolphe is representing the Abondance 1 group. He owns and operates a small shop where he sells various food and drink items. He has had this business for three years. 

He plans to use the loan to buy imported drinks in bulk. The loan allows him to buy his merchandise in bulk, and because of this he receives a lower cost per item. His business strategy is to open very early and close very late. 

Rodolphe has received one previous loan from HOPE Congo, Kiva’s partner. He has a good repayment record.

loans.use: to pay for a bulk order of imported drinks.

loans.name: Evolution 3 (#1) Group

texts.en: Gustave, age 56, is married with six children, ages 14 to 35 years old. He is representing the Evolution 3 (#1) group. Gustave has a small business selling pharmaceutical products. He has been operating this business for over 20 years! He has gained valuable experience and knowledge about his products over the years. He will use the loan to buy more medicines for his shop. Gustave has received three previous loans from HOPE Congo, Kiva’s partner. He has a good repayment record. He hopes to travel abroad to buy products for his business and to find different varieties of medicines at a cheaper price.

loans.use: to pay for medicine.

loans.name: Evolution 3 (#2) Group

texts.en: Jean, age 38, is a single father of two children, ages 5 and 8. He also takes care of his elderly mother. Jean is representing the Evolution 3 (#2) group. He has a small pharmacy where he sells a variety of medicines. He has owned this business for four years. He will use the loan to buy more medicines to stock his shop. His business strategy is to sell his medicines in an area where many of his clients live and near a hospital. Jean has received three previous loans from HOPE Congo, Kiva’s partner. He has a good repayment record. He wants to expand his business and open a clinic in his community.

loans.use: to buy medicines for his pharmacy

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy wefts and yarn

loans.name: Chhoeurn

texts.en:
Chhoeurn is a farmer living in Prey Chor district, Kompong Cham province. She is married with four children who are currently attending local schools with different levels. 

Farming rice is what she is doing at the moment alongside her spouse to generate the main source of the family’s income. Thanks to their business, they can afford to send all their to school and provide the family with basic necessities. Their children also help them in the business when they are free from school.

With the requested loan, Chhoeurn plans to purchase farm supplies such as fertilizers and pesticides, which will ensure a good growth of her rice crop and secure it from the challenge of insects. She believes that through the help of the loan and her sacrifices, her rice farming business will gradually improve and she will enjoy a fruitful harvest in this coming season.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies such as fertilizers and pesticides.
